review_content: Light pale yellow pour, thin white head.  Not much flavor or body here, with a medium finish.

Bottle from Lupe Pintos. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Fine carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of straw and honey. Flavour of sweet malt and cereal. Medium body with a slick mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Sweet and strong. It tastes like an imperial pilsner.

A golden color with a white head. The aroma contains some hay, caramel, and biscuit. The flavor is rather crisp with some malt present. Some hay, lemon, biscuit, and a hint of caramel. Overall I prefer the darker Paulaner and the darker ofests in general but this is a solid refreshing beer. Pretty good stuff

0,5l bottle from bavarian store, drinking it on14/07/2021 BB 03 2022 Pours clear gold with a thin creamy white foam on top, some lacing. Aroma of malt and bread, grains, biscuit, hay and slightly hoppy. Taste is quite sweet with rich malt and grains notes, some honey and a nice grassy hops finish that I don't mind and helps balancing. Medium body and slightly oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Strong enough without overdoing it at 6% abv. It's alright and a pretty good lager overall, enjoying it more than the Helles.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_

Bottle, 500ml. Pours clear yellow with a medium tall, foamy white head. Mouth feel is crisp with medium carbonation and a light body. Taste is mildly sweet and gently bitter with very light acidity. Flavors of honey, pale malt, mild hops, lemon. Simple and easy drinking. Good for the style.
Old rating from 2010 - 500ml bottle, pours golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of lemon, flora, hay, cereal, honey, grain, bread & hops. Medium body. Light bitter finish

can.  Poured clear gold with a bleach white head. Sweet hayish aroma. Light-medium bodied, crisp carbonation, clean dry mouthfeel. Flavour of sweet crackery malt, some citrus zest with dry herbal hops.

0,5 can from local store.

Pours pale golden color with a short, low head.
Strong intensive taste. Well carbonated. Sweet notes. Pretty bitter. I'm not fan of this, but overall decent beer when it comes to quality.

Ne svidja mi se, previše intenzivan (jak) ukus.

Whole box of cans from Paulaner official online store.
Opaque golden body and crispy head; strong note of barley bitterness and hint note of fried sugar. It's a very pure and straight beer.

Gold with an immediately fading white head. Aroma is a mix of cereals and honey. Taste is mildly bitter with honey sweet undertones. Grainy bitterness at the end and faint alcohol. Body to the full side of medium, with a rich, creamy feel, and balanced carbonation, which is probably the best thing going here. Okay.

Simple, pure tasting Bavarian beer, what more do you want and 6% proof to go with it.

Buy this one!
Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma of wood, slightly oaky, scotch notes. Taste has some bread notes, rye, resinous. Palate has grain, slightly oily. Weird marzen.

30cl bottle pours a clear golden color with average white head and some lacing.  Aroma has wheat bread, crackers,  other grains, and a touch of honey.  Taste is slightly sweet with bitterness in the finish.  Body is medium with average carbonation.  This is more substantial than your typical Oktoberfest and not bad at all.

I am not a big fan of lagers (except Bocks) as they are usually flat. However, I bought some Oktoberfest beer from Lowenbrau, Spaten and Paulaner and this one is way better than the others.
The can is bitter and the sweetness coming from the malt is low, whereas the bottle is balanced. The hops seems to be more "flowery" and complex and sweetness was more present.
Overall this is the best Oktoberfest Bier I tried and it's a tasty beer, especially the bottled one.

BB 30/06/2021
Light pale yellow pour, thin white head.  Not much flavor or body here, with a medium finish.

Bottle from Lupe Pintos. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Fine carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of straw and honey. Flavour of sweet malt and cereal. Medium body with a slick mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Sweet and strong. It tastes like an imperial pilsner.

A golden color with a white head. The aroma contains some hay, caramel, and biscuit. The flavor is rather crisp with some malt present. Some hay, lemon, biscuit, and a hint of caramel. Overall I prefer the darker Paulaner and the darker ofests in general but…

0,5l bottle from bavarian store, drinking it on14/07/2021 BB 03 2022 Pours clear gold with a thin creamy white foam on top, some lacing. Aroma of malt and bread, grains, biscuit, hay and slightly hoppy. Taste is quite sweet with rich malt and grains notes,…
