Instagram/czgr_

Bottle, 500ml. Pours clear yellow with a medium tall, foamy white head. Mouth feel is crisp with medium carbonation and a light body. Taste is mildly sweet and gently bitter with very light acidity. Flavors of honey, pale malt, mild hops, lemon. Simple and easy…
Old rating from 2010 - 500ml bottle, pours golden with a white head. Aromas & tastes of lemon, flora, hay, cereal, honey, grain, bread & hops. Medium body. Light bitter finish

can.  Poured clear gold with a bleach white head. Sweet hayish aroma. Light-medium bodied, crisp carbonation, clean dry mouthfeel. Flavour of sweet crackery malt, some citrus zest with dry herbal hops.
0,5 can from local store. Pours pale golden color with a short, low head.…

Whole box of cans from Paulaner official online store.
Opaque golden body and crispy head; strong note of barley bitterness and hint note of fried sugar. It's a very pure and straight beer.

Gold with an immediately fading white head. Aroma is a mix of cereals and honey. Taste is mildly bitter with honey sweet undertones. Grainy bitterness at the end and faint alcohol. Body to the full side of medium, with a rich, creamy feel, and balanced…
Simple, pure tasting Bavarian beer, what more do you want and 6% proof to go with it.…
Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma of wood, slightly oaky, scotch notes. Taste has some bread notes, rye, resinous. Palate has grain, slightly oily. Weird marzen.

30cl bottle pours a clear golden color with average white head and some lacing. Aroma has wheat bread, crackers, other grains, and a touch of honey. Taste is slightly sweet with bitterness in the finish. Body is medium with average carbonation. This is more…
I am not a big fan of lagers (except Bocks) as they are usually flat. However, I bought some Oktoberfest beer from Lowenbrau, Spaten and Paulaner and this one is way better than the others.…
12 oz bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Malt and graham cracker smells. Nice bready flavors with a dry mouthfeel, medium body. Nice fest.
Pale golden with low head. Malty aroma. Malty taste with som earth tones. Balanced bitterness.

Una delle tante birra da Oktoberfest! Il profumo è maltato e il colore è un giallo dorato molto limpido con una schiuma molto fine e poco persistente. Il gusto è delicato e ben bilanciato tra malto e luppolo con un finale leggermente amaro, infine il corpo è leggero.

Bonne bière, belle couleur, belle mousse. 
Bu en bouteille de 50cl. Une suffit car légèrement écoeurante.

So to conclude, this Oktoberfest Lager balances sweet malts with a mild bitterness while the hops provide incredibly fresh notes of earth. For that reason this Lager will stand out above others and may take the edge if you are after a refreshing beverage with a higher ABV. Unfortunately the head size, retention, and lack of lacing bring the points back down making it a good, but not great Beer.

Read the full review here: www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2020/10/09/oktoberfest-dual-review

Bottle from Beers Of Europe.
Pours a clear golden colour with a medium sized throthy white head. Aromas of grains, hay, grass, straw, white bread and a little honey. Taste is the same notes as the aroma with hints of floral. Fullish body, slightly oily mouthfeel with a grassy hop finish. Crisp and fresh. Nice Oktoberfest.

In toast of the cancelled Wiesn Oktoberfest in München this year a good few litres of this in its own krug did the trick. Bright, medium gold body with good carbonation keeping a two inch, snow-white cloud atop leaving a solid, messy lace. Grainy, sweet granola nose with licks of palest honey, lemon balm, rye bread and hay bales. On the palate it is light, softly effervescent and clean in the finish. Driven by malt it is very similar to the nose in its granola sweetness ending with barnyard, haybale dryness. Softly peppery. Earthy. Mild nuttiness. Good length of grainy malt. Alcohol is evident. Body is lean, well attenuated but has a good presence. Drinks with alarming ease, but does fill the stomach so I can't imagine a good afternoon on the Wiesn green downing this one. One was enough. Not your most sessionable Märzen. (1.0L can, PKD 12/05/20, Aldi Cannington)
On tap at Das.  Amber pour with a white head. Malty bouquet. Heavy malt/bread note upfront with caramel backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel. About as traditional as it gets.
Pours very well and very crisp in taste. Much better than the standard Paulaner. I actually thoroughly enjoyed.

Clear,light carbonation.malty,lightly bitter.
Slightly metallic at first,but not in the end.easily drinkable.
Ticks the right boxes: strength, body, carbonation, quaffability. Decent but not astounding.

1L can at home. Pours a clear golden color with a big frothy white head. Aroma of bitter hops, malt, slight honey. Taste is moderate sweet, medium bitter with a moderate dry finish. Notes of malt, hops, slight grass, hay. Texture is oily, medium to light bodied with medium carbonation
Strong smell of hops with a hint of cinnamon. Bitter aftertaste. Very drinkable but prefer the munchen helles version.

Bouteille de 50 cl achetée chez V&B. Robe dorée limpide avec une légère mousse blanche. Arômes de malts pilsner. Texture aqueuse, carbonatation moyenne, légère. Notes florales, miel, malts. Finale légèrement amère.

7-5-7-4-14
Bottle, L21505D, eleven months before bbd. Pours clear pale yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is pilsner malts with white bread, as well as grassy hops with floral notes. Full body, with soft to carbonation. Flavour is floral hops with spicy herbal notes, as well as grainy malts with white bread and heather. Smooth, balanced and moreish.

Recht hopfig bitter, fruchtige Noten (geht Richtung Birne), florale Nuancen. Trotz Substanz und sehr handfesten 6,0 % Alk. kann das Bier durchaus als süffig bezeichnet werden. Ich halte das für eines der besten Münchner Oktoberfestbiere.

33 cl bottle sent by Paulaner for my comment, along with the "Original" Oktoberfest. Bright straw-colored pour like any Pils or Dortmunder. Foam is slightly denser, and sticks around for quite a while. Smell has light malts and a note of Noble hop. Toasty malt taste and a hop edge that's just slightly peppery. Goes down a little more lightly than the "Original." Both list the same ingredients, but no proportions, or the length of decoction. Clearly the beer to have while strolling about an Oktoberfest meadow.
0.5 can in Serbia. Golden clear a bit dark with a medium white foam. Nose: honey, malty, balsamic, floral. Mouth: sweet malty, warming sip, clean, dry, decent bitterness. Ok

From an 11.2 oz bottle.  Clear deep golden pour and a sandy head.  Nice sweet caramel toasted malt aroma and flavors. Some dry woody malt bite at the end.  Much better flavors than the domestic "fest" b eer prior.

Pale golden beer that smells of malt and subtle hops.  Dry, but more crisp and clean that leaves a slightly malty finish.  Don’t serve too cold, the malts will not come through.  This beer is too easy to down a ton for the abv’.  It should be rated much higher.
Clear golden pour. Sweet, malty nose. Very malty, grainy but also crisp tones. Not very festive, but very drinkable

A light smell of malt,  light hoppy. The small white foamy head disappears rather fast,  the body is yellow.  A light malty taste,  not much else . The body is light,  a little bit dry with a lively carbonation.
Esta es una Oktoberfest Bier con un aroma suave y muy ligeramente acaramelado. Un color dorado muy limpio. Casi no se percibe el amargor del lúpulo.
Bottle. Clear full golden color, small white head.  Slightly cereal, light floral aroma. Dry taste, medium bitterness. Malty cracker, floral, grassy aftertaste. Medium carbonation, full body.
водниста, но с % алкохол над очакваното, със златист светъл цвят, добра пяна, аромат на малц и хмелен послевкус.

Home. 50 cl bottle. BB 04/20. A thin white foam layer on a clear golden yellow beer. Aroma of somewhat malt, light sweet/yellow fruit. light honey. Taste is somewhat sweet, some yellow fruit, light malty. In aftertaste a hop bitterness is coming up. Reasonable balance.

Olor maltoso, sabor más amargo que la Paulaner Naturtrub, con un sabor hacia la mitad de lúpulo, y un poco de malta. Es seca, pasa rápido y no deja nada de regusto. Lo liviano de la cerveza ayuda a que no afecte el amargor.

Auch dieses Jahr gab es in Wiener Supermärkten dieses Bier in der charakteristischen Dose und den chinesischen Informationen auf der Rückseite. 
Es ist ein gemütliches Bier, das etwas stärker ist, aber trotz enormer Süffigkeit locker die Kehle hinunter gleitet.
Aromatisch ist es nicht allzu tief, aber gut trinkbar ist es allemal.

Illatában szinte csak az alkohol érződik. Egy kis citrom egy kis szegfű, vagy nem tudom igazán még mit lehetne belőle kiérezni. Ízében szinte ugyanez a helyzet. Nem egy itatja magát kategória. Kedvenc semmiképp sem lesz.

One of the better is Oktoberfest beers. But still has that odd quality of most that I don’t like and can’t quite identify. Konsum dresden (nov 2019)

Tried again and concur with previous rating
Ganz lecker und überraschen guter geschmack. Aus der dise deswegen keine eiteren angaben.
500ml can. Clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are bread, sweet/biscuity cereals and honey with spicy and herbal notes. Light to medium, good carbonation, smooth texture.

Color amarillo cobrizo, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma herbal y ligero cereal. Gusto a cereal, pan integral, notas de miel y amargor herbal. Cuerpo acuoso. Marzen de manual, ideal para beber a litros.

2 x 50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2020

Aroma is grainy with malt and butter. Flavour has grainy malt, butter, some grassy hops and mild menthol. Clean, somewhat crisp and malty and nicely balanced. Traditional märtzen at its best.

6%ABV.   Festbier.

Tapped out clear gold.  6°SRM. 

Nose has aromas of grain and fresh-baked bread.  There are pleasant “beery” aromas.  Clean nose with hints of DMS and diacetyl.

Mouthfeel is light with moderate carbonation.  Perfectly clean, clear, lager mouthfeel.

Palate has flavors of toast, bread crusts, toasted grain.  Overall, the malt backbone is clean grain without much else, soft, and pronounced without being full.

Hop flavors are herbal, minty, hint of wood and forest-y.

Finish is clean with a light herb-like minty bitter.

Overall, a really good style example.  Always pleasant, glad to have put this down in writing finally.  Enjoying a good Bavarian lager is like enjoying roots cuisine, it’s sometimes nice to appreciate what a well-made basic beer tastes like again.

0.5 bottle. Light wheat color, nice clean,  with small holes white head. Its aroma is not very intense, it leans more towards hops, against Bavarian malt :) Medium-bodied, sweet, bitter German base lager flavor with more alcohol. From the brewery, the Salvator is my favorite, the wheat is outstanding, this oktoberfest is not a big number, but a nice little round German large factory.
***
 Világos, búzakalász szín, szép tiszta, habja apró lyukú fehér. Illata nem túl intenzív, inkább a komló felé hajlik, a bajor maláta ellen :) Közepesen testes, édeskés, kesernyés német alap lager íz, több alkohollal. A gyártól a Salvator a kedvencem, a búzái kiemelkedőek, ez oktoberfest léttére nem nagy szám, de szép kis kerek német nagyüzemi.

On tap at the Siren's Calling, Portishead 4/10/2019. Golden in colour, with a thin white, head and moderate carbonation. A touch of floral hop, sweetish malts, some lemon fruit, giving way to a lingering, bitter finish. Fine.

Bought at BC liquor stores in 2012, $12 CAD, cellared for 7 years.
Attack: crisp bite, incoming maltiness
Mids: lvl4-sweetness, liquid barley malt
Finish: metallic, fishy astringency
Overall: basic flavour for the style, barely drinkable, the metallic fishiness is off putting.

Golden color, weak white head. 
Typical lager aroma, yeasty, malty. 
Taste is nothing special, typical lager. Medium sweet maltiness, medium hops, a balanced beer. Medium body. Average mass  lager.

From tap @ Minipivovar Richtár Jakub in Bratislava. Big, white, average retention head. Colour is pale gold, clear. Aroma is malty, sweet bready, honey touch. Taste is medium malty base, bready, bit honey, grainy, bit mettalic, decent bitterness, soft carbonation, I expected much more here.

Tasty Ocktoberfest style bier.
Not sure why this is 6.0 abv. Light gold colour. Did not sense any or very much citrus. 
I do prefer decent Vienna lagers to this hands down.
After one 1 was ready to move on 
Perhaps with some hearty food it will be better.
Very pleasant taste,on bitter side,i enjoyed in this beer,it is on a more expensive side for us in Serbia but it is worth it,atleast for me.

500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 6%. Sweetcorn and Marzen malt aroma. Smallish short-lasting head. Pure golden colour. Slight citrus hop kick to start and then it's the good old Marzen brown-bread rich malt all the way. Constrained, but in a good way. Classic-tasting Marzen, whilst being distinguishable. Can't fault Paulaner.

Bottle picked up locally (possibly REWE?) consumed at home Saturday 12th October 2019 in company of Dad, and Pauline listening to Craig Charles Funk and Soul Show on 6 Music. Pours gold superb clarity, malty with a little cereal, drinks far easier than 6%. Good but I have had better festival beers.

Poured from a bottle into a Victory 12oz tall glass. Head dissolved quickly. Decent lacing and autumn, Amber-brown hue. Refreshing and session-able.  Serves its purpose - mass consumption at a wedding. Cheers!
# 453; 9/2016. Nižší střední plnost, dobrá pitelnostd, sladové, jemně kořenité. Vcelku dobré.

7/10/2019. Tap at Grand Excelsior Hotel Munich Airport. Pours golden with a tint of orange and  a foamy white head. Aroma of sweet malt, light hops, fruit and caramel. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Oktoberfest is one of the best fests in the world and that octoberfest beer is one of the best lagers you can get out there.

Pint served in Beermerchants Tap, on draught. Clear toasted amber llooking with a large light foam head. Nose is otasted grained, cereal grains, grassy, straw, hay, slight biscuit. Taste is grassy, cereal grains, hay, straw, lovely toasted barley grains. Beautiful toasted malt character with some bitterness and sweetness. Stunningly good lager

Bottle from Fountainhall Wines Aberdeen. Lovely crystal clear gold with a tall fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet, syrupy meal. Light hay. Grassy freshness. Mild orange jelly. Soft medium body with a moderate sparkle. Light dry finish. Really drinkable although the syrup sweetness leaves it not clean enough for me.
bottle at home. this beer poured very much like their (brewery) helles. I was expect a beer like a mazen. It was malty smooth light an enjoyable beer
Sweet malt and very noticeable alcohol. Disappointed, to be honest. As if you poured vodka in a regular paulaner lager.
Bottle. Pours pale gold with thin white head. Cracker malt and floral hop aroma. Rich cracker malt with floral notes. Medium-light body. Long finish.

Rocky white head soon left a decent creamy cover on a finely carbonated amber coloured body.
Minimal aroma of, pale malt, cheese & bready.
Medium bodied, soft & airy over the tongue with a we carbonated but cloying back.
Bready, wheat, yeast, malts, herbal & grassy tastes with bitter finish.

Nose, Malt, diluted with herbaceous (German hops)
Taste. The body is dense, very strong. The taste is malt, aftertaste of malt turning into bitterness from grassy hops. Very drinkable.
Clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma of grain and malts. Taste is malty with light sweet honey touch.  Light body, average carbonation. Decent
Clear golden appearance. Aroma is sweet, corn and malt. Flavour is malt, hop, bitter and floral.

(500ml can, Berlin, 0.89 EUR)
AROMA: grainy, dank, fall leaves, wood/bark, vegetables, tad of old standing water
APPEARANCE: honey/golden yellow, touch tan, respectable looking
TASTE: bit of a bite upfront, astringent, grain, dark bread, spicey, nuts/bark, fair amount of bittering hops for this style, back layer of lemon/candy
PALATE: light body but bitterness and earthiness make it seem fuller, the bitterness does lightly linger for quite a while

OVERALL: interesting. if you like moderately bitter lagers/pilsners (almost leaning towards a Keller Bier) then you would like this. not super complex but there is decent amount of edginess that definitely separates this from typical lager beers.

Pours a clear golden amber coloration with a large, foamy head and very slightly visible carbonation. Smells of grainy, bready malts and grassy, herbal hops. Taste is a great balance of grainy, bready malt and grassy, herbal hops, with just a hint of a slight mineral note. Finishes with a light/medium bitterness and some bready malt and herbal hops lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation. This is definitely the least sweet and most bitter of the Festbiers I've had so far, making it my clear favorite. While this is their Festbier, it almost borders on Märzen territory, with some more bready, grainy malts and quite herbal, grassy hops, making this quite a bit richer and more bitter and nuanced than most of the other Festbiers. I would just love to taste their actual Oktoberfest Märzen next to this, too bad it's only available in the USA...
Really lacking in any sort of aroma.  Pours a really clear amber color. Tastier than it looks.

Puszka 28.08.2019 r.
Aromat: słodowy, chlebowy
Wygląd: złote, klarowne, piana bardzo uboga
Dobrze się pije, dość pełne, czuć solidny podkład słodowy, słodowe, ale nie słodkie, nasycenie na umiarkowanym poziomie
Fajne piwo na wieczór
Golden color and little bit dimly. Nice smell. Sweet taste with malty end. Very nice beer.

Kolor złocisty, piana biała, zbita, drobnopęcherzkowa. Opada dość szybko. W aromacie cytryna wyjęta jak z radlera - coś tu się dziwnego zadziało. Poza tym chrupki kukurydziane i słód. W smaku to po prostu mocny (względnie), wytrawny, musujący lager z nieco wyższą pełnią. Trochę DMS? Generalnie nuda.

Klarowne, jasne złoto, piana mało obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, szybko się redukuje.
W aromacie sporo słodu pilzneńskiego, trochę ziołowego i trawiastego chmielu, nieco jabłkowych estrów, odrobina kukurydzy, odrobina miodu, odrobina nektaru.
W smaku dużo słodu pilzneńskiego, odrobina ziół, siana, białych owoców, kwiatów, nieco miodu, odrobina kukurydzy.
Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego (jak na styl), pełnia niska. Goryczka bardzo niska, trochę jej brakuje.

Barwa jasnozłota. Piwo krystalicznie klarowne. Obfita piana dość szybko opada. AROMAT: dominuje słód, chlebowość, dalej trochę kukurydzy i miodu, lekki mokry karton. Mimo to nie odrzuca. SMAK: dość pełne, słodowe, troszkę motywów karmelowych i chlebowych. Całkiem przyjemna wyczuwalna goryczka.
Sweet, malty golden bottled beer with good head. An above average drink but wouldn't rush to buy

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a medium foamy white head, nose is full malty and grassy with notes of biscuits, taste is sweet, malty and a bit floral with a moderately dry and slightly boozy finish and a fizzy carbonation.
Malted sweet pilsner type of beer. Not bad but nothing special. Might buy again if it is discounted.
Canned (1liter !). Golden colour, thick white bubbly head. Hay nose. Aroma of hay, soft hops and very weak malt. Flavour is maltish sweet and light hoppy. Very thin. Dry finish. Boring crap.

Barwa: jasnozłota, klarowne. Piana średnia, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała, niezły lacing.

Aromat: słód, DMS konkretny, mokre zboże, lekka szmata.

Smak: słodko, słodowo, warzywa, karmel. Goryczka niska, wysycenie wysokie, zapychające, ciało poniżej średniej.

11.2oz bottle.  Pours yellow-gold with a moderate frothy white head.  Aroma is honey, soap, bread, spice, grass, and a little caramel.  Taste is honey, toffee, bread, nuts, grain, and light spice [5.5/10].  A little bitter.  Light-medium body.  Moderate carbonation.  Crisp-ish mouthfeel.
Classica lager tedesca, beverina e di buon corpo. Colore tendente all'ambrato e gusto abbastanza luppolato

Jasnozłote, klarowne, piana obfita, ale niezbyt trwała, choć zostawia ładny lacing. Mocno daje kukurydzą, do tego ogólna słodowość. Smak również wyraźnie kukurydziany, słodki. Mimo to da się wypić bez bólu.

Puszka 0,5 l. Piwo ciemnozłote, klar. Piana biała, obfita, gęsta, trwała, pięknie oblepia szkło. W aromacie nuty słodowe, chlebowe, siana, delikatna kukurydza od słodu pilzneńskiego, lekki karton. Pachnie całkiem miło. W smaku przyjemnie pełne, jak to marcowe, słodowość, chlebowość, lekkie sianko. Pełnia średnia, wysycenie średnie, goryczka niska, o charakterze siennym. Zaskakuje mnie to, że coraz bardziej lubię te Marceny, umieją je robić tam za Odrą.
Golden with a white head - Malt aroma - Malt body with hints of hop bitterness to balance - Malt and hints of bitterness goes into the finish - This was nice
Easy drinking German. It is slightly sweet but has a good palate of hops and floral notes.
Puszka 0,5 litra. Barwa złota, klarowna. Wysoka biała piana, naprawdę trwała. Aromat słaby, trochę kukurydziany, lekka mokra szmata. W smaku bardzo słodkie, aż przesadnie. Średnia goryczka.
Lekker makkelijk door drinkbaar bier. Licht en granig van smaak met een fijne subtiele bitterheid. Bier is mooi pils geel en heeft een stevige schuimkraag.
Sixpackje gekocht in de aanbieding bij de kaufland, lekker biertje, drinkt makkelijk weg, niet al te complex qua smaak

Smell- weak, some sweetness, some malt, some caramel, not bad.
Foam- thin, soft, some weak bitter notes to sides. Medium large white color.
Appearance- clear yellow, orange amber, medium to low carbonation.
Taste- weak citrus, weak bitterness, weak sweetness, weak caramel.
Not bad, some weak bitter aftertaste, not bad, quite drinkable.
Paulaner da 6 gradi. Dorata con buona carbonazione stile octoberfest. Retrogusto amaro il giusto. Tra le commerciali una delle migliori...

Can - 500ml. Pours a golden, carbonated, limpid body with an average, fading, white foamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with bready and grassy hints. Its well balanced malty/hoppy taste carries herbal, bready, and sweet notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish. Average Okroberfest lager.
Bardzo, bardzo przeciętne, nie za bardzo jest co komentować... średniaczek...

11-01-2019; (1L) can; at home (bought at EDEKA supermarket, Germany).
The looks of the beer are nice. It is not to special. It looks like the perfect beer for an Oktoberfest. Beautiful golden yellow colour with a lovely golden glow. The brew is absolutely crystal clear. On top of the beer a thick layer of frothy rough white foam is formed. Foam retention is low. Just a rather thin drape is left after a short time. Perfect simple fest beer look. Nice.
The aromas of the beer are fine. They aren't too special. It is a very easy festbier. Malts bring some bready aromas. Hops bring some herbal notes. There are some slightly nutty yeast esters. I can't really make more of it than this. it is nice though. Pretty accessible easy drinkable festbier.
The taste is fine. It is well balanced. Sweet malts, with some bitter hops. Not bad. The beer has quite some flavour and isn't difficult to drink. Perfectly suitable for its purpose...drinking lots and lots of it. 
The palate of the beer is fine. Light body, smooth texture and medium-high carbonation. The finish of the beer is nice. It has some nice sparkly carbonation remainders and some alcohol. Also some nice bitter hops linger on for quite some time. I like this beer. Not bad.

Solidny lagerek. W zapachu słody przed wszystkim, trochę chmiel i kukurydza, bez wad. Wygląd ok, złociste z fajną pianą + lacing. W smaku znów głównie słód, ale cośtam chmielu czuć, jest czysto i pijalnie.
Lovely 1 lt. Can bought in Jumbo supermarket in Santiago. Honey and grains smell. Classic lager looking clear golden color. Nice taste and aftertaste, but nothing special tbh.

1L Can bought for me as a gift from a family member when in Germany. Poured into a huge glass which was capable of holding such a beast. Aroma was grainy and a bit bready with some caramel malt. Taste is not too disimilar to lots of cheap strong lagers you can buy over here but much cleaner! Drank as part of my breakfast today (my birthday). Not bad!
Pours clear golden with a medium sized head. Aroma of malts, grass, hay. Taste of malts, bread, butter. Light sweet finish
Bottle pour. Light straw color. Banana and yeast aroma. Notes of light wheat, orange peel and vanilla. Very light bodied.
Bardzo nijakie, słomkowe i w opór miodowe. Goryczka nie uświadczona, może delikatnie w stylu, nie mniej zwykły koncernowy lager, bez szału.
Аромат солодовый, с ноткой алкоголя и цветочности. Цвет красивый, золотистый с белой пенкой. Вкус средний, солодовый, немного приторный. Послевкусие умеренное, солодовое с легким хмелевым оттенком.

Köpt på Glen Miller Café, Stockholm. Ganska tunn i doft och kropp, lite skumbanan över smaken som annars är ganska lätt. Fyller dock verkligen sitt syfte. Helt ok helt klart. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bună, cu mult malț ușor dulce, paie proaspete, puțină amăreală pe fundal cu nuanțe de frunze și iarbă uscată, dar prea mulți fenoli (ulei/untură); în lipsa acestora ar fi extrem de curată și plăcută, dar, posibil, deja pils... Oricum e plăcută și bine făcută.

Tap @The Canal House Nottingham. Pours pale yellow gold with lasting white lace. Aroma floral hops honeyed malt. Taste is medium sweet to lightly sour. Palate medium bodied, slick feel, soft to average carbonation and a sweet honey finish. Easy drinking and should be more available in the UK than it is.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

500 ml can bought at Circle-K in Sheung Shui Centre.



Clear golden yellow colour; Explosive four-finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with active slow carbonation; Fragrant aroma of full Lager malt, with honey, floral, sugar, spices, herbs, thick bread, lemon and strong grass; Medium sweet taste of full Lager malt, with nuts, very light honey, floral, sugar, light spices, herbs, bread, light lemon, mid to light bitter hops and grass; Medium body; Slick palate; Mouth feel is very good Lager maltyness in a solid background. Nutty with traces of honey. Flowery with medium sweetness. Light spicy, herbal bready with fair lemon to round. Pretty decent!... Hoppiness is floral, light spices, herbs, lemon and strong grass i nose and taste; Bitterness is fair for an abrupt, mid to low astringent full malty finish; Fairly dry after taste. Nutty herbal and slightly bitter to mouth.



Comments: As a strong full malt Lager, this one is clean, effective and with nice nutty characters. As a Maerzen, though, I think it's too clean and lacking some sparks for me to like it more. Looks like it's geared for mass appeal, which is not a bad thing when you are in festive mood. For me? Once is enough.

Bottle. Clear gold with a finger of foam, laces well. Toasty bready aroma, light citrus. Honey bread malt flavour, simple and a touch sweet, malts get tastier down the glass. Medium feel, nicely carbonated and bittered for a crisp drinkable feel. Simple yet pleasing.
Clear golden colour with white head. Malty aroma. Taste is fruity malt with some spice in the background.
Aroma is mostly caramel with a note of malty signs. Taste is semi dry with grainy character which is really dominant with earthy scratches to hoppy touches. Slight and simple Oktoberfest bier.

Half liter on draught at 5 Horses South End, 9/26/18.
Clear, bright, straw-golden with some deeper copper hues. Snow white head atop is large and well-retained.
Lemon pepper-like herbal hop nose with honey and light, freshly baked bread seems on point. Clean and pretty aromatic.
Light-to-medium bodied with good malts and fairly appropriate attenuation. Carbonation is rather forceful, unsurprisingly, leading to a bit of a loose finish. Bit mushy on the malt side of things but it's shockingly clean and the hops are very flavorful. Good balance with lingering honey-like malts. Definitely could be a lot less mushy sweet, but it's fine.

500ml can. It is a medium-heavy festbier. Foam is almost weak, body is almost hard and sticky. Nice to drink, sweet malt, some german hop and hint of smoke do the caramel or chocolate aroma. Very good.

Celkem slušné pivko, poslední dobou jsem měl tu čest zkusit několik marzenů a toto patřilo k těm lehce nadprůměrným. Pivo podobné dosti českým ležákům, přitom mírně odlišné. A to v chuti, která je dle mého názoru sladovější a také barvě, která nebývá tak čiře žlutá, jako u českých ležáků.
Clear golden beer with nice white head. Aroma is malty, hay, some hops. Taste is smooth and sweet malty, little bit bitter. Light body. Overall nice and simple drinkable beer.

Oktober 5 2018: 
On tap at Rogue Wetbar on W Broadway in Vancouver. A clear medium amber beer with white head and a faint spicy vegetal nose. Well balanced warm and seasonal spice notes; almost a pumpkin beer, but not quite. Hints of cinnamon, nutmeg, clove. Not really my style of beer, but well executed. 3.5

Oktober 2 2020:
A tall can from the BC Liquor store in Burnaby Heights, Greater Vancouver. 
See nots above, but my subjective appreciation has increased. Wonderful stuff! Maybe I’m just in a good mood? 😃
500ml bottle from M&S, Watford.  Decent enough lager, with a strong malty aroma.  Nothing special, but drinkable.

On tap. Pours a clear pale gold with a small, foamy, long lasting, off-white head that laces. Aroma of grainy malt, bread and grassy hops. Sweet flavour of bready malt, honey and butter with a dry, bitter grass finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Ok.

Sehr schönes Goldgelb aus der 0,5l Flasche, grobblasiger Schaum der schnell zusammenfällt. Im Geruch unauffällig, vielleicht etwas grün, Gras oder Tee. Der Antrunk ist malzig läuft aber sogleich irgendwie auseinander, untypisch für ein Festbier. Dann ist es auch gleich weg von der Zunge nur etwas Prickeln bleibt ein wenig am Gaumen. Das ist heuer das Schlusslicht unter den 6 Münchner Oktoberfestbieren.
Aroma malt, humle, karamell. Utseende klar gylden med hvitt skum. Smak malt, karamell, humle. Fyldig, lett bitter, god sødme. Flaske på BMW Welt, 50cl 6%
From Beer Hawk. Golden malty lager but not as much taste as I was expecting
Nice, clear amber-copper pour. No head to speak of. Oktoberfest nose and flavor, but with a distinct German quality.
From backlog. On draft at Paulaner Festzählt Winzerer Fähndl München. Golden with white head. Malts, hops, sweetness.

Yeasty, malty aroma, some spice. Short white head than recedes quickly to a thin cap with little lacing. Crystal-clear bright gold color with moderate amount of rising bubbles. Moderate feel. Initial taste follows the aroma - herbal, perhaps even slightly fruity, with substantial bready malts. Light bittering comes along in the middle, remaining through the finish and into the aftertaste. This is, without a doubt, the best of the lighter "fest-style" that I've tried. Very nice.

Bottle pour. As Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier. Pale golden orange, clear and still with a diminishing ring of off white head. Aroma is lager grains, toasted corn. Body is smooth with soft to tingly carbonation. Taste is crackers, lager malts, very grainy with some apple. Malt sugars with a drying finish. Clean and so easy to drink. Ok stuff. (4-4-6-3-12=2.9)

Robe or clair, limpide, mousse correcte mais dure assez peu, très visqueuse. Nez de malt un peu sucré, simple mais assez agréable. Attaque sucrée, très ronde, mais pas écoeurante. Notes maltées dominantes, caramel, un ensemble plus riche que la version de base. Légère amertume herbacée en finale. C'est sympa mais ça casse pas des briques. J'aurais ptêtre du mal avec un mass, étant donné la saveur sucrée.
Sweet,malty, fresh. Good character.  Had it on tap and only needed on. A bit sweet for my liking.
Birra discreta, poco amara e dal gusto erbaceo. Bevibile, ma c'è sicuramente di meglio.
Malt, hops in aroma. Golden, clear with big white head. Malt, hops, medium bitterness. Medium body, high carbonation.

Bottle from Drankenhandel Leiden. Aroma is sweet grainy malts with notes of honey, apple and toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter with a medium body. On the sweet side and a bit musty overall, unremarkable but drinkable Festbier.

"Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier", Flasche (50 cl). - Mein Berliner Edeka bietet schon Mitte August vier verschiedene Münchner Oktoberfestbiere an - eine gute Gelegenheit, in Ruhe daheim zu verkosten, ohne sich diesem überlaufenen Massenbesäufnis aussetzen zu müssen. - Satt goldgelb, blank filtriert. - In der Nase strohig-süßes helles Malz, zart muffig, mit leichten Anklängen an kräuterigen Hopfen. - Antrunk breit süßlich karamelmalzig mit etwas muffiger, zart ranziger zitroniger Hopfenherbe. Milder rezent, harsch, deutlich fuselig. Im Abgang nicht zu kräftige aber schroffe, leicht metallische Bittere mit Anklängen an grüne Äpfel. - Ruppiges, lieblos gemachtes Festbier, dem man die industrielle Herkunft allzu sehr anmerkt: das schmeckt auch aus der Flasche deutlich nach der 1-Liter-Dose ...

Tap. Hoping this is the right one; listed as Oktober even if it's May...

A: Caramel color, white head, and light lacing.

N: Pumpkin, toffee, caramel, pine, flowers, coriander, toast, and biscuit.

T: Quite toasty and sweet. Bitter and peppery. Bready.

M: Light body, no alcohol, spritzy carbonation.

O: Another easy drinker. No Ayinger level of appreciation here, but still nice.

15 September 2020 draft at Dad Stahl Bierhaus. Amber color poured with a thick cream color head. Nice malty caramel note with some sweetness. Slightly thick on the tongue. Nice. Rating 3.7. 

31 May 2018  Draft. Amber color with a thin off-white head.  The aroma is malty with caramel and Candi sugar notes. The taste is sweet. Nice Oktoberfest.  Rating 3.4.
Fles 50cl thuis. Maltig, kruidig, wat zoet maar niet té. Beetje caramel. (1-2016).

tall can that pours clear light but bright gold with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. grainy honeyed maltiness, sweet hay, cara-like doughyness, caramelized pears, fresh but not really bitter herbs, clean german yeast action - some lagering effect. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; semi-sweet herbal-grassy finish. rather sweet but still nice "strong" oktoberfestbier.

500ml can from CBA, drunk at home. Pours clear with a thin, fast-settling frothy head, medium lacing while the head lasted, a persistent bead. Pale straw in colour. Malt predominates the aromas, with cereal, hay, bread and honey. In the mouth, light fine carbonation with bread and biscuit malts, but balanced with slight fruit and floral notes, minimal sweetness leading to a mild bitter finish. Overall, just a fancy name for a strongish malty lager.

On tap at Oktoberfest 2012 (from records). Pours a pale orange gold with a white head. Aroma: bread, grain, mild sweet malt, grass, mild orange peel notes. Taste: bread, grain, sweet malt, mild lemon, straw flavours. Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Easy drinking. This was quite nice.

Can.
This is classic. Perfectly neutral, very very close to euro lagers. Not impressive. Not great. Barely good. It only sits here waiting on you to grab it. Don't.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker. Shared with Anke.
Labeled 2017. Pours clear pale golden with a thinning, foamy, white head. The aroma contains wheat, citrus, yeast, apple, grass, bready malt & dough, some cow fodder or 'wort'. It tastes medium malty/bready sweet and light to medium grainy bitter, bit yeasty. Dry, grainy, yeasty finish. Light body, slick texture, fizzy carbonation. Very simple Lager, but then again, it's served at Oktoberfest and not at a zythology course...

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, pale, golden, amber, orange, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour, very bitter, salty, umami,
Fles gedeeld met Koenzie en Roelzie. Het is een helder goudgeel bier met een witte schuimkraag. De geur is moutig en nootachtig. De smaak is moutig, licht zoet en nootachtig.
500ml can. Fresh grain aroma. Golden in colour with a small white head. Crisp sweet malty flavour with some notes of grain and biscuit. Medium body. Short sweet finish. Refreshing and very drinkable.
Sweet and malt, but just not enough balance for my preference in Oktoberfests.
Can. Clear golden color. Foams quite a bit and the head Is medium stable. Stronfer Sweet malty Taste balanced with hoppy Bitterness. Hint of some spices.

Toto pivo jsem ochutnal v lahvi i párkrát na čepu a musím říct, že mě rozhodně neuchvacuje. S tradičním marzenem už nemá mnoho společného a je už to pomalu klasický ležák. Ale furt nadstrandarní ležák.
This one comes from the LCBO 2017 Fall Seasonal Beer Program. I had hopes, yet, not much you can do with a marzen.
Classic Festbier. Very drinkable. Pours clear golden with decent white head. Like a typical Helles but with a little more punch, bit more flavour.
Bottle from supermarket in Italy. 1l can. Golden color, white head. Pleasant, easy drinking. Like it

Aus der Dose, hat sich bis jetzt hinter den anderen Bieren im Lager versteckt. Klare, goldene Farbe mit weißer, kurzlebiger Schaumkrone. Süßer, malziger, getreidiger Geruch. Süßer, malziger, nur leicht getreidiger Geschmack mit leichter Bitterkeit. Klingt recht kurz malzig bitter aus. Leichter Körper mit aktiver Kohlensäure. Ok.

A bottle from City Super in the basement of Sogo on Zhong Xiao Fu Xing. Aroma: some fresh mown hay. Appearance: clear gold, head dissipates to nothing. Palate: medium-bodied and slick, soft carbonation, predominantly bitter at the finish. Taste: medium-bitter, some candy, pepper from the booze quite pronounced at only 6%. Very satisfying beverage.
0.5 l bottle. Clear golden, thin white head. Nose is sweet grains and so is the taste with slight metallic notes. Short sweet finish, light body, average carbo.
(lager classique) (je n'ai pas à dire grand-chose de plus) (mais je réessaierai)
Licht zoet licht bitter helder witbier uit een literblik. Smaakt niet echt als een wit bier maar is wel lekker.
Aroma of malts. Taste is sweet and malty. Palate is very light. Enjoyed it quite a lot!

8/X/17 - 1L can as "Wiesn Bier", shared @ Arno & Meggy's place - BB: IV/2018 (2017-1770) Thanks to Krisje for the can and nice glass!


Note: drank this for the first time a couple of years ago at the real Oktoberfest in München, but didn't take notes so vigorously back then, and I didn't really identify this as a different beer back then....

 
Clear blond beer, small creamy white head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, some caramel, cow fodder. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: malty, bit metallic, some caramel, bitter touch, bit of cow fodder, grassy touch. Aftertaste: metallic bitterness, bit floral, caramel malts, nice one!

Grass aroma
Honey nut color
Light head that dissipates quickly
Strong wheat taste 
Short lasting aftertaste 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy yellow gold with thick foamy white head
Aroma is mild citrus and banana notes and grainy 
Flava is grainy slightly tart and chalky and Stone fruit 
Feels light to medium with crisp fizzy foam 
Finishes dry grainy slight banana

1l can at a friends birthday party. Appearance: clear pale straw with fairly big, white head. Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, grains and a hint of sweet spice. Taste: above medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of sweet malts, caramel, some hops and grass. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation.
2017 Version in a 1/2 liter can. pours golden with a thick but quickly disappearing foam layer. for me it was just another strong lager. not bad but also nothing special.

W porządku piwo, klasyka Oktoberfestu (2017). Pijalne dość, klarowne tudzież. Barwa dość jasna, jasnobursztynowa. Aksamitne, trochę słodowe; w aromacie delikatne cytrusy, kwiatowość; w smaku karmel, nieduża goryczka, przeciętna pełnia; nawet spore wysycenie. Taki wzorzec marcowego.

Bottle from Rimi. BB 08.2018. Clear light gold with small head. Grainy, somewhat papery aroma and flavour, the floral (honey-ish even?) hops feel kinda strange, overall modest sweetness and very faint bitterness in the finish. Dry, light, crisp. Not exactly bad, but I'm not really enjoying this.

Bottle, 0.50l. Aroma is grainy, grassy, floral and honeyish. Pours clear deep golden with thin quickly diminishing creamy white head and average sparkling appearance. Taste starts medium sweet grainy and grassy, following is bready, mouthfeel is mild spicy, while finish is average bitter. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Not bad, but nothing special about it...

Aroma : granos dulces; ligera galleta integral; lúpulo floral y especiado

Apariencia : oro casi totalmente translúcido (6 SRM) que traduce en ámbar en el jarro; cabeza blanco hueso de buena retención; regular encaje

Sabor : granos y galleta de soda; amargor medio (23 IBU aprox.) ligeramente contrarrestado por amables notas dulces de flores de té

Paladar : cremosa espuma; ingreso fresco; cuerpo medio-ligero; regusto semi-seco y floral de mediana duración

Impresión General : cerveza de tradición e historia; fácil de beber y de muy buena frescura; altamente recomendable

0,5 l bottle from Alko Hakaniemi, Helsinki. Apperance is golden and clear with a nice head. Taste is sweetish (alchohol) and herbal. This is basically a too strong helles. Probably quite nice with heavy German food.
Bottle. Clear pale golden with white head, fizzy. The aroma has notes of hay, some fruitiness (pear), herbs and grains. Bitter and sourish flavor with notes of grains, lemon and herbs. Light-bodied.

Draft at Moerlein Lager House from notes. Pours a clear  dark golden/orangish color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have toasted malts, more bready doughy than most, light caramel, mild fruit character, a hint of earthy bitterness, generally decent for the style, but not much that stands out as special.
Аромат слабый солодовый, вкус тоже слабый, но хороший и очень стойкий, окутывает рот.
From Bottle. No description. Rating only. Transferred from an earlier rating.
1 Quart can. Smells malty. Hazy, straw in color. Sweet and malty. Smooth on the palate. Overall nice Octoberfest beer.

Aus der 1-Liter-Dose, stilecht im Maßkrug. Optisch prima, in der Nase maischig, malzig, Heu. Im Trunk kernig, süffig, süß, dann bitter. Es schwingt noch etwas neben dran, das ich nicht ganz ausmachen kann. Holzig, erdig? Insgesamt leider nicht überragend.
Wygląd nietypowy jak na piwo marcowe warzone na oktoberfest. Kolor żółty, niezła biała piana. Aromat słodowy. W smaku podobnie. Niezłe piwo ale oczekiwania były większe

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of bready malts, cereal, slight grain, subtle lemon and some floral hops. Taste of bready malts, grain, slight honey, a little lemon and some herbal, floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, honeyed, floral hop bitterness in the finish. A lot hop forward than most Oktoberfests but also quite sweet in the flavour. Not as easy drinking as say, Spaten.
Clear golden colour with medium white head, aroma is malty, fresh, hint of hops, taste is malty, lower carbonation, smooth mouthfeel , medium bitterness and malty aftertaste. It's a good lager.

Pours from the bottle with a really nice golden yellow colour. Mild carbonation with nice head. Fruity aroma with nice yeast and malt balance. Really nice taste to match with dry aftertaste. Recommended.
Svijetlo zuta boja, veoma prozirno, sa srednjom debljinom pjene. Blage gorčine i lakog tijela, malo aromatičnije u odnosu na klasične lagere, sa biljnom aromom i vema blagom aromom sira i meda.

Paulaner are in general very good beers. This is the best German beer I have ever had! A full yet light and smooth taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
It's just a lager. It's very average. Pretty strong for what I thought would be a session beer for the drunken Munich tourists. Cue vomit puddles and regurgitated weissewurst. Distinctly plain!
Don’t really get this style. Nice enough but just a big standard strong lager to be.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into mug. 
Appearance: Clear golden colour, with big but short-lived head. 
Aroma: Malt, corn/barley, hint of hops.
Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation.
Taste: Barley, malt, cereals, bread, medium bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Quite good/solid beer, drinkable, tasty..as usual from Paulaner.
Taps clear topaz with a fair eggshell head. Aroma presents fresh malt and apple tones. Flavor features crisp fresh malt and sweet, almost cider-like apple. Mouthfeel offers fair fizz and body. Prost!

500 ml bottle. Crystal clear golden coloured beer with a 1 finger white head of a short duration. Steady slow carbonation. The aroma was pleasantly malty with a touch of lemon, floral spiciness and grain. The taste was a malty medium body with peppery and lemony, some kind of grassy hop notes. Minimum to none alcohol sensation. Very drinkable lager. Enjoyed it.

I do not know so much about this style and what taste it has to be. But from what I remember, it was just a lager. Lager aroma, taste, it was refreshing a lot, but good in summer, not in autumn. Good with meat.

Pours a clear golden brown from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that dissipates quickly moderate lace. Aroma of mild earthy hop notes over a hint of sweet malt. Taste follows, clean and easy. A decent Oktoberfest.

Stærk maltet. Bygmalt, meget simpel

pale, clear, minimal head,

medium bitterness,

medium body, slick, kvalmende feel, average carbonation bitter,

Alt for dyr, selvom den koster 15kr. Kedelig øl

From tap at Paulaner am Dom, Frankfurt. Clear yellow golden color with white head. Malty sweet aroma, grainy, light caramel and light fruity. Sweet taste. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Clear golden. Nice floral sweet leaning flavor, but weaker in the nose - really had work for anything. Nothing unpleasant at all, but a bit dull.
the aroma is malty and herbal with shades of grain, buckwheat and hay... the taste is clear and refreshening, malty, with notes of grain, straw and some grasses... dry and bitter aftertaste...
500ml can from Bliznetsy in Moscow. Pours clear gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is malt, bread, grass. Taste is sweet, malt, bread, light spiciness.
Looks awesome in the mug, tastes of straw, a fruity taste in the background. Nothing special, but not bad.
500ml bottle from The Grumpy Goat, Reading. Amber colour with white head. Sweet bready malt, biscuity malt, overripe banana, yeast, banana bread, pine nuts, light metallic notes.

Bottle from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours beautifully clear gold with a white head. Aroma of hay,grass,light,y toasted bread,fresh bread,citrus & some peppery spice. Taste is doughy bread,light citrus,hay,& grass. Light bodied & smooth. The sweetish finish is slightly dry with more of the same flavours .

2 x 500ml bottles from Beers of Europe, drank on 23rd and 26th September 2017. I have had the beer many times before and was very surprised to find I had never rated it. Anyway, it's a good golden bodied beer, solid but quickly fading white crown on top. Nose on the bready, malty side, taste more hoppy than malty. Decent enough, if a little boring flavour wise.
Piwo o jasnożółtej barwie. Piana szybko opada, bez lacingu. Słabe aromaty slodowe. Minimalna goryczka. Piwo bez większych zalet.
Pours a dark hazy bronze with thick white head. A grainy and malty caramel aroma. A sweet caramel and malty taste with some grains and fruits. A sweet malt and light autum spice afteraste

500 ml bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is mostly noble hops, with a lighter citrus and malt character. Full malts with a light spicy flavour. Light sweetness, and a dry and bitter finish.

At cask in Pahad Poisid, Tartu. Clear golden color, with tiny white foam, disappears quickly. Sour hop aroma mainly. Nice sour start, wheat, malt, watery taste. Little booring, but not so bad. Watery mouthfeel.

0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, light bready notes. Clear golden color, white head. Malty taste, bready notes, light caramel notes, medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation and malty bitter finish with bready notes. Very good.
tak toto je velmi pititelne pivko. vona nic moc ale ostatne parada. viem si predstavit pit ho cely vecer.

500 ml bottle. Pours clear orange-golden, decent head. Hay, bread, citrus. Medium bitterness. Slightly metallic. Süffig. Average carbonated, light bodied. Okay Märzen.

Re-rating. From bottle. A lot of pale malt, bread, hay, some grassy floral notes, some citrus and marzipan. Malty sweetness, medium dry bitterness. Full bodied, soft carbonated, dry malty finish. Nice!

500 ml bottle,2017 version,bb 04/2018.
Golden,clear,medium head,no lacing.
Nose - raw sewage. Twenty minutes later it is mostly metallic with sewage undertones.
Taste - sour/sweet,leaning toward sweet,hints of grass.

From notes. Drank this one in the parking lot at the Cube after a hockey game on August 04. This was the last beer in the cooler, so I reluctantly didn’t go thirsty. 330 mL bottle, I believe. Color is more of a golden orange with a thick pillowy white head and a ton of lace in the little bit that was poured out. The rest was consumed from the bottle. The aroma is interesting. There is a lot of bready malt and a light sweet maltiness. There is almost a pilsner level of metallic coming through and I’m not a bit fan. It’s lightly grassy, but just isn’t working for me. The flavor is incredibly sweet and metallic. The breads just control and the sweet graininess is really interesting. The metallic maltiness resounds through to the last drop. The mouth feel is light and watery with a bright over carbonation and a lingeringly sweet and metallic malt that I’m not enjoying. This isn’t good, but at least I guess I didn’t go thirsty. 6 4 5 3 12

1 liter can from Tye as a gift which was purchased in Germany. Pours a clear golden colour with two finger of lasting white head. Aromas of grass, bread, and light notes of citrus. Taste is light and matches the aroma with some barley notes. Moderate carbonation. Pleasant, easily goes down, certainly enjoyable. Thanks Tye!

Bottle. 2017. Color: Golden, nice long lasting dense white head. Taste: Malt, grain, notes of sugar and some caramel hints. Some medium bitter notes of hop. More hop notes at finish. Mild. No really pronounced taste, but just a good above medium bodied classic German beer. Medium carbonation. Definitely worth a try or an uncomplicated beer to enjoy once in a while.

Version 2017
No detail information about the malts, hops or drinktemperature on the bottle.
Clear golden beer with short white head, smell is Pils, light metal, after grassland and sour, taste is light malty, light bitter, light body, soft carbonation, thin, 
(I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 04.18 and batch L18375 W)

Can. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is cookie dough, pale malts, some honeycake. Taste is dusty malts, honey, dough, and I also get a touch of vegetables and some stale flavours (in a fresh beer from the can? That doesn’t make sense), sticky sweetness. Ample carbonation. Quite disappointing, even for the standards of the "strong pale" Oktoberfest beers that you get in Munich. 5-3-4-3-9

Bottle during a blind tasting of all the Wiesenbiere and some extra Festbiere. This turned out to be still very sticky sweet, though the stale flavours I did not get there. Did rate a little bit higher blind. 5-3-5-3-10
Botella 33 cl del c Inglés Oviedo tomada en Oviedo junio 2000. (r1170). Lote L24403H hasta 08.. 2001. Cereales. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber más menos fino. Buena.
500ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Würzig. Vollmundig. Ordentlicher Körper. Süßlich.
in a bottle. meh. a week one from Paulaner. Does have that shitty Oktoberfest mass produced flavor, that corn and malt flavor just doesn’t do it for me.
500ml bottle. Pours clear golden with small white head. Aroma of malts, grass, bread, caramel. Medium body with lively carbonation. Medium sweet, light to medium bitter.

Tasted blind together with Dr. Beer / Serverd in black glassware. Smell is fruity, esthers, some apple notes, as well as banana, very mild bitter touch. Mild wheat character. Distant, light alcohol notes. Taste is bit bitter, rather dry. Some wheat, mild sweetness towards the end. Bitterness doesn’t stay, really. Very mild aromatic malts. Some banana, but not overly so. Rather silky MF, for what seems to be a lower ABV. Assertive carbonation. Ending a bit to the dry side .
Goldgelb im Glas mit schöner Krone. Malzig süsser Antrunk, vollmundiger würziger Körper, feingehopfter Abgang. Sehr süffig
0.5l bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma of mild roasted malt, barley, herbs and caramel. Taste is sweet and bitter.
Helder lichtgeel bier met veel schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig en licht zoet met iets van honing en gras. Gewoon een goed bier.

Bottle.Clear straw,thick,white head,not too stable,copious lacing. Aroma malty, grassy,biscuits,somewhat nutty. Taste rather smooth,not too thick,sweetish. Carbonation medium,bitterness low,fitting. Aftertaste bready,malty,grassy. A decent Märzen.
Clear golden. Creamy white head. Malty aroma, some nuts and freshly baked bread aswell. Taste is straightforward malt. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with almost no bitterness. I like it.

Bottle form Elysium. Aroma: Grain, bread, cookies. Appearance: Golden clear body, ok medium-high head. Taste: Estery a bit, bread, sweet, cookies, aceton. Palate: Sweet finish, medium-low body, high carbonation.
On tap. Golden color with minimal white head and soft carbonation. Sweet aroma with grain and barley notes. Mostly sweet flavor with a but of hoppiness. Light bodied. Not bad.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Bière légère aux notes de miel, très classique.
Verly light and easy to drink. Interesting taste, if you pay attention. Honey aroma a bit

Butelka 0,5 przywieziona z Monachium. Aromat słaby i dziwny, jakby kiszonki. Kolor ciemnozłoty, piana fajna na 2 cm. W smaku dość paskudne, wali kiszonką i zepsutym piwem. Czyżby felerna partia? Data ważności jeszcze ponad miesiąc.

Generalnie - mi nie smakowało.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze zlotym z niezbyt obfita biala sredniopecherzykowa piana ktora znika bez sladu. W aromacie slody, pieczywo tostowe i mokry karton. W smaku dosc wytrawne z wysyceniem i goryczka na srednioniskim poziomie. Troche karmelu i i przypraw, dominuja slody. Nic ciekawego.

Pours golden with medium, well-looking head. Some lacing too. Malty and grainy aroma, some notes of bread. Slighty hoppy and grassy in the end Quite middling. Taste is sweet, malty and grainy. Quite similar to strong lagers. Nothing interestins is here. Medium body, low, grassy bitterness. Ordinary, but disappointing beer.
Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma is malts, carrot, some fruits, a bit cardboard. Taste is bitter, fruits, some caramel, malts, autumn leaves, light sourness, leather. Very good beer!

Bottle. Clear pale yellow. Good head. Aroma is malty, grassy and a little bit hoppy. Taste is spicy, malty, grassy and bready. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Easy drinking. If it wasn’t for the small alcoholic warmth I might have taken it for a Pils from southern Germany. Alright.
Bottle. Pours a mid orange colour with a mid sized white head, light aroma with some hops, the taste is light bitterness with a dry bitter finish.

After an autumn of drinking oak-aged, imperial and cooperatively brewed Oktoberfest beers, with the last and most basic of the bunch I found the best of the year. Extremely well balanced, full-bodied and pleasantly sweet throughout, this is a beer one could drink all night. Mine had the blue label as seen here:
https://www.paulaner.com/us/products/oktoberfest-beers/oktoberfest-wiesn
poured from bottle...pours dark yellow...minimal white head...mouth is bread caramel and malt...decent not great.
Taste: delicate barley bread notes, balanced malts to hop. Mild sweet nose. Bright Gold in color, clear, with a tall white head of foam. Medium to medium lite body. Crisp and easy drinking.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a clear golden colour with a clear white head. Malty aroma, and the taste is dominated by a full, rich malt flavour. Quite sweet with hints of meadow grass. The finish has a good,hoppy bitterness. A highly drinkable well-made lager beer. If only all lagers were this good!
Frisch vom Hahn im Maximilians in Berlin. Klares Gold mit feinem weißen Schaum im Glas. Süßlicher Malzkörper dominiert.

Bottiglia 50cl al supermercato, bevuta a casa.
Chiara con schiuma evanescente.
Non memorabile, dolce e poco incisiva 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Beer on bootle. Tipical lager gold color. Meadium head. Malty aroma. Taste malt swet, litle biternes, big carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Clear golden body, tall frothy white head. Aroma of malt, notes of bread and carmel. Taste is mainly medium sweet, malty, with flavors of bread, and notes of caramel. Medium to low body, watery texture, average carbonation.

Bottle 50cl. from a REWE supermarket, Herzogenrath, poured into a lager glass. Clear pale golden, tall frothy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; sweet malty nose, aroma grainy, light caramel, candy sugar; taste light heavy sweet and slightly bitter, malty, grainy, light caramel, bit sugary; mild sweetbitter malty aftertaste; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; decent.
Uma cerveja leve mas com sabor marcante e bem maltada. Cor dourada e espuma branca. Uma ótima pilsen.

Verticale. Bottiglia bevuta 10/2016. Il gusto al naso ritrova l’orzo. L’intensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. La carbonazione quante bollicine. La consistenza del liquido è limpida Le bollicine sono fini. La carbonazione è bassa con risalita morbida. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. L’amaro è moderato. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di pane e cereali. Plus. Bottiglia BBE 03/2011. Bottle courtesy of Roberta Reganati. (A 4. A 4. T 6. P 3. O 3.2) Una bella caduta verticale di grande sorpresa e soddisfazione. Il gusto al naso riferisce di percezioni di ciliegia, albicocca passita e orzo. L’intensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è corta. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. La carbonazione è media. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La carbonazione è praticamente piatta. Il colore è ambrato. Il corpo è pieno. L’amaro è deciso e perde quel leggero aspro della bottiglia consumata nei limiti di scadenza. L’intensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono poco meno che luppolate. Il finale è felpato, setoso, lungo, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Al palato arrivano sensazioni di caramello, miele, crosta di pane, cereali e fiori.
Bue dans chope de 1L. Bière allemande qui se boit facilement. Et le litre fait plaisir aussi =)
Egyenesen Münchenből, az Oktoberfestről. Kicsit édeskés, de teljesen lágy ihatmány.

500 mml bottle tasted on the 21/10/2016. Clear yellow colour with a dense white head. Aroma of bread and yeast. Taste is grainy, bready and yeasty with some caramel on the aftertaste. Next one please!
Can. Pale with medium white head. Aroma - Malt, hay, honey. Taste - Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, malt, grass, honey, yeast.

0,5 l can. Pours clear pale golden with big white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, light yeast, slightly herbal with some honey notes, Body is rich and full, bread with some honey, medium sweet, some caramel, a bit of hay. Slick texture with lively carbonation and short light bitter finish. Pleasant and drinkable.
Cerveja de coloração clara límpida, boa formação de espuma. Aroma e sabor clássico do estilo.

Aroma:


Slight aroma of malts, caramel and grain.




Appearance:


Clear yellow/golden beer with no/a slight white head.




Taste/Palate:


Starts slightly/medium sweet with malts and caramel; ends slightly dry with grain.




Overall:


This beer is rather intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Besides being very slight, the aroma also includes an uninviting smell that I cannot place. The appearance is abysmal; being completely clear, very light and without a head very fast. The taste is decent really; nothing great, but nothing bad either. Same goes for the palate.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, caramel and earthy. Taste is grains and malty.
Just ok. Head disappears in just a minute or so. Not very distinctive flavor. Just some malty sweetness.
Tap. Clear golden colour with stable head off. Aroma and taste almost the same, bread, cereal, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, average carbonation, small bitter finish.
Refrigerated aluminum quart poured into a snifter. Clear Pale with no head. Aroma is light caramel malt, low body, low carbonation, and no lacing. Taste is light caramel malt.
Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Light malty and fizzy aroma. Taste is light sweetness overwhelmed by assertive carbonation sourness. Way overcarbonated.
Keg at the Draft House on Northcote Road. Gold colour with a good head. Sweet malt, slightly cloying actually, but some nice hop to balance and enjoyable enough overall.

Straw coloured. Aroma is mostly noble hops, with a lighter citrus and malt character. Full malts with a light spicy flavour. Light sweetness, and a dry and bitter finish. Full body. Overall, a decent oktoberfest bier. Good balance and nice malty flavour. Too simple to rate higher, though.
[backlog] 01-07-16 // 500ml bottle. Pours a clear golden colour, small white head. Malty grainy in the nose and in the mouth. Smooth. Light body. Flat.
W aromacie nieco bananów, raczej bez wad. W smaku goryczka lekko alkoholowa. Poza tym nic szczególnego wartego odnotowania w tym piwie. W sumie po pewnym czasie jest trochę męczące.
Tapping on the Tramtária pub in Prievidza, dark yellow color, foam quickly falls, weak flavor hops, soft flavor.
Cloudy golden with white head. Banana, citrus and cereal. Sweet and malty finish. Not bad
Can from Netto. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, grass, straw, yeast, honey sweetness. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish.
Nice simple beer. Less caramel malt than the other. Easy finish. Nice opening beer to an evening

Color dorado claro, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca mínima (y poca retención). Carbonatación mínima. Aroma a malta y cereal, estándar y suave. Sabor similar, algo dulce para mi gusto. Aunque la pega no es que sea dulce. La pega es que no aporta nada al paladar. No es plana, es mala como ella sola.

0.5L bottle. Clear golden colour with a frothy two finger white head. Aroma: bready malt, grain, caramel. Taste: bready malt, light sweet caramel, light bitterness, average carbonation. Not bad I suppose.
Butelka. Aromat słodowy, lekki karmel. W smaku goryczka niska lekko alkoholowa. Nic specjalnego ale lepsze od zwykłego koncerniaka.
On tap. Yellow color with white head. Aroma of herbs, grass, hay... One of the worst beers recently tasted. Horrible.

1L can. Pours a yellow color with big white head. Earthy, straw, bread, dough, pils aromas. Straw, herbal, bread, earthy flavors. Definitely lighter and more chuggable than the marzen. Easy to knock back a 1 L can. Reminds me of drinking this in Germany, but I actually enjoy the marzen a little more.

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of malt, grain, light caramel, wheat and bready notes. Flavour is above light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with light carbonation. [20-09-2016]

The body is gold with rapidly disappearing foam. 
Aroma: Melt, bread
Taste: medium sweet
Bottle from appellation dalry. Aromas of lemon, straw, malts. Taste is honey, apricot, malts, citrus.

0,5l bottle from Alko Vaasa. Pours crystal clear yellow color with not much head. Aroma is sweet and herbal. I’ve tasted every oktoberfest beer from Alko this year. This was not among the better ones. Too sweet and with a rubberlike lingering. The carbonation feels a bit low and leaves the beer as just sugar juice. Basically a sweet lager.
Malziger Geruch. Dunkekgolden mit schönem Schaum. Kräftig würziges Aroma mit leichter Bitterkeit. Gleich im Antrunk ein deutlicher Starkbiergeschmack.

1000ml on tap at Käfer Wiesenschenke, Oktoberfest 2016. Aroma is light malt, light bread. Appearance is clear golden with a white head. Taste is light to medium sweet and very light bitter. A medium carbonation. Good.

Erheblich ausgereifter als andere Oktoberfestbiere. Nicht zu süß und aufdringlich untergärig. Allerdings läßt auch hier das grosse Ahaerlebnis aus. Solides Bier mit leicht alkoholischen Ausklang. Probierschluck bei the big Bayernparty with J&J&Omi&Opi....
Light amber with rich white creamy head m malty aroma. Too strong maize sweetness with some bitterness in the background. Not badly balanced but too sweet for me.

Pours a bright golden color and aspongy white head, which won’t receed at all.

Smells of sun bathed straw and honeyed, sweet malts, together with just the lightest hint of herbal hops.

Has a medium carbonation and a refreshing, lighter body with an effervescent finish, which almost makes up for the lack of crispness in this.

Taste mirrors the nose, while the higher carbonation provides a metallic quality, which mingles into the rich hay and malt foundation. 
Finishes with a light, dry touch, pretty late, coating partly the malts. 

Well balanced, easy drinking, pairs well with food, but kinda fails on itself, since it does not provide any taste evolution, but dough and hay.

Can. Clear yellow colour, medium head. Aroma of grain and bread. Taste is malty sweetness. No bitterness. Very tasty beer. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Smells appetizing, fresh, but not special in any way. Appearance is definitely decent, not only the unique label on the bottle, but also the decent foam head (although nothing exceptional) and the colour. Taste: Heavy cloying sweetness which makes it different from most German beers, only lightly bitter. I was expecting much more pronounced hop notes and unique flavours. I would say that the beer drinks surprisingly easily, especially considering the alcohol content of 6%. Overall too sweet and not enough special aspects such as hop notes to really become a favourite of mine. Although I think it really suits the title Festbier. It is a beer that, due to its sweetness, is perfect for a day or night of partying. Does not leave the drinker with too much of a dry mouth. full sweet body, fizzy and slick texture (not thick though), smooth finish.

Jasnozłote, klarowne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i redukuje się do mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat i smak słodowy, niezbyt intensywny. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie liczyłem na trochę więcej, a jest to lekko wodnisty popychacz do kiełbaski na Oktoberfest.

0,5l can. Clear yellow colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Bread, light caramel, notes of cheese. With time a light smokey tone is comes. Taste: Sweet malty caracter dominates with a light sour mouthfeel. No bitterness at all. Nothing special but very pleasent and very good drinking beer. Has a light warming feel. Light body with soft carbonation. Short sweet finish with a slightly noticable bitter finish.
Corn in aroma. Not especially that pleasant. Maybe could do with being served _very_ cold though.

Bonne bière 
Festive en bouche
Une blonde comme on aimerais en avoir plus souvent sous la main

Light yellow-golden color with a billowing head that lasts till the last drop. Aroma is bread, fresh cut hay and grain. It is quite different than the "Paulaner Marzen Oktoberfest" in bottles which is amber and much less malty with a bitter finish. This "Wiesen" is very malty, slightly fruity, smooth and highly sessionable with a pleasant dry hop finish that is not as much bitter as it is herbal. This is my favorite Oktoberfest beer out of the 33 versions I have tried.

Look: clear golden with strong white head.

Aroma: malt, white bread, some grassy and spicy hops.
Taste: sweet with very light spicy bitterness.
Some alcohol notes in the finish.

This is a good malty lager with light spicy bitternes.

Aroma: wheat and fruits. 
Flavour: Fruity sweetness with notes of banana and citrus. Finish is bitter and fruity. 
Colour: light amber with a white head. 
From: Can @ Bilka Tilst Sept. 2016.

Dollar 90 bottle from wine warehouse. Pours golden with an inch of slightly off-white head. Aroma of grasses and slightly rotting fruit. Perhaps a compost pile. Taste is fresh and much better than the aroma. Grasses, lightly citrus, light corn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveja clássica no estilo, dourada com boa formação de espuma e com boa drinkabilidade. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Aroma: Caramel, honey, and overall nice malt aroma. Taste: wooden honey notes, sweet, and some bitterness of hops. pretty ok
Cerveja dourada com boa formação de espuma. Aroma e sabor maltados, boa drinkability.
Bottle. 500ml Price: gift Skaidrus gelsvos sp. putos beveik nerasta.. skonis neblogas

Garrafa 500ml: Cor dourada, creme de boa formação, que abaixa logo em seguida e fica, uma camada fina, até o final. Aroma de malte, um pouco picante. Sabor primeiramente doce, depois picante, com um amargor leve no final. Corpo médio, boa drinkabilidade
Grains, grass, honey, pale golden with a huge white head quite persistant, light body, medium carbonation, grains, honey, quietly sweet...i see Munchen in october in my eyes, and i want it.

I bought this beer in the denner, close to my flat. It is firstly a refreshing beer for the throat. The body is yellow-gold, thin and white foam, average carbonation. The taste is malty, a bit metalic, watery but it is ok and the touch of hop is discreet.
0,5 l Flasche aus einem lokalen Getränkemarkt. Orangegold, leicht getrübt, mit einer dicken festen Schaumkrone. Riecht süßlich. Schmeckt wässrig-süß. Kann man ohne Ende trinken

Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt. Pours a medium amber color. Aromas of roast malts, caramel, and a touch of spice(ginger?). Flavor has a nice smooth sweet roasted taste. A little bitter on the finish.
Límpida, agradável, equilibrada. Boa drinkability. Boa pra um dia de verão ou várias seguidas.
Special Oktoberfest beer. 50 cc bottle from Metro Gross market. Some malty and hoops . Little bitterness but taste is ok. Enjoy.

Can, 0.5l. Pours clear, pale golden color with small white head that disappears quickly. Smell is malts and yeast with some hops and caramel in the background. 

Thin to medium body with higher carbonation. Creamy texture on the tongue. Taste is pleasantly bitter. Aroma of malts, yeast and a bit of caramel. Grassy mouthfeel with alcohol dominated aftertaste. Dry finish.

Overall, not bad but nothing special either.

Originally rated on 5/30/08. I had the privilige of drinking this at oktoberfest in Munich a few years ago. It was the first beer of that day at 10:00 am, what a way to kickoff! A delicious full bodied beer loaded with creamy caramel malts, the initial sweetness gives way to a slight hop bite finish. A very good marzen. I have it a few times over here in bottled form, while pretty good it isnt the same. is it ever? It is worth a try. In bottled form i would rate it around a 3.4/ 3.5

1 litre can Paulaner Wiesn Bier packaged with original dimpled glass purchased in Germany. Pours hazy gold with medium creamy head. Aroma buttered pretzels and fresh barnyard yeast. Taste medium sweet. Palate oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, full body. Good beer to sip by a fire. One satisfies, which is a good thing at 6% ABV. One of the better Oktoberfest beers.

Sulfury minerally aroma with spicy noble hop. Smells like a Pilsner 
Pours a light golden color with great clarity and small wispy white head
Malty flavor of bread and biscuit with balanced amount of spicy hop character.
Light to medium bodied with high prickly co2, quick finish.
I could drink many of these at a festival. Taste good and goes down easy. Highly quaffable. Non offensive and well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden with an average frothy head. Aroma is malty and light grassy-hoppy. Flavour is also malty, bread, with a hint of toasted grain just before the light hoppy finish. Lager, evem Marzen is not my type of beer, and this one better for a hot summer day than a wet Oktober.
Clear gold with nice foamy head. Aroma grainy and sweet, with a grassy note. Taste grainy and sweet, with a bit of corn note. Decent
Pours gold with a thick white head. Aroma is bready, earthy, cereal and grass. Taste is sweet with some very mild bitterness. Medium bodied with slick texture, somewhat sticky.

11.2 ounce bottle - $1.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.



Best Before: 06/16 (L18151G)



Appearance: Pours a light pale golden body, just a bit hazy and topped off with a thin, thin white head that quickly fades out of sight.



Smell: Sugary, sweetly smelling of grains with a splash of low-grade cider for a hint of apple and a faint grassy whiff of the hops within.



Taste: Cereal sweet, grainy flavor with a bit of sulphury character to it and hint of raw dough. A sugary apple, cidery taste follows with a little hit of spice and only the slightest bitterness. Honestly, this isn’t what I was expecting at all, it’s a little like a malt liquor. A little grassiness on the sweetish finish.



Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-light carbonation.



Overall: Haven’t had it? You’re not missing much. This is no way for me to be spending Christmas ’15!
Draught. Pours clear golden with white head. Bready and malty with more caramel than normal pils beer. Medium body, high carbonation. Finish is medium to low bitter, herbal. Ok

APPEARANCE- Light golden color with slightly amber hue. 
NOSE- very light, near pils-ish. 
FLAVOR- brings me right back to Oktoberfest in Munich a couple years ago (where my ratebeer profile selfie was captured). Very light and all day drinkable. Not at all like traditional German or new US Oktoberfest beer standards.
Flaske og på fad på die Wiesn. Farven er gylden gul og skummet er hvidt. Aromaen er som smagen, dvs. kraftig sødlig malt med noter af nødder.
500ml bottle. Pours hazy amber, good white head. Good sweet malt aroma. Continues to taste. Clean, smooth malts, easy-drinking, light fruitiness, subtle grain. Exactly how it should be.

Flasche 0,5l: Kräftiges Gold, klar, etwas fester feinporiger Schaum; in der Nase fruchtige Frische, kräftige Süße und Würze, malzig, Kräuterprinten, dunkles Fruchtmus; im Körper kräftige würzige Süße, leicht wässrig, cremig, deutlich Kohlensäure, malzig; kräftig würziger Nachgang, leicht nussig, mehr Kräuterprinten

Canette. Robe jaune claire avec un mince col de mousse blanc. Arômes de malt, levures allemandes typiques, herbes séchées, zeste de citron. En bouche, grains maltés, herbes citronnées, cosses de noix. Texture huileuse et corps mince.
Clear golden color with medium white head. Malty and cerealy aroma, grainy and bitter. Taste follows the aroma, weak, grainy, malty, with a bitter aftertaste. Not much going on. Flat and refreshing.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ El Corte Ingles, Sevilla, España.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Malt, sweet, cereal / Malta, dulce, cereal.
Jakoś mnie nie zachwyciło. Aromat nijaki, wygląd nawet ok, a smaku jest coś co mi nie podchodzi. Taki dziwny posmak. Po piwie od Paulanera spodziewałem się trochę więcej...

Gylden filtreret Oktoberfest/Märzen med stor hvidlig skumtop på 4-5 cm (skænket i hvedeglas). Toppen svinder til et par mm. Perlende i glasset. 
Aromaen er mest præget af maltnuancerne af brød, korn og vådt hø. Derudover noter af nødder. 
Smagen er frisk og fint balanceret mellem en let sødme og en middel bitterhed. Maltpræget. 
Fin mellem krop og en forholdsvis blød, men også frisk mundfølelse. Karboneret på et middel niveau. Afslutningen er let bitter, lettere sød og semi lang. 
En fin hvede-festøl uden afstikkere. Solidt og troværdigt håndværk, når vi taler om hvedeøl.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 4B). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L23356Q. AROMA: predominant malty sweet aroma with a slight grainy character. sweet malty background with faint herbal/spicy hop notes. clean lager profile. TASTE: medium malt flavour with a mild sweet and slight grainy background. very faint to no hop presence. low bitterness with a a semi-sweet finish. clean lager profile.
