I get confused by European beer sometimes. Some breweries makes different brews of the same style but don’t differentiate them in the marketing so I sometimes never know which beers I’ve had and which I haven’t. Case in point: Paulaner Oktoberfest Wiesn – which, despite the name is not a wheat beer (“wiesn” apparently means fair – the event, not the sense of justice). This has been around for years and apparently I’ve never had it before. Not that I was missing much as this is a pretty standard pale lager with no frills. I’m wondering if this is truly considered an Oktoberfest/Marzen brew.



I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a mug. It had a best before date of 6/16. 



Appearance: Dark golden color with crystal clarity. Some carbonation bubbles can be seen trickling up. Pours to a two-finger, off-white, soapy head which mostly evaporates and leaves little lacing.



Smell: Not much of anything other than the generic pale lager scent. I do detect a faint green apple character.



Taste: People tend to like Oktoberfestbiers better than regular pale lagers since they tend to have a little bit of actual flavor to them, but not so much that it’s overwhelming. In the case of this one I’m surprised it bears the Oktoberfest name because it seems like any other pale lager. I don’t detect any adjunct presence, but I don’t get any discernible malt or hop character, either. This seems like a rather boring lager to me. I will say it’s sweeter than the average lager, though; I notice a mild caramel sweetness, but that’s about it. Just a faint dry bitterness on the backend. It finishes clean, which is nice. That’s about it.



Drinkability: I’m surprised to see the label on the bottle mentions a potency of 6% ABV. I thought Oktoberfest biers were supposed to be fairly nominal in weight since they’re intended for sessioning? This beer does not seem to be nearly that strong as the palette is mild and direct. The actual deliver of Paulaner Oktoberfest Wiesn is a little boring, too. The mouthfeel is not as crisp and bubbly as most pale lagers. I would not consider it refreshing, either. At least it goes down smooth and leaves almost no aftertaste. 



RATING: 5/10

Light clear amber color with little white head. Thin body, the aroma is fresh and the taste has hints of lemon or flowers in generel. The carbonation is very low but this is in this case neither a pro or a con. Overall a good beer, easy to drink and delicious in the summer.

I’d have been very disappointed to have ordered a pint. Not too much different from macro lagers. A touch of burnt popcorn that I’m used to getting from super-stale NA macro lagers. Was the keg from 2014?

Bière dont je fais la mille et unième cotation, un peu comme à la fête de la bière à Munich,
on fait cela en grôôôsse groupe.
Bouteille de 50 cl à 6 % abv, brassée dans la tradition des fêtes de 1810 (ceci nous rajeunit..).
Couleur doré cristal, avec une clarté réellement cristalline (serait-ce de l’eau de roche?).
Bulles fines en colonne au centre très droite. Splendide. Ce qui l’est moins (splendide), c’est la mousse à très gros flocons, et blanche comme si elle était lavée avec Dash !!! De plus , elle retombe 
jusqu’à laisser le liquide nu comme un ver … (non, pas un verre …).
Arômes (si on peut dire) de malt pils, houblon concentré, pneu au rebut, bois mouillé.
1ère bouche liquide sur de la pils, et un peu de malt grillé.
Arrière-bouche sur du houblon industriel.
2ème bouche plate, monotone.
3ème bouche .. devinez …
Longueur … devinez…
Levure : y en a-t-il ? 
Alcool sans aucun intérêt.
Finale : sans objet.
CONCLUSION : je n’irai jamais aux fêtes de la bière … (et pourtant je suis né en octobre…).

Respectable.

Pure yellow color. If I didn’t see the label on this one, I would have assumed it was a Miller Lite, except that it does have more body/thickness, giving it one number higher. It isn’t see-through, and it isn’t awful.

The aroma is interesting: a combination of corn syrup, cola, and purple grapes. It’s sweet, but not at all saccharine. It is complex, but not challenging. Pleasant, but not lowest common denominator.

The flavor is more cola, a touch of corn syrup. The malts are sweet and corn-y, but also have a hint of cola. The hops are almost non-existent, because it’s all malts. There is another wine-y, purple grape flavor int he taste too.

The feel is smooth and buttery. It’s just a terrific, sweet beer with not a hint of hops to it. it’s more like a wine than a beer, or maybe a mead. Very solid brew.

Draft at Gourmet Haus Staudt. Clear bright golden appearance with a lasting white head. The aroma is bready and grainy, with some cracker to it. The flavor it’s rather uninspiring, but fine. Mild sweetness and a moderately bitter finish, grainy with cracker. Medium-light body with lively carbonation. Drinkable but certainly not exciting.
Pours a very pale yellow, with decent head and carbonation. Aroma smells of wheat. The flavor was a bit plain almost watery. Has a malty wheat finish. Not terrible, but very average.

Bottle from WholeFoods London. A clear, pale, lightly carbonated gold lager. Gentle earthy hop aroma, mild soft lager flavour - mild on hops, gentle malt. Pleasant enough and a good foil to meaty German foods - roast pork, smoked chicken, with buttered kale, red cabbage and potato.

2015:  Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll.  Crystal clear straw gold, very soft effervescence, zero head; Intense barn aromas, wet hay & gamey richness, polished leather, undertones of sweet tropical fruits; Light-medium body with noticeable alcoholic pepperiness; Rich palate with wholegrain toastiness of spicy cereals, mellow fruits (melon) on long finish.  Have to search for the fruitiness (which is there) through the deep malty character, therefore a beer for those who like a challenge.

2014:  Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll. Clear gold colour with a decent head of moderate persistence; Light yeast and lemon-meringue aromas; Initially soft grassy, floral notes on palate but with a rich ginger-biscuit follow through. A nice complexity of balanced flavours makes this my pick of this years’ Oktoberfest beers (so far!).  Ar.8, Ap.5, T.8, P.4, O.17 = 4.2
On-tap at Porter&Sons. Clear yellow golden with a nice creamy head. Aroma of grains and hay. Sweetish, malty and herbal, light hoppy bitterness, very light flavors. Rather light-bodied, quite watery.
Złote z drobną kremową pianą, delikatny aromat słodu i chmielu w smaku to samo, delikatna goryczka, dość mocno wysycone.
bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours clear golden with really white medium head. Aroma is malty, grainy. Taste is the same + little sweet, hint of wheat and citrus. Decent lager. Light body.

Natuke liiga palju on maitses tunda kangust.
Aga vaht on kaunis.
There is too much alcohol in the taste.
But te foam is nice!

330 ml bottle. Hazy golden color. Small foamy white head. Faint malt aroma has notes of wheat and cereal grain. Crisp dry malt flavor upfront. Sweet mid taste. Kinda tastes like across between a wheat beer and a lager. Dry light bitter finish. Rather unassuming.
Mediocre appearance. No aroma. Very pale, hay-like taste. Not much character. It’s OK.
Bottle 50 cl. Golden color with big frothy head. Notes of grains, malts, grass, apples, earthy, citrus. Decent.

0,25 hana@ Zinnkeller. Kirkas, kullankeltainen. Tuoksussa happamuutta, hedelmää, käyneitä omenia, hiukan mallasta. Maussa myös omenaa, mallasta, ihan mukavaa happamuutta. Etäisesti omenasiiderin makua. Raikas.
Ljusgul med lite skum. Doften neutral, smaken söt med lite banan. Eftersmaken lite bitter & ganska söt. Lättdrucken och god.
On tap 100cl. Small white head staying. Nice golden color. Normal, but slow carbonation. Aroma is grain, wood, apples, malt. Taste is quite sweet. Malt and grain.
Hvala Kresimiru na ovoj pivi ..unatoc 6 posto alkohola ne osjeti se nista ...cak je okus vodenast ali ipak dosta dobro i pitko pivo ...zivija oktoberfest..

A clear dark yellow body with a quickly settling white head. Nose has malty , spicy and herbal aromas. Taste is moderately sweet with a smooth dry finish. Soft carbonation and medium palate. Quite nice and easy to drink.

0.5l bottle. Golden color with white head. Malty aroma with herbal hops notes. Taste is medium bitter with sweet aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Overall it’s nice and easy drinkable beer.

A golden, strongly bubbling beer with a medium and white head. The aroma is pure and malty, some sweetness, honey, hint of grass and grain. Taste has rich malts, some sweetnesss, mild bitterness is noticed as grass. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, quite smooth. Just like as I expected, smooth malts, low bitterness, pure.

for some reason, this beer tastes like the 1st taste of beer i ever had; the way beer is supposed to taste like, without tasting beer before ever.
or not, as it always depends on one’s personal enjoyment.
but it is very tasty.

Clear golden-yellow beer with white head. Malty aroma with a light sweetness. Light-bodied, average carbonation. Just a short and slightly bitter finish. This is what you expect of that style. Really quaffable, well-balanced but also quite boring.

Draft at SB. Pours a slightly hazy medium gold with a dense and creamy off-white head. Spicy sweet nose, showing a little bit of tangy banana and some light herbal hops. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Very softly toasted biscuit along with plenty of herbs, banana, and a bit of clove on the mid palate. Long clean finish.
Smooth and delicious, which is precisely what an Oktoberfest beer ought to be.

Pours clear golden, slight thin white head, nice thin lacing. Aroma bready, clove, noble hop, slight fruity, a little banana. Taste balanced, slight clove, spicy noble hops cuts the sweetness from the malt, definitely Munich, maybe Viennaand Pilsen a bit of crackers, fruitiness and slight clove, banana faintly detectable on the finish. Mouthfeel medium body and mudium-high carbonation, slight spicy bite from the hops, clean almost dry finish. Overall one of the classics in the style, very flavorful, almost rich, yet very drinkable.
In fles van 0.5liter op het oktoberfest. Helder geel van kleur met een matige schuimkop. Drinkt erg makkelijk weg met een klein bittertje in de nasmaak.
0.5l bottle at hotel imperial München for oktoberfest. Yellow colour. White tastefully head. First impression : watery, good taste. Little bubble. Good to drink a lot of!
uma boa cerveja para comemorar a data, bom equilíbrio malte e lúpulo corpo médio
Klart og veldig lys farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt og gress. Smak av malt, gress og lett sitrus. Melkebaren.
Great Amber color, good malt flavor a bit subtle, no overly pronounced flavors, good beer

Very malty and slightly alcoholic taste. Poor with fragrance but feel a little malty aroma. Weak bitterness which fills the lower part of the mouth of a weak moment. Not impressed at all on me. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Syrlig duft av malt og høy. Dekkende skum. Klar gyllen farge. Syrlig smak av høy og en anelse sitron.

Pours clear golden with a medium-sized frothy white head. The aroma is very malty, in a pale, grainy way; cereal, hay, herbs, not much else. Taste displays the usual clean maltiness that is typical for German lagers. Some sweetness at first, later drier herbal notes where hops add their small contribution. The palate is medium bodied and the carbonation soft. Nothing special here but variety of the taste is not the point for Oktoberfest beers.

Bottle from the "best of Munich" variety six pack - mostly clear blonde - lively carbonation - nose is pleasant.honeyed maltiness, some floral, almost musky hoppiness and perfume wildflower character - soft malt texture in the mouth - moderate sweetness, fairly rich malt, but light and airy at the same time - some balancing floral and grassy hops late - lingering clean sweetness finishes, along with a touch of spiciness - nice lager.
Light orange colour, white head. Aroma of hay, bread. Taste is light sweet, slightly bitter. LIght body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation.
Solid, light and sweet beer. Nothing special but it has a nice wheaty sweetness, good to drink.
@ Nedre Mölla 16/9-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Malty, hayish, notes of DMS. Taste: Malty, sweetness. Body is medium, the finish is dry and light bitter with notes of DMS.

Classic German Oktoberfest. Doesn't get much better than one of the originals. Would drink this anytime it is available

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ljusgul vätska med medelstor ganska snabbt försvinnande krona. Vissa rester lämnas på glaset. Doften är svag med inslag av bröd och gräs. 
Smaken är lättsam men något fadd med en liten avvikande smak som jag inte kan sätta fingret på. Ingen riktig höjdare .

The best Octoberfest Beer I’ve had so far, so I give it top ratings.
Nice we’ll balanced taste, aroma and after taste, that holds up well pint after pint.
I’d rate Spaten #2, Hoffbrau #3, Warsteiner #4, thirsty Dogs Barktoberfest #5, Great Lakes #6...
Incredibly, alll of these great Octoberfest beers are currently on tap at the Firehouse Grill at Rockin on the River in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio.
Where Ocktoberfest is being celebrated this weekend.
They also have 2 great German Hefe Weizen beers, Weihenstephaner and Franzenhaner.
Can’t wait to do it again tonight !

Flaska från SB. Gyllengul vätska med vitt lågt skum. Maltig och gräsig doft. Lätt sötma med ett neutralt avslut. Ingen smakbomb, men det är något särskilt att en gång om året få njuta av en oktoberöl.

50cl bottle. Clear golden colour with a nice white head. Malt, light yeasty and grassy hops in the aroma. Average carbonation and light body. Taste is light sweet and medium to light bitter with a dry grassy finish. Overall, a normal unexciting beer.

Slightly sweet aroma, with a touch of caramel and bread. Pours a clear light yellow/amber with a thin white head. Very light bodied, with a thin mouthfeel. Light sweet flavor, with just a touch of caramel in the finish. If you like sweeter beers, you will probably like this one more then me.

@ Havregatan. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget (22:-). Malty with yeasty and grassy/hayish notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and bitter with grassy and light honey notes.

500ml brown bottle, label picturing healthy looking women carrying beer cans. Pours clear pale golden with a medium sized frothy beige head that reduced quickly leaving no lacing. Aroma of cereal and wheat bread. Flavours of wheat bread, honey and a hint of alcohol. Taste is light sweet and medium-light bitter. Palate is light bodied, thin texture and average carbonation. Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier is a standard plain Oktoberfest beer, unoffensive and unexciting.
This beer is good I am not a dark beer drinker but I have found this one and like it pretty smooth beer.

Bottle split with Adnielsen. Clear golden pour. Aroma of spice and white bread yeast with hints of citrus and sweet malt. Taste is bitter, sweet, malty, grassy. Finish is dry and bitter. Easy drinking.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought in Konstanz, Germany. Enjoyable beer.
 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not bad. Improved by drinking in a full litre glass. Not quite up to the standards of the other beers in its genre.

Pure transparent gold, light carbonation, medium strength white head. Fairly neutral aroma with hoppy notes. Bitter-sweet taste with a hoppy bitter finish. I can see why this is Oktoberfest beer, very palatable.
1L can in a 1L mug. Brew of 2012. Always wanted to have that souvenir mug. Beers is also good. Not quite märzen, but a good example of oktoberfest brew :-)
Pours clear straw color with white head. Cereal like flavor and light bitterness.

Giant can! Pours mostly clear gold with white head. Aroma is bready and cereal malts, light toast, light caramel, light mixed nuts, and faint dates. Flavor is bready malt base with light hop bitterness and some dark fruit and caramel sweetness. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.
Light yellow pour, no head. Smells like a breakfast cereal with a hint of banana. More sweet than not. Middle is malt and a slightly cloying sweetness. Finish is much the same. ????
Aroma floral e levemente maltado. Coloração amarelo palha e translúcido. Sabor doce do malte e um amargor gostoso que fica no retrogosto e convida para mais um gole.

Clear golden with only the slightest haze. Rare slowly rising bubbles. Aroma is gummy. As for the taste, for a second I thought it was a dos equis but it tastes too gummy like most cheep beers made in germany. Forgettable paulaner. They should really stay away from wheat beer and capitalize on the pils.

Inside the big liter mug the body has a deep golden color with good clarity visible carbonation and a tall bright white head. This head slowly settles down to a much smaller cap that hangs on till the end. Lacing is slick. It has white bready maltiness with a nice nutty character and some leafy/earthy/spicy noble hop notes as well. The flavor is very similar to the aroma with the same base of clean bready malt and noble hop notes. Its medium bodied extremely drinkable and lively carbonated.

Bottle pour. Clear, honey yellow with two fingers of head. Pleasant nose of honey, wheat thins, and mild cereal. Medium-light body. Cereal and honey, with mild grassy hops. Faint earthiness. Average carbonation.
Pours a slightly cloudy orange color with white head. Caramel malt and light hop on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more maltiness and some wheat.

1 litre can. This came with a giant mug to make it even more fun to drink. For a stronger beer it taste quite light. Taste somewhat grassy sweet, with a little bit of spices going on. Had some actual mouth feel to it, that was pleasant a little bitterness on the end. Good Summertime beer, This is actually the next beer I am brewing at home, so I look forward to it.

From 0,5l can. BBD: 08/2014. Pours, clear yellow to light golden liquid, plenty of small particles floating inside, small white soapy head, fell down quickly. Aroma: nice malty, grass, but low intensity. Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, malt, alcohol, Palate: medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, malty aftertaste. Overall: not the best beer from Paulaner, drinkable, but simple in taste and aroma.

500 ml can. clear gold color with white head. first taste are a bit bitter from hops with some kind malt aroma. aftertaste are nice bitter from hops with malt aroma and dry finish with soft water. refreshing tasty beer.
Clear yellow, medium white head. Malty, grainy aroma, sweet and malty flavour. High carb, slightly dry finish. Boring.

Pours golden yellow with a big beige head, good retention and very fine lacing. Aromas of orange, biscuit, earth, grass. Light body, smooth, velvety. Mild-medium sweet, light citrus, gentle bitter finish. Sessionable, enjoyably sweet, not particularly exciting.

Man vergisst beim Trinken dieses Biere sehr schnell dass es sich hier um Oktoberfest Bier handeln. Irgendwie kommt bei Farbe und Optik nicht ein Festbier im Sinn. Es wirkt einfach wie ein Helles und nicht wie ein Märzen / Export. Dies ist kein schlechtes Bier - Einstieg ist sehr spritzig und kohlensäuren reich, zu wenig Würze im Körper und Abgang (wie soll sich dieses Bier gegen ein Händl oder sonstige Mahlzeit nur wehren?). Insgesamt ist dieses Bier fast eine Light Version von Oktoberfestbier.
Good looking golden beer. Taste of bitter hops and malt. Nice soft touch of yeast as well.
Great German brew, really smooth, a "go to" Oktoberfest!!!
Pour, yellowish with a white head, sweet taste of honey and malt, slight bitter to finish, average Oktoberfest.

Bottle from my Dad. Clear amber with a thin patchy head. Typical helles slight-sweet-and-salty-malt aroma. Taste is fleeting and watery and rather deceptive given the ABV, which adds nothing to it. Average.
I really liked this one, easy to drink and quite sweet. Nice orange colour. I’ll definitely have this Oktoberfest beer again !
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, würzig, leicht fruchtig. Geschmack würzig, malzig, leicht bitter hopfig.

Pours a clean, clear, golden color. There is a white frothy head, about two fingers of it, that soon settles to only a halo around the edge.
Not much to the nose, there are however some malts and grains to be picked up.
The beginning is neutral, slight sweetness, followed by a balanced body, some more bitterness perhaps, coming to a nicely bittery finish.
Nothing special, but still enjoyable.
Tap at One Pint Pub, Helsinki. Originally rated 09092011. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.

1L can, BB 29.04.2014. Pours clear light golden with nice white head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet, malt, grain, corn and herb notes. Taste is sweet, some sourness, grain, and malt. Finish is nice dry bitter and some hay. Overall: it’s drinkable, but nothing more.
Cerveja bastante marcante sem aroma forte salientando o amargor do lúpulo tipico de uma cerveja de paladar forte com teor alcoólico de 6.0%, preferência em consumir-la bem gelada.
Comme souvent, pas d’arômes au nez de cette Oktoberfest nier. Mais on sent les céréales au palais avec une certaine complexité intéressante.

I did the worst 1L can pour ever with this holy. 2 inches of beer and 12 inches of foam head. Aroma of straw and corn, taste is pretty much the same. Pretty much a classy Oktoberfest Budweiser. Meh. The cool can and fact it came with a huge glass for $5 sold me on it and didn’t disappoint!

From an epic 1 liter can. Pours clear amber with a bubbly, fizzy white head and foamy lacing. Tastes like dry malt, grains, corn, lightly nutty. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like musky, corn, light apple cider.
light bread aroma,yellow,clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, lively, long finish, very drinkibel beer.

Light golden coloured and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Flavor of light bread and light hoppy notes. Real harmonic. Flavor starts sweet, light sugars, then heavy hoppy flavor, finish moderate bitter. Nice.

Appearance: Clear pale golden color with a big white head. Ok lacing.
Aroma: Malty and mild grassy.
Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet and an ok bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Caramel malty, mild hoppy, light fruity and some grassy notes. 
Overall impression: Pleasant refreshing beer.
 Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with McTapps.

Poured from 12 ounce bottle purchased at Whitey’s Wine and Liquor, tasted on October 19, 2013. Clear golden color, sweet and skunky aroma, good sweet malty taste with more than enough balancing bitterness plus wheat notes. Although the label gives "5/14" as an expiration date, something seems a little off, although it’s still quite decent. And despite the note that this isn’t the same Oktoberfest marzen sold in the US, the bottle label had wiesn printed on it and it looked different than any other Paulaner labels I’ve seen sold in America, so this is where I’m rating it.

Cerveja Clara,espuma pouco densa, pouco amarga, 6% alc. Alemã. Sem aroma marcante. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dourada e translúcida. Creme branco bem formado.
Aroma de malte bem marcado. Lúpulo gramado bem suave e no fundo. Bom aroma doce.
Um pouco doce no sabor. O álcool aparece no fundo. Amargor leve.
Corpo médio. Baixa carbonatação. Final adstringente.
Não sou muito fã de lagers, mas esta é interessante.

Very slightly sweet aroma. Urine yelow color(!) not so nice because it is so pale. At the same time 6% abv but it is not in the taste. Simple not wide palete. In Octoberfest probably would take another one, but not now.
Sweetish aroma, not very nice, bit metallic. Yellow colour. heavy cloying sweetness. thin feel.
Really enjoyed this beer. Really good beer. Clear apperance with great taste. No after taste.

500ml bottle, 6%. Golden lager appearance with good head. Malty and slightly sweet - this is a pleasant and refreshing beer. It is straightforward rather than complex which ensures it is nothing out of the ordinary. Enjoyable all the same

Pours amber with a thin white head. Nose is musty. Taste is slightly bitter. Thin body, mild carbonation. Average beer, but I wouldn't turn one down.

Bottle
Aroma-hops, yeast
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam,

Overall- very good with mexican dish :)
The aroma is caramwl. Spicy, wheat, clove. The appeanance is haxy amber, white head. The flavor is sweet, caramel, bubblegum, spicy, clove. The finish is spicy, noble hops. Medium in body. Not bad.

Dark golden in color, clear with white average top. Flavor is a bit astringent lagerbier with more malt profile, seems like dark caramel mix with toasted malt, but without caramel in flavor. Hops are far, far away, not even in aftertaste. Some sour touch in taste. Medium bodied, watery and not thick. In few words - darker malts lager, nothing to retry.

Reviewed 7.1.10
Poured from bottle to New Belgium tulip.

A: Orange and ruby. Excellent clarity. Low-carb appearance with no head and only sporadic bubbles/ribbons.

S: Sweet and malty. Roasty.

T: Toasted oatmeal is the dominant flavor of profile.

Golden colored beer with thick white head. Bitter and sweet and spicy taste. Little dry in the end. Medium body and carbonation. Preety decent.

Bottle. Clear golden/pale, minimal white head. Couldn’t sense much aroma, since I have a slight nasal congestion ATM. Slightly bitter. Average carbonation. A bit too watered down for my liking. Definitely a drinkable beer, though overrated.
Si sólo esta birria hubier probado seguro hubiera sido de las mejores pero como tome otras no
From bottle. Gold pour. Little bit of white head. No retention or lacing. Nose is grainy with some skunk. Lots of carbonation. A little old-tasting. Passable.

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear, golden yellow beer with a thin white head on top. Aroma is rather yeasty and malty, nothing more actually. Flavour is medium bitter with some slight hoppy aftertaste. Big lager influences making it a kind of bland and mellow. Very easy sessionable, but not much special

330 ml bottle into dimpled mug, best before 5/2014. Pours fairly crystal clear golden amber color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of bread, toast, cracker, honey, pear, apple, light caramel, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance of malt, yeast ester, and hop notes; with good strength. Taste of bread, toast, cracker, pear, apple, honey, light caramel, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of bread, toast, cracker, pear, apple, honey, light caramel, light pepper, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a bit. Damn nice balance and robustness of malt and yeast ester flavors; with no cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and slightly creamy mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Oktoberfest style. All around great balance and robustness of malt and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Clear Gold Color, Big White Frothy Foam Head, Lots Of Lacing. Light Grainy Aroma.Malty, Sweet, Light Dough, Faint Sour Finish. Hides ABV Well, therefor is Easily Drinkable. Nice Thirst Quencher, not much more... Good...

Appearance: clear deep yellow with one finger of soapy white head that shrinks to a creamy collar, leaving clingy lace.  Aroma: slightly musty grain, some cracker, honey, and grass.  Taste: sweet and sour, with honey, lemongrass, hay.  Finish:  	surprisingly dry, with a bit of alcohol warmth (?!). Notes: Unexpected characteristics all around. Color was much lighter than the traditional amber. Alcohol was present, and the finish was very dry. More like some sort of crazy Helles. After having the Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest from the same brewery, I don’t know why you’d try anything else in the Oktoberfest style. That’s the gold standard right there.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber with a off white head. Taste slightly sweet, malt. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2oz bottle. Filtered yellow-tan body. Soapy, fading white head. Light golden malt, some deep lager tones and noble hops. Lighter than most examples of the style in color, but still has some deep malt depth. Perfectly balanced by the noble hops. Classical, well done beer.

There seems to be some confusion about Paulaner beers. This was a 6.0% Oktoberfest Helles brewed in the Munich brewery, 1l (!) can in Belgrade from a real Maß glass. Nice amber colour, sure there would have been more head on draught. Really rich bready aroma that you can smell as it pours (at least from a huge can!). Tons of honey sweetness, like a Helles squared. Flavour unfortunately duller, more watery, though some breadiness and interesting peppery alcohol. Bit of sweet vegetal stuff going on. Slightly odd in all, if not unpleasant. I’ll be buying the last stocks of this in Belgrade for the novelty and glasses at least - unless luttonm beats me to it.
Pour from bottle, a light golden color lively liquid. Smell citrus and taste a little bit bitter. I was expecting something great, but it’s only something good.

1litre can, hauled, along with the matching, huge glass, from Germany, by my good mate Joe Button Moon. Straw colour. Thin, white head. Aroma is sweet, bready malt. Some lemon, maybe. Taste is yeasty dry. Some toast sweetness on the lips. Crisp, alcohol evident palate. Off dry, lingering finish. Cheers, Bin Lid.

2013 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a very light, clear yellow with lots of carbonation and a big white foamy head. Aroma is tropical fruit esters, yeast. Taste is grainy, slightly sweet. Watery mouthfeel.

Pours clear yellow with a nice off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a medium-bodied wheat flavor with a slightly bitter finish.
DWG; On tap. Pours clear golden. White fast fading head. Light fruity hoppy, malty, grassy aroma. Taste mirrors. Watery texture with a short finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
on tap. clear yellow with dense white head. hoppy and breadish aroma. medium malty sweetness well balanced with hops. dry finish.
Bottle. Pours yellow with a White head. Grassy hops. Good bitterness. Solid German lager.

Good head, pours light brown, medium carbonation. Aroma of malt and straw. Taste is much the same. Bought the 1 litre can and giant beer glass combo, mostly for the glass.

Pours in clear light body. Foam is very low. Aroma has hints of acetaldehyd, malty. Taste has light sweet malt notes with almost bitterness. Body is medium, dry with good carbonation. Little bit bored.

Serving: Bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a light gold with a small white head. The nose is very light with a little malty sweetness but not much else. The flavor has a light honey sweetness up front with a little hay and yeast note. Very light bitterness. Light to medium body. Decent.
Clear golden beer with medium white head. Aroma of sweet malts and grain. Easy drinkable with a taste of sweet malts, little hops. Nice session beer.
Poured a deep golden with thick white head. Lighter color than American Oktoberfests but great tasting medium bodied.

50cl on tap at "Oktoberfest" at Alexanderplatz, Berlin. Clear golden with a white head. Moderate malty hints of fruits and herbs. Moderate sweet with quite pleasant bitterness. Easy drinking and quite nice. Medium body with average carbonation. Nothing special, but quite okay.
Clear golden appearance with medium head. Malty aroma, slight yeast scent, medium sweetness, low bitterness. Light body, very refreshing. Goes well with 1L festive glass.

Servi à la pression en 50cl. Une bière très blonde magnifique avec une mousse onctueuse.
Une bière basique en goût on sent bien le grain mais peu le houblon, bonne bière de soif.
Bottle from Super Best, CPH - Pours slightly fuzzy golden yellow. Grassy, straw, doughy bread and sweet malts/yeast, pleasing floral notes as well. of bread and yeast. Thirst quenching and very good.

Had a few of liters of this at the Paulaner tent at this years 2013 Oktoberfest, or assume that is what they were serving us! Anyway, firm head upon getting the liter krug, nice smooth beer, went very well with my Schweinshaxn and pretzels.

Very drinkable Oktoberfest. Makes me want a pretzel,brat, and some saurkraut balls!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice beer, comes included with a 1L oktoberfest glass. Pilsener-ish with a nice malty flavor, quite bisquity actually! :) awesome!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Malty sweet with moderate hop bitterness. Kinda OK balance. Nothing special, thou easy drinking thirst quencher. .sadly - nothing more
Bottle. Smooth, easy to drink. Malty octoberest with hops as a secondary property. Not bad.
Pours crystal clear with a tight white head. Aroma - grassy, sweet cereal, biscuit, subtle. Taste - crisp, clean, the biscuit note is good, touch of sweetness. No sign of any alcohol, very drinkable.

Sweet hay, straw, soft butter cream. When I taste this beer I’m transported the the Theresienwiese. To me, its the only beer of this specific style I have had in the US that looks, smells, and tastes identical to the festzelt pours. Great with roast chicken, bread or brez’n, obatzda... Take heed Americans -this is what an Oktoberfest bier is supposed to taste like. Not that amber colored over-hoped stuff. Pour in a maß and enjoy. Prost!

33cl bottle. Small white head atop clear apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, banana, some cotton candy, clove, light lemon. Taste is moderately sweet, banana, some cotton candy, light clove, bread/caramel. Soft light-medium body.

330 ml, bb 05/14 and labeled "Oktoberfest Wiesn". Clear golden body with a few bubbles that support a lasting thin disc of cream on top. Mild aroma of husky grain, caramel, citrus and grass. Уважаю эту фирму, потому и взял. Не сказал бы, что остался доволен. Просто не мой стиль. Но оценки не занижаю, т. к. не пил других о-фестов.

From a 11.2ml bottle. About $9/6pack from Binney’s in Skokie. This beer pours a light golden color, a bit darker than a helles with a thick fluffy white head. Smells like a helles but has a bit maltier taste with a bit of a sour finish. Full bodied without being cloying. I can see why you’d be able to drink many liters of this in the tent. This beats the "Oktoberfest Maerzen" by a wide margin. This beer is distinguished from the "Oktoberfest Maerzen" by the designation of "Oktoberfest Wiesn." What a shame we in the US have been duped into thinking that Maerzen is the Oktoberfest style. I really enjoy the specialized helles style that is Oktoberfestbier.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is toast and nutty malt with earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is malt and hop balanced, a clean lager character and a sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.

The flavour is moderately sweet throughout, with honey, caramel and noble hops. It becomes a little more bitter towards the finish, ending on a long herbal note. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a dryish texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a decent Märzen, but quite a bit lighter than American versions. 2012-12-22

1 litre can from World Market with glass, Pours a deep golden with half an inch of white head that lingers. Nose is grainy, earthy, edged with some spice. Taste is sweet malt, bready and lightly caramelly. A touch of bitterness is in the finish which stops it being cloying. Perfectly reasonable beer.
Draft. Light golden pour with beige head, pretty bubbly. Flavor is light but full of caramel and breast malt tones. Nice drinking brew. Aroma has some fruit like malt tones.
golden yellow. beautiful foam . commercial version of strong lager. not fine malt. finish quickly. sweet and something alcolic.

Lightly sweet and malt dominated. I don’t know, maybe I’m just not a fan of the marzen style or I’m just not a fan of this beer. It’s fairly good and very drinkable, but it just didn’t seem to have anything at all really special about it.

Had on tap at Oktoberfest Zinzinnati.

Pours a clear gold with a one finger white head. Pretty ordinary looking but nothing really detracts from the appearance.

Aroma of bready grain along with some hay and grassy hops.

Flavor continues with they grain with tons of hay and grass from the hops. There is a touch of caramel but less than some of the other Oktoberfest beers I have had. A little bit of honey too. Finishes on the dry side which greatly increases drinkability.

Overall, probably my favorite Oktoberfest to date. This beer is just made to drink liters and liters of under a tent during Oktoberfest. An extremely tasty and quaffable. beer.

Bought the giant can that came with the dimpled mug. Poured a hazy pale gold. Slight head. Mostly caramel malt aromas. Highly carbonated. Dry cereal notes. Some melanoidin aftertaste. Not bad. It can’t hold a candle to Ayinger Oktoberfest, but not bad.
caramel, bread, herbs, leaves, alcohol, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, sticky, average carbonation, long finish,
Gold,lasting white head.Faint sweet nose.Light clean sweet profile, faintly hopped.Easy drinking. Great lacing on glass

Pours hazy gold with white fizz. Smells lightly of grainy sweetness. The taste has a tasty golden sweetness with a musty earthy grainy light spice. There is a pseudo commercial lager taste but it quickly leaves got a full grainy lager flavor that is satisfying and very easy to drink. Tasty aftertaste, honey like sweetness.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; part 3 of 6 Oktoberfest mission, pours straw yellow loads of carbonation reminds me of mass produced lager drinking days :(.
100cl. Pours bright orange with a huge white head. Light aroma, the taste is common but a good flavor. Somewhat biiter. Overall good
Surprised this is rated that high.  It’s a fairly vanilla Helles.  I find flaw with how sticky the mouthfeel is.  Rein that in a little bit, Paulaner, and make it crisper.
Surprised the reviews have been that positive. Honestly, this beer is pretty non-descript. Not good or bad. There are much better marzens out there.
Pours clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is sweet malts, grass and some butter. Flavor is malts and some hay. Sweetish palate.

Barva zlatá a při nalití se tvoří vysoká hustá bílá pěna, leč nedržící. Vůně nabízí příjemné tóny sladu, v pozadí můžeme cítit i nádech koření. Výrazná chuť chmelu, středně hořké pivo s výrazným chmelovým dozvukem. Chuť celkově vyvážená a pivo má správný říz.

From the 1L can into the provided 1L glass.  This is the only way to get it where I live.  Can says ale, but it reminds me of a lager, a cheap one.  Certainly the stuff you put down by the liter.  Hoppy, earthy aroma, but not typical of most Bavarian brews.  Taste is bready, cereal, and a little honey sweetness.  Big carbonation and very thin.  Overall, not the best of Paulaner,  but I know it is designed to be consumed in bulk quantity.
Draught at bar. Golden color, white head. Malty taste with citrus, toast and grass. Light body. Pretty good brew.
Halve liter fles. Goudgeel, redelijke kraag. Ruikt wat moutig. Weinig body. Niet zo lekker als de löwenbraü  oktoberfestbier.
Clear yellow colour with tiny head. Aroma is grain, malt. Flavour is malty, sweet, alcohol.

Pours golden. Poor head and last very little. High drinkability. You can hhj ave a good party with this beer, but not a special moment.  Aroma malt and aome sweet flavor. Great.sensation and perfect carbonated syle..a good beet for party

Poured into big mug from 1L can. Beautiful golden amber with thick 1" foam that slowly dissipates.

Sweet malty aroma. I get a little honey and citrus. Wonderful light Marzen type taste. Lots of carbonation. Light palate. Sweet lightly biscuity flavor faint honey. I could drink a lot of this.

I haven’t found this anywhere other than in these limited edition cans. Kind of limits the "drinking a lot" idea. I guess I need to go to Germany.
Draught at the Flying Saucer on the Lake. Clear copper/brown color with a nice white top and nice lacing. Caramel, roasted, and other malty flavor. Palate is watery and medium carbonation.

1l can my mom brought from Germany 


Head: medium, white, creamy/foamy 

Colour: slight hazy yellow 

Smell: wheats, irony, hops, tad of sweetness/candy , some malts 

Taste: sweet malty with yeasty notes and citric flavours , main flavour is a bit of wheats and bittersweet ... not that bad ( note i drunk it ice-cold )
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Very quaffable, sweet and easy to drink. Aroma of dark chocolate, flavours of roasted peanuts.
0,5 l bottle shared with McTapps. Pours in deep yellow with a nice white head. Even if it is drunken a bit too warm you don´t taste the 6%. It´s a beauty which hits you in a strong way. Great beer.
Poured deep yellow with an off white head. Aroma was raisin, sugar, caramel, and earthy notes.

1 L can from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Pours light yellowish-orange with a foamy off-white head.  Aroma of light caramel malt and faint Earthy hops.  Taste is mildly sweet hops, wet grass, and damp cardboard.  Easy enough to drink so it’s not that bad but the best thing about this is the cool mug that comes with it.

1L BFC (nice) in a Paulaner maß, what up?  I drank this AT Oktoberfest 2009, it’s every bit as good as I remember.  Rich yellow color, little lacing.  Great palate, super easy to drink.  Rich, grainy aroma as well.  It sacrifices complexity a little , but this is a superior beer, no doubt about it.  I could (and have) drink it all day long.
Bottle@home, 50cl. Head: White colored foam. Color: yellow golden. Aroma: almost none. Taste: hops, mild bitter. Palate: mild, CO2, thin. Overall:  could do better.
0,5l bottle. Deep golden color, clear. Small white head, stays. Sour, grainy aroma. Aroma is weak. Watery, grainy, dusty flavor. Sharp mild bitter carbonation.
Nice clean, tidy easy to drink beverage.  Really smooth, soft and pleasant to drink.  Goes down so easy.  Nice neutral beer flavors without being bland!

Originally reviewed: 11/8/08. Pours a tawny brown with about an inch and half foamy head. Nice bubbles coming off the bottom of the drink. Clear as crystal. Weak retention and lacing.

Smells of spice and floral hops. Some citrus also. Nice malt sweetness pulling through.

Taste of slight spices. Good balance of malt and hops with low bitterness at the finish. 

A little watery, but smooth nonetheless. A pretty good marzen, but I’ve had better.

On tap at Gasthof’s, Northeast Minneapolis.  Light yellow color, with just a little haze.  Flavor has simple malt and yeast.  Flavor is simple and mild, intending for drinking in quantity, and sacrificing flavor and aroma to get there. If this beer was inexpensive, it would be a good session beer, but it costs to much, and has nothing to offer.
Crosp, strong, bubbly, refreshing. Pours light yellow cloudy with a thin head...one of the best Oktoberfest brews I’ve ever had.

Pours clear gold into a Stein.  Bright white head with medium retention recedes to skim rim. Cookie aromas. Soft with sweet caramel upfront turning to a hint of bitterness before the sweet bready finish.
Poured from a BFC.  Very light in color.  Very sweet and malty.  Definitely tastes like a German beer.  Easy drinking.  Goes down smooth in a big mug.

My favorite German Oktoberfest. Served on tap at Billy Groat Gruff’s in Ourray, Co., you’d think you were in the Bavarian Alps. Amber-orange colored. A sweet finish to the bottom of the stein. This brew was invented by Spaten, but Paualaner has perfected it to be a great beer with German sausage, hackbraten, or eisbein. Prost!

Bottle. Pours a pale golden body with a white head. Light bread y malt tones, a touch nutty. Light malty sweetness, a hint floral a note of honey. A hint of floral hop tones, with a light cracker and cereal notes. Soft clean, but nothing special.
Pale yellow clear body with white tight head. Aromas hops , malts, grains. Palate thin with lively carbonation and mouth feel. Aftertaste sweet malts and medium short hops finish.

Deep orange color with a medium mouth feel. Complex malty taste up front with a dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the 1 quart can stamped 05-20-11-02:20:12.  Cool big can!  I am saving this one.  The pour is pale yellow with a tremendous shaving cream foamlike head.  The aroma is vibrant with German malts and yeast. The body is medium and smooth and holds its texture on my tongue. The taste is vaguely malted but also oddly bitter.  It is a decent seasonal.

I would recommend it I you want a light beer but I would get the Salv. Over this. 






---Rated via Beerology

Can. Golden beer with an off-white head. Light malt and light earth aroma with light grass. Light caramel flavor with light grass and light earth. Medium bodied. Light caramel lingers with light grass and light earth.
Really malty nice beer - no idea if it’s a good example of the style but I liked it

Trader Joe’s was selling big, huge aluminum barrels of this stuff. I exaggerate, but the cans on display were more-than-generous; more apt to be footstools or pieces of a makeshift barrier than a beer serving size. Still,　splitting one of these azure monoliths with a friend didn’t seem too greedy. Orange and frothy, this looks like a festival beer - good for celebrating outdoors where heady rays of sunshine and noise from adjacent crowds make good complements to the otherwise simple notes of honey paired with the crispness of pilsner malt and sharp carbonation. Unengaging, the Pauler Marzen is best left to being a session beer, or served with powerful dishes, or to slake undiscriminating thirsts. It deserves a glass boot more than a chaise.
tasted in 2009 and 2011. clear golden beer, tasty, slighty bitter. good oktoberfest bier

1 litre can with Paulaner dimpled mug. Bright clear golden yellow, lasting  foamy white head. Sweet grassy, grainy lager malt aroma. Not to sweet malt taste, balanced with a firm hop backbone. Crisp clean finish. Brewed for mass consumption. Great solid lager. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

It is virtually odorless but it pours a pretty transcendent gold with a thick white head full of carbonation.  It is relatively smooth & has a decent amount of flavor.  It’s ok & probably true to the form but I’m not a huge oktoberfest fan in general.
floral, cereal, basement aromas, herbs, cough drop, licorice, rocky head, white foam, golden, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, salty, full body, creamy, lively, bitter,
Clear golden with nice white head and lace.  Grassy honey aroma.  Clean honey mild sweetness with grassy noble dry finish.  Simple but very pleasant.

Bottle (500ml from Peckhams, Glasgow):
Light & watery on the nose, this is not what I have come to expect from a Paulaner beer. There is some lager malts on the nose and a little biscuit along with a pilsener like aroma. It is a clean smelling beer with a sugary sweetness towards the end and some light alcohol grain notes.


Straw gold with a thin white head that is little more than a soapy lacing  for a head.


A clean lager like taste to begin with along with the usual malts that were mentioned in the aroma. There is also some vegetable adjuncts and a bit of grain and alcohol too. Again there is a sugary sweetness but it’s not strong on flavour.


Smooth & medium on the palate with a sweet, crisp finish that has a pleasant sugary feel to it although it is nothing special


Pleasant enough and a good alternative from the usual pale lagers but it was quite similar to them in a number of ways and it wasn’t good value for money.



1001 Beers To Try Before You Die:
Pours a pretty and sparkly bright yellow.  Aroma is mostly grain.  When kept cold this is a great beer.  As it warms, the flavors fade a bit.  Sharp and very easy to drink.
Cloudy straw - must not be filtered - big billowy head; apple aromas; sweet palate with a crisp finish. Good Oktoberfest bier

Pours a light golden colour with a short lived white head. Aroma is sweet, hoppy and some caramel and hay. Taste is also sweet and hoppy with grass and some caramel leading to a dry bitter finish. Not bad at all.
Golden color with an medium sized white head. Aroma of hay. Yeasty flavor. easy drinkable.
Really nice oktoberfest bier not the best beer but still really refreshing nice change of beer for me
Golden with a small white head. Malty aroma with a fruity hint.  Sweet and malty flavour with no particular character
Can. Light copper colour with a minimal head. Aroma of grass, malt and cereals. Sweet malty taste.

Bottle. Golden, very small and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and faint grassy hoppyness. Medium, malty and sweetish flavor, faint caramel and faint grassy hoppyness, faint alcohol. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, faint hoppyness and some alcol. Typical uninteresting Oktoberfest beer.

Bottle direct from Germany by way of air. Thanks, Rich! Golden pour, less carbonation bubbles on display than expected, head weak. The aroma was grass, grains, cereal, honey. The flavor followed, a firm bittering hop presence, somewhat pilsy flavored, full malt backbone, drinks refreshingly crisp. The mouthfeel was full and the carbonation quite low. A very nice o’fest!
Pours golden yellow with clean white head. Malty but not overly sweet. Has typical imported beer aftertaste which some people enjoy.  Good carbonation. Easy to drink. Very typical German type Lager.

1L can: Poured a clear golden color beer with a large foamy head with good retention and some good lacing.  Aroma is not the best with light notes of overcooked vegetables and lightly sweet malt. Taste is a mix between some light overcooked vegetable notes with some light malt with sweet notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not sure if this is really what people drink during Oktoberfest but I sure ain’t looking forward to drinking this again.

1L can purchased at The Cheesemonger Shop in Leavenworth, WA.  (Beer was part of a gift pack that included a 1L mug.   Appearance:  Pleasing golden color with a white head.  Aroma:  Sweet malt, freshly baked bread.  Flavor:  Sweet malt, mild hops.
From Gene’s with bonus glass. Pale gold color, sweet and malty, some hops at the end. Fairly nice but sometimes a bit sweet. Serving: 1L can

1 Liter Can 11/20/11 (Meijer Supermarket Gift Pack with Dimpled Mug)-46° in Dimpled Mug-Poured a dark golden light amber with a big fluffy white head. Aroma of malt, sweetness, wheat, and grains. Taste of malt, caramel, toffee, and grains. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and it goes down fairly easy. I am usually not a fan of this style but this one is a bit milder IMO.
On tap at hop angel.  Copper pour.  malty, yeasty aroma.  Straight malt, virtually uncarbonated.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Áttetsző arany szín, telis-tele apró felszálló buborékkal, tetejére pedig közepes méretű és hasonlóan kitartó laza fehér hab kerül. Illata malátás és szalmás, melyeken felül erős, ám nem a legfinomabb zöldséges komló érződik. Íze malátás, és a zöldséges, állott komló ebben is túl erős, nem a legjobb, inkább csak tovább édesíti. Utóíze kenyérbeles és nagyon kicsit savanyás is. Közepesnél egy fokkal testesebb, élénken szénsavas és nem túl száraz. Egy teljesen hétköznapi, unalmas és jellegtelen ízvilággal rendelkező, mégis ünnepi főzet. Sokkalta jobbra emlékeztem...

Thanks to my boss for bringing this 500 ml bottle.  It poured a golden yellow with aromas of malt, mild citrus and a touch of caramel.  Flavor was much of the same, had more lager qualities than a marzen in my book.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. I have never been a fan of oktoberfest beers and this is no exception. Light biscuity malts with a touch of grain. Easy going and balanced enough but a little sharp to finish with. Not very impressive

One Liter can in a stein at Costco for $5.97.  If I had more money I would have cleaned the palat they had since they dropped their previous price. Pours golden with a thick off-white head that stays around.  Moderate to low amount of carbonation.  Aroma of hops and some caramel malt.  A little on the thin side with not much mouth feel.  The ABV seems a bit high to call this one a session beer.

0,5l bottle @ Den Gode Nabo (Trondheim). Pours a small head. Pale golden in color. Not much aromas to pick up. Tastes like a lager/martzen. Not a taste experience of new dimensions, but a good "beerfest" beer. Not as filling as lagers, so you can drink some more of this than a lager. (My opinon). Prost!

1 litre, from a can into a stein. Clear golden in colour, thick white head. Wheaty aroma with some sweet touch I can’t identify. Lovely hearty wheat flavour, without that yeasty funk after taste a lot of wheat beers can have - very nice.
One liter can.  Pours a golden with medium fluffy head.  Flowery nose.  A bit of buttery malt sweetness with a balanced hop presence.

Pour is a light golden yellow, with a large foamy white head. Nose is of octoberfest. Yes, bad description but it smells like it does outside right now, so its what I’m giving you to work with. Taste is very indicative of the style, little hop presence, and a nice malty combination for a good, full flavor.

500ml bottle.
Pours a medium straw, white head.
The aroma is fairly light, some malty notes along with a citrusy touch, faint cardboard, and a slightly grainy smell.
Dry, light to medium body, quite low bitterness, lively CO2.
The taste is surprisingly neutral, malt with a fait bit of cardboard, faint hops/citrus, the alcohol provides a bit of body, but also some sweetness and afterburn.
I definitely think that an Oompha-Oompha brass band, a mountain of Bratwurst, and hordes of big-bosomed German waitresses would make me appreciate this beer a whole lot more. (2011-11-05)

Saw this in trader joe’s, thought it was the regular oktoberfest but turns out it’s not.  sweetish lagery malty aroma, pours a cool blonde with a nice sized head. that appearance would be good for a woman, as well.  flavor is bready, medium/light body, sort of creamy. a little doughy, i like that/  finishes sweetish, bitterness is there but a little subdued. nice enough especially for 2.99 for a L can!
Nice grassy hops, decent grainy cereal malts. Great carb, and body. Medium bitter finish. Nice stuff.
on sample not much head or aroma. very malty reminds me watery apple juice. crisp finish

Gift pack with 1L glass and 1L can of beer poured a golden color with an average white head and some very thin lacing.  Aroma of light cereal grain and a hint of grassy hops.  Taste is moderate hop bitterness with a hint of malty sweetness underneath.  Definitely a below average beer for this style.

I don’t want to call this beer a let down, because it is a session lager, and at the end of the day it serves it’s purpose. Body was too light for my liking, even some macro beers will fill the mouth more. Aroma was of a nice hop, like one in a Punk IPA, but not as harsh. There were characters of fruit, maybe a banaish type thing, too. The Paulaner-ness was there, alright, but just not enough of it. Taste was alright, if a little predictable. Bread and butter after taste. A little bit of nice hopping, and a subtle roast malt, too. As I said, it serves it’s purpose, but just pick up an Erdinger Oktoberfest instead.

Oktoberfest package including 1 liter can and 1 liter glass mug. Color is nice lager yellow with nice collar that disappears after a while. Smell is not that fresh but still a bit sweet. Taste is very goed, a bit strange and not too bitter. With licht sweet aftertaste.

1L Can - Pour is fairly clear light golden into this Paulaner Liter glass with a fairly nice fluffy white head that retains pretty well, actually - The nose is more or less what I remember from the fest - slightly floral, fairly sweet smelling - The flavor profile brings out the noble hop additions in a more specific way - coupled with caramel and sweet bread , and a hint of booze, actually. I don’t know how fresh this can actually is...

Tasted from bottle into nucleated pint glass. Poured a clear, deep, dark amber color with creamy off-white head, some retention, barely any lace. Rich aroma of caramel malt, very faint noble hops and fruitiness. Complex malty-sweetness with soft hops bitterness. Flavors of bread, toast, brown sugar, toffee, slight roasted barley. Medium body and well-rounded mouthfeel, dry aftertaste. A classic example of style. Highly drinkable and delicious.

Draft at Taps, Petaluma. Clear pale golden with foamy diminishing head and scant lace. Mellow hay, dust, and warm ripe grape scents. Mechanically flawless malty-beery taste, balancing sweet. Clean, easy finish with medium carbonation, lasting gentle bitterness, and a vanishing crunchy minerality.

Clear golden and boring looks. Medium but apparent carbonation. Grass, white bread, leaves. Bit much to it. Prickly crisp taste is the best I can say. Only the slightest bitterness in the aftertaste raises this above any pale lager. (50cl bottle, 2,25 EUR)

Tap @ Grunerløkka Brygghus. This is a a clear pale yellow-golden beer with a small sidesticking and bubbly head. Aroma is lagerish, with grapefruity-citrus and some malts. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied and the mouthfeel is quite nice and lightly slicky-creamy. Malty flavors with some sweet notes and citrus. Quite refreshing and I would imagine that this is one of those that’s it’s quite easy to drink lots and lots of.
huge can, bright gold with a white head.  nose is heavy on the caramel, light spice, dried malts, bread.  easy palate, flavor is like the nose, heavy on the caramel, spicy finish, dough aftertaste.
1L can. With a krug. Marketing points already. Pours an yellow orange color with a large soapy white head. Notes of grass, honey, wheat, caramel, and metal. Kind of a quaffer. Simple but fun. .

On tap@Patricks pub. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruitiness, yeast and grassy hops. Flavor is fruity and sweet with some maly, grainy and floral notes. Medium body, average carbonation.

1L Can.  Pours deep golden with a white, short lived head and lively carbonation.  Nose is of bready malt and herbal hops.  Body is medium and smooth.  Bready malt, grain and light noble hops fill the mouth.  Clean, grainy-hoppy finish.  Pleasant session brew.
Clear gold with a fluffy white head. Not my favorite authentic Oktoberfest beer but not bad.

Can. Pours clear darker yellow with small white head. Aroma is hops and hay. Taste is bitter and light sour. Palate is crisp with good carbonation. Finish has some citrus. Not very good but not very bad either.
Pours golden with white fluffy head.  Aroma is a musty goat, bread, and hay.  Taste is funky German yeast with a bit of a fruit punch aftertaste.  Not good.

From a 1L can.  Clear brilliant gold with a small fluffy laceful head. Big malty biscuit tones with a slight grassy hop. Big  flavor of biscuity malts, Munich malts, pilsener malts, and a balancing grassy hop bitterness. Pretty nice and crisp.
Bottle - pours yellow with a bright white head.  malt cereal aroma.  Quite a nice light malt flavour slightly sweet with a lingering after taste.  Like it!

Bottle. Pours a darker yellow color with a frothy white head. Aroma is of grassy hops, light caramel and sweet malts. Flavor is again of grassy hops, lightly spicy, with notes of caramel and sweet malts, along with a slight amount cereal grain. The body is light with a crisp mouthfeel. Overall a solid Oktoberfest.

33.8 oz can, best by 2/12.  Clear yellow straw with a fading white head.  Nose is cooked rice, dough and mild brown sugar.  Almost medium body with a sharp, refreshing buzz.  Taste is dull lemon, hard water and toast.  Cardboard and stale popcorn finish.  Decently drinkable but seems a bit off.

1 L can.  Poured lighter than I expected - kinda pale gold.  Small head.  Mild aroam is bready-malty.  And dusty, somehow.  Flavour is bread and hay, with a touch of noble hops.  Not bad, but I wouldn’t drink it again, except to be festive.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear, light gold, with a smallish white head, which does not last at all, and leaves no lacing behind. Very mild citrus mixes with some unusual herbal notes on the nose, with a touch of rye bread mixed in as well. Strong herbal hops introduce the beer, leading into some weak spice notes in the body. A lingering, dry finish blends a strong caraway flavour with an unfortunate metallic hint. Not the best beer out there, but passable enough, and presumably perfectly acceptable when getting ridiculously sloshed during a month-long beer festival.

Maßkrug! 1L can. Clear golden pour, sticky white head, sticky lace. Nose is of dusty malt, rather light. Flavour has some light malt notes, bready, very faint hop note on the end that lends a haylike character. Dry finish, slight grass aftertaste. Light body, soft textured carbonation. Light and drinkable.

Number 500....  I picked this one for that milestone, not because I loved it, but because it was brewed to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the Oktoberfest Festival, and because I recently drank it at the Delaware Saengerbund Oktoberfest.  I am looking at the 1 Litre commemorative can that we enjoyed there.  This is one of the lager-like festbiers, very sweet and thick in texture and palate, not a ton of personality.  I prefer the Oktoberfest Marzen beers, or even Pumpkin beers this time of year.  The can that this beer came in is great - an old style steel can, 1 litre in volume, nice graphics and the topper is that it has the history of Oktoberfest printed on the back.  Unique package and will always remind me of a great day.  Well, at least it was a great day until we drank so many litres that we lost Rolfie!  Still a great day overall!

It’s yellow.  Not amber, not pale, not hay... just yellow.  Mostly malty in the nose and taste but no great shakes.  The plus is I got it in a big-ass can that I poured into a big-ass stein and drank with thirsty relish.  It’s Oktoberfest season.  It’s OK. Not offensive but not great.  I would stock this at a picnic where non-craft folks may dominate and I would have another one (or two) next O’Fest but I would otherwise pass.  Better O’Fest beers around.
Big disappointment, I was expecting something special, this is just a strong lager, with a dominant metallic/alcohol taste

Bottle poured into a glass, 
this beer was a clear light to less than medium yellow-gold, there was a white cover, and it left nice lacing, 

this beer had nice malt, pilsner malt, light bread, light spice and herb hops on the nose, and a little malt sweetness, 

the flavors were light malt and bread, light spice hops, 
light malt sweetness, 
there was a nice light to less than medium bitterness, 

the mouth feel was light and creamy with more than average carbonation (almost lively), 

this drink was a nice German lager beer, light malt and hops.

Golden beer with light amber hue, big white head though quickly receding. Malty aroma, slight citrus, touch of hops. Flavour sweetish, bit of caramel. Rather thin mouthfeel. Not bad but not overly exciting either. Good atmosphere though ^_^

(draught Maß @ Armbrustschützen tent, Wiesn, München)
Tap. Pours a light amber. Has a flowery scent that carries through the taste. It’s okay but nothing spectacular.
Light, almost no head. Malty flavor with bread and nutty tones. Weak bitterness, some molasses and hay. Good for imbibing in large quantities.

Can @ Home. Pours light golden with a small fast fading white head, loads of small bubbles. Aroma of yeast, malt, grassy hops. Taste is bready malt, caramel, grassy hops, cloves, spicy. Medium body, lively carbonation. 250911

1L can; tap - light gold pour with a small white head. Interesting color/palate for an Octoberfest - a little lighter on both counts than most. Bready malts, some caramel, some floral elements, and just a touch of spice. Pretty nice.

1L can. Not sure if this is the US version but i don’t think so. Labelling on the can seems to be for Europe/Canada. Appearance: Clear golden yellow, huge frothy head. Aroma: Very spicy, notes of cloves, ginger, cinnamon, but I don’t find it that pleasing. Palate: Fairly thin bodied, but not watery. Pretty smooth, but it has a bit of a bite all the way through. Taste: Quite sweet. Not bitter at all. Kind of a simple beer. My first Oktoberfestbier. Not sure I like it.
50cl bottle. Golden coloured with a small white head. Smells alamonds, honey and malt. Tastes bubbly, malty and abit sweet with a bitter malt finish.

1 liter can. Poured aclear gold with a 3 finger frothy cap. Fairly well carbonsted. Aroma was demure - bready malts over some grassy-herbal noble hops, Medium-light body, light in character, slick mouth feel. Flavor follows aroma - bready toasty malting in front, rouded mellow taste hops show in the finish. Not the best Munich helles but a real ket down if you were looking for the amber marzen that is normally called "Oktoberfestbier"

I really love Paulaner but this was maybe their weakest beer I’ve had.  It has a lovely appearance and taste but I couldn’t get over the smell.  It smelled like wet dog.  After doing a Google search I find discussion that this is a characteristic in some beers.  I’m not sure if this is a typical note for this beer or if I just had an off bottle.  I’ve experienced this a few times before but this was the most pronounced.

I enjoyed the beer overall but it was hard to get over that smell, particularly after taking a sip.
Got this in a 1L can that came with a dimpled mug as a gift set. I really just bought it for the mug, but the beer isn’t bad. It’s good for drinkin in the fall.

I am pretty sure there is wheat in this. served 1L can in dimpled mas. fluffy white head disappeared fast, nice lacing beautiful deep yellow, smell carbolic acid-camphor (regular listerine?), raw bread dough, taste the same, light carbonation. i am glad I got a mas with the deal.

Bottle.

Clear golden with a huge white head. Sweet aroma of malt, grain and some citrus. The same in the taste. Thin body and not that interesting to be honest.
1 liter can into the big stein,  clear golden color with cottony foam, aroma of dried fruit and grain, flavor is fruity cardboard, metal finish

Bottle 500ml. A clear red-amber colour with a large off-white head. An aroma of malt, caramel and hops. The taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long finish.

On tap pour was fairly clear yellowish-orange with white head, not what I’d expect for a marzen.  Aroma had notes of grass, grain, biscuit, slight touch of caramel, with a touch of lemon in there as well.  Taste was pretty full bodied and full flavored, but not in the traditional style, with grain, grass and lemon notes moving into biscuit, slight hint of caramel, finishing slightly bitter.

(draft @ Tap and Mallet - Rochester, NY) Clear orange pour with a thin white head. Mildly sweet and caramelly aroma with not much else. Flavor is mild and sweet at the start with lots of bready and caramel malts. Finishes a bit thin with a very subtle sweet aftertaste.

Poured from a 1 liter can into a huge Paulaner mug. 

The beer pours a yellow color with a nice-sized white head. The aroma is a mix of bready malt and some grain notes. Not too much going on but nothing offensive. The flavor is more of the same. I get a lot of grain and bread notes with a little bit of toffee and a hint of grass from the hops. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Not really what I come to expect from an Oktoberfest beer, but you have to like the packaging which includes the 1L can and 1L mug for a nice price.

Review from notes at Peg’s Cantina on 9/10/11. 

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass. 

Appearance: Poured a dark caramel brown with yellow highlights and a 1/2 finger off-white head. Decent lacing.

Smell: Very German, traditional Oktoberfest aroma. Nice earthy malts.

Taste: Sweet German malt throughout with a touch of hops at the finish. Malty aftertaste. Not a complex flavor, but a good one nonetheless.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a fair amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Good drinkability. You could drink a few without much trouble.

Overall: Good beer overall. Definitely worth a shot.

1l can. Clear gold colour, low/medium head with some lacing. Grainy aroma. Taste is mostly grain with some hops and caramel. Lighter body than I expected. Overall, a bit of a disappointment. Thinner body and taste and a lighter colour than most North American beers sold as Marzens. I didn’t find it all that much better than an average wheat beer or a pils.
(bottle 9/24/10). Clear gold color. Medium white head. Light malt aroma and flavor. Avg duration. Dry, light bitter finish. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Fair lacing.
Bottle from Bier Imperium, Vienna. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grain. Taste,  malty, some bitter hops, hints of caramel. Bittersweet finish. Good.
Pours pale golden with a low head. Aroma is bitter malts, flavor is pretty much just malts. Clearly meant to be drank by the liter.

Half litre bottle, poor head retention. Pale colour, very clear. Smelled hints of hay. Very nice balanced sweetness. Very crisp and easy to drink. Nice mouthfull. The most drinkable oktoberfest beer i’ve had.
Interesting variant on Paulaners normal Pilssner. Nice and malt with some grainy and bitter notes. Nice body and pours golden with a white foam head.

Big ass can that came with Krug. Pours gold with white head. Aroma is very grainy with mild hop and light caramel. Flavor is much the same. Mouthfeel is light body with high carbonation
 . Overall, a bit disappointed.....taste like the pilsner with a bit of caramel malt extract added.

Draught @ Pub Kultainen Apina, Tampere.

Pours a golden colour without a head. Large lazy bubbles. Aroma of sweet grainy malts, honey and some lemon. Flavour of sweet grainy malts, honey, mild fruitiness and also some bread and citrus. Nice bitter hops as well. Medium bodie, high carbonation and a finish of bitter hops, quite strong lemon and sweet malts. Top-notch Märzen.

From notes: 1L can poured into a thoughtfully included stein.  Poured deep yellow-amber with a huge white head.  Aroma is grassy mixed with biscuity yeast.  Mild, but not too thin.  medium-bodied.  Flavors are initially flowery and grassy giving way to biscuity yeast in the finish.

50cl bottle in Munich
Decent white head.  Clear golden pour.  Quite refreshing

Ljus lager med alla den moderna urtvättade oktoberfestölens mer tveksamma karaktärsdrag. Klar vätska, lätt kropp där den ursprungliga maltiga märzenkaraktären helt försvunnit, lätt humlad och för lagertypen en alldeles för nedtonad beska.

I suppose this is not going to be the finest example of a good german beer, seeing as it came in a big 1L can.  Honestly, I got this because it also came with a cool german stein, and I really wanted to have another stein.  The beer is nothing special.  I taste no hops at all, mostly malt.  Not my favorite beer, but not the worst ever, either.

bought in a 1l can. pours gold with a very unstable head. smells alcoholic. tastes malty with a bit sweetness. a light citrus aroma. bitterness and taste of alcohol in the finish. i liked the other munich oktoberfestbeers much more!

1L can.  pours a clear gold with a large, frothy white head.  malty nose with notes of caramel and butter.  creamy medium bodied palate.  a textbook example.  malty, lightly sweet, caramel and light buttery notes, a faint finish of floral hoppiness.  well done.  love the autumn beer season!
.5l can at Paulaner booth, BBF. Pale, clear, german lagery body. Normal, sweet full wheat. Full, complex grass and herbs. Citrus, maybe lemon. Very creamy, nice.

Poured out of a 1L can into my free 1L mug. Brilliantly clear deep straw/honey color. Big frothy white head that quickly fades and leaves behind a bunch of lacing. Malty aroma with hints of yeast and lemony fruit. Taste is malty and sweet. Sweet aftertaste, almost honeylike. Nice filling beer that will be great in mass quantities.

Pack of six 0.5l bottles bought from Tengelmann in Bavaria. Pours gold with a medium-to-small (by Munich standards!) fluffy white head, malt and peppery hops on the nose. Fresh and hoppy on the palate, with a juicy malt bite cutting in, and then the peppery hops reasserting themselves. Lightly dry-bitter aftertaste. A bit too fizzy, but otherwise very nice.

Die Optik dieses Bieres stimmt uns mißmutig: Schnell verflüchtigen sich der rare Schaum und das nicht gerade üppig vorhandene co2. 
Beim Geschmack kann das Paulaner dann wieder deutlich punkten. Ausgesprochen süffig und eine wohl dosierte Herbe; der Abgang mit dezent malzigen Unterton. Keine aufdringliche Süße. 
Ein braver Bursche!Test vom 26.10.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Half liter bottle in Munich.  Suprised me how smooth this one was.  Very drinkable and smooth for 6 percent.
Bottle in Munich. Prefer the hefewiezen, but this is not bad. Clear and refreshing

One litre can that I received as a gift. Pours a hazy orange gold with a thin-moderate white head that lasted through the first two sips and left light lace. The aroma is mild bready malt along with some equally mild hops. The taste is a bit more flavorful than the aroma suggests with malt, somewhat bready, followed by some mild-moderate hops bitterness. No problems. Colorful and perfect body.

November 13, 2010 - Waterloo tasting with blankboy, jerc, mabel and tupalev.  One litre can (thanks to tupalev??).  Pale clear gold with an average white head.  Sweet and floral/grassy aroma, a bit herbal as well - good low-level sweetness and bitter balance, doesn’t smell like 6%.  Nice taste - clover, honey, fresh grass ... light and sticky mouthfeel, weak carbonation, with a sweet grassy finish.  Decent - good patio beer.

Very clear yellow colored beer with a large white head that diminishes pretty quickly. Smells malty, grainy, cereal, nuts. Taste cereal, malts and grains, lightly sweet and a light hint of bitter in the finish. Bit sticky and thin texture, low carbo and body.

0,5 l can found in Belgrade.  Light golden colored, very fizzy, with a thick long - lasting head.  Malty overall taste, with lots of caramel and butterscotch aromas. The aftertaste is both dry and a bit sour. Pretty good, like all Paulaner beers.
Can courtesy of my parents back from Munich. Heavy wheat notes, creamy, def Munich malts. Very refreshing beer. Big fan

One litre can that I received as a gift.  Pours a hazy orange gold with a thin-moderate white head that lasted through the first two sips and left light lace.  The aroma is mild bready malt along with some equally mild hops.  The taste is a bit more flavorful than the aroma suggests with malt, somewhat bready, followed by some mild-moderate hops bitterness.  No problems.

2010 version (July 10 ,2011)

0.5 can, quite old (bought this winter). Intense gold body with big creamy white head with good lacing. Nose is quiet, some herb and some metal (because of can). Aroma is full of malts, bread, some grassy hops. The 6% alcohol is noticeable but not so invasive. Fairly sweet, medium carbonation, medium body, a pinch of salt, long smooth bitter finish. Good one. (3.7)



2011 version (Sept 8, 2011)
50cl bottle: almost as above, without metallic notes. More crisp, dry and gassy than that aged can. strangely head is quickly reducing leaving no lacing. Body seems lighter and has a light harshness in the end. Still good, but not that difference with a regular lager. (3.3)



2012 version (Sept 16, 2012)
Same stuff, classic german blonde marzen, good head retention this time. Tingling hop profile while pale malts are lingering in the finish, still being short and somewhat harsh. You can feel the 6% abv, have a liter of this and you’ll be happy. (3.3)

Ein gutes Bier, besonders nach der alkoholfreien Variante des Paulaner. Vorweg, das Bier ist süffig wie Sau. Im Antrunk ist eine mittlere Süße und ein hopfiger Charackter erkennbar, im Mittelteil wird das Bier würzig, was zum Abgang hin den Hauptteil des Aromas darstellt. Dazu ist auch eine deutliche Malznote zu schmecken. Der Nachgeschmack verebbt erst nach langer Zeit und hinterlässt ein malziges und süßes Aroma auf der Zunge. Einfach nur gut! 	 
Test vom 25.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,14,13,12,12,13 - 12,95

Can: &nbsp Dull golden in color, thin white frothy head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Soft fruity and mealy nose. &nbsp Fairly strong pale fruitiness on the tongue. &nbsp Pale breadiness, some sweet mealy aspects, otherwise grassy and a little barnish. &nbsp Decent body, smooth mouthfeel. &nbsp A little cleaner and less mealy than the standard fair (Oktoberfest Marzen). &nbsp Not half bad at all. &nbsp Seems less mealy than others, albeit a bit lighter.

27 April 2011, bottle. attractive gold colour, clear, steady bubbles, frothy white head. first aroma is a lager hop aroma but this is quickly dominated by a malty, slightly sweet aroma. med body and moderately fizzy, moderately fizzy. decent malty lager flavour. not too sweet, bitterness is slight but present. it is rather refreshing though a tad heavy.

From a big ass can, poured into a big ass clear stein - I think it’s called a Mass Krug, or something like that. I hope so, I kept saying that in an exaggerated German accent the whole time I was drinking this beer. Anyway, a good lookin’ beer - clear orange gold, with a big rocky white head. Nicely sweet aroma and flavor. Very bready or toasty flavor, with more subtle sweet notes as it warms. Tasty stuff, actually.

At a tasting in the street party on Moriah road in Haifa that held in 2010, on tap, pours very light golden and slightly phosphoric with a nice high and thick white head that dissipates quickly but remained short, clear, metallic aroma in the palate, corn, it was hard to smell due to the smells of the food served in the street, nicely carbonated, taste of hay, straw and fodder, strange and sweet taste, light body, flowing, and overall a standard Lager and a disappointing beer.

Had a 1L can from LCBO and it came it a glass Oktoberfest mug. Beer was not stored properly and was a little skunky but wow it was still very good. Definitely a beer for Oktoberfest or any occasion where lots of beer will be consumed. Easy to finish the mug full of beer quickly.

5 000 ml can. From Germany.

Slightly hazy golden colour with tiny white head.
Sweetish yeasty aroma with lots of maltiness and bready notes.
Malty bready flavour with yeast and mild hops. Pretty ordinary Märzen.

Just re-tasted this and my earlier rating days showed some quite severe scores. The general drinkability this has for a 6% beer is great. 
Previous rating on 15/04/2011 = 5+3+5+3+10 = 2.6
50cl bottle. A nicer than usual golden pee colour. Citrus malt on the nose. Caramel, malt and a little vegetable on the taste. The palate is fairly substantial for a lager and there is a long zingy finish. A good refreshing beer but nothing special.

Reviewed from notes.
