Pours a moderate orange-brown with a white head. A bit of lacing on the way down my pilsner glass. The nose brings some light hops as well as caramel and bread. The flavor is a bit more plain with some light bready notes and a bit of caramel and toffee. Feel is nice with good carbonation. Hearty. Drinks quite well and is one of the classics, for me at least.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-02-2010
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and light hoppy - straw. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and bitter finish.  190910

Bottle.  Pours a pale golden body with a white head.  Light bread y malt tones, a touch nutty.  Light malty sweetness, a hint floral a note of honey.  A hint of floral hop tones, with a light cracker and cereal notes.  Soft clean, but nothing special.

1 liter can into a Paulaner mug.

It pours light for an Oktoberfest, but stunning, especially in the big mug. It is a dark gold with a foamy white ehad that billows high and sits for a while before receding to some very nice lacing.

The smell is a dougier, nuttier, heartier version of a Helles. It manages to smell true to style despite it’s lightened appearance.

The flavor is very nice, a Helles Oktoberfest mix with a nice hop presence. Fresh bread and nuttiness are the other predominant flavors. Sweeter than I expected. 

It is exceptionally drinkable for the style, just massive drinkability. 

An awesome beer.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 10-02-2010 04:22:05
Has a little of spice to it, but not too much so.  Good maltiness, stands up as one of the better Oktoberfests.

Bottle 500ml
[Trade by fonefan] Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt and hay. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

1liter can in a dimpled mug.  Pours golden with a thick white head.  Aroma of light malts, some honey and dough with light fruit.  Flavor sort of the same, with nothing really sticking out.  Just a German beer.

Bottle 500ml. @ home.

Clear medium orange yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to light light heavy malty, grain, toasted, sweet malt, honey !Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110107]

.5 liter bottle. Aroma is sweet and floral. Hints of apricot and orange blossom. Pours clear pale yellow-orange. Much lighter in color than most other oktoberfest beers. High carbonation. Taste is light, malty, and sweet. Very drinkable. Not much hops evident. Overall a nice take on the style, though thinner and lighter than most.

Kan 100 cl. i sæt med krus på 1 litter.  Klar bleg farve med et stor langt varende, skummende hvide hoved. 
Aroma og smag, moderat ristet malt med en forholdsvis sød smag, noter af gær. En forholdsvis sød finish. Alt i alt en forfriskende og let drikkelig øl

Rich with a golden color and fresh aromatics with a mild spiciness. Full nectar with good carbonation. Goes down easily with flavors typical of an old world style hefeweizen although it’s all barley. In a blind tasting I would have lost this bet.
Clear pale white head sweet lager that must be consumed cold as the flavour goes of quickly. Low carbonation, low flavour of sweet malt and very little hops.

My can [1L] shared with HogTownHarry, tupalev, jerc & mabel. Pours a clear gold with an average size diminishing frothy white head. Aroma of Saaz hops, honey, some cereal and caramel malt. Flavour’s the same, slightly sweet with caramel malt, Saaz hops, some grain and honey. Average to medium bodied. Nothing bad, just nothing special -- a fine beer.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Sour floral, light sweet malty aroma. Clear golden color. Minimal white head. Light sweet, light sour. Very fizzy.

1 Liter can.  Pours golden straw with a large frothy, foamy head. Aromas of grass, bread and a touch of spruce. Tastes similar to many german lagers to me. Palate is also similar to german lagers. Overall decent, but not great. i did like the liter size.

1L can and mug set. Poured clear pale color with a large frothy white head that was mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted sweet malt and yeast aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a Medium sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met.

Tasted from a one liter can purchased in Denver, Colorado. Light yellow orange appearance with a nice foamy pearl white head. Really a nice floral, german noble hoppy, pale, pils malty aroma. Floral, creamy, noble hoppy goodness with a light, tasty pale malty flavor. I could (did) drink five maß of these in a day. This really isn’t a Märzen- more like a Helles.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hoppy aroma. Bright golden yellow colour, not much head. Flavour of hops, bread & cereal. Resin aftertaste. Interesting - lager ++.

Draught, small stable head, clear golden colour, light malty aroma featuring bread and honey, with a hint of spiciness, flavour of honey with some herbs, a little too strong malty sweetness with a light bitterness that doesn’t diminish in an instant. Quaffable but nothing spectacular.
1l can - Gift from JJ, Dusty nose, good carbonation and lace, white head.  Visually impressive, but tastes as metallic as the can it came in.

[3469-20101113] 1L can. Toasted corn bread aroma has mild floral plastic notes. Clear, light yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Plastic light straw yeast flavour has sweet cereal characteristics. Light-medium body. Boring but for the sweetness.

(c/o tupalev, w/ him, blankboy, HogTownHarry, jerc)
Canned in a 1L size into a Mas Krug.  Poured a gold, lots of foamy head (hard not when you’re tipping a 1L can).  Grassy notes etc, tasted like a regular helles.

Draught at Porter & Sons in Tel Aviv. Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma has some bready malt and a bit of slightly grassy noble hops. Sweetish malty flavor with a bit of bread, light grainy hints and a crisp, bitter, hoppy finish with herbal and grassy notes. Light-medium-bodied. Not great but quite refreshing.

Pours clear amber with big off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is roasted malts, hops, caramel, hay, fruity and slightly nutty. Slightly sour lean and sweet mouthfeel. Not too heavy, acidy sour, malty, hoppy and fruity sweet flavor with notes of alcohol. Nice lean palate. Finish is very dry tart hoppy. Refreshing and tasteful.

1 liter can/mug set from Gobell’s in Wichita
Pours a nice glassy yellow with an aroma of slightly sweet malt, bready honey, and earthy hops.  Flavor is matly sweet vinegar bread, wet roasted leaves, and light butter.  Average mouthfeel.  Not bad; very German.

1 litre can from LCBO.  Pours a clear, bright golden colour with large, rich white head and some retention.  Aroma of sweet cereal grains and some mild fruity notes.  Taste has cereal grains and more prominent sweet fruit.  Medium body.  Decent but nothing special.

2010-11-13. Crisp yellow body with a small foamy white head that fades. Sweetish cereal aroma is grassy, with very muted grassy hops and a kiss of honey.  Flavour is similar, sweet pale malt is quite cereally. Average palate. Inoffensive but dull. Giant can shared by Tupalev

A színe nem túl érdekes "alap" sör sárga. A habja is hamar elillan. De nem is számít mert azért eléggé itatja magát a nedű. Finom malátás, mézes illat karcos alkoholos sármmal. Belekortyolva először a savas, pezsgős indítás rögtön utána jön a maláta végül nagyon finom könnyed komlós keserűség. 
Plusz egy kellemes, karakteres vasas, fémes összetevő. 
Nagy a legenda és hírhedt sör de azért annyira nem jó viszont bármikor jöhet.
Very ordinary flat and dirty beer.  Was not expecting this to be that bad.  No wiesn that i could discern.

Can - 1L in a gift set with a 1L glass stein. Golden amber pour with a tall, foamy white head. Aroma is malty and sweet with big grains, soft fruity notes and bubblegum/candy-like notes. Taste is sweet malt, light caramel, soft fruit and more bubblegum. The taste of the bubblegum is like the cheap stuff put in a pack of cards. Body is medium with a strong carbonation. Ends with more big malt notes, light caramel and light fruit and more candyish notes. Worth it if you like the glass that comes with the set, but more "meh" by itself.


RE-RATE1L can. Gold bodied with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is grainy and sweet with malt notes, light fruit and bubblegum notes. Taste is baseball card bubblegum, sweet malt, a touch of caramel, light fruit notes and grains. Body is light-medium with a strong carbonation. Finishes with more bubblegum, sweet malt, fruit notes and grains.
bottle. probably best widespread octoberfest bier. great smell, color and head. very good taste, very eyjoyable.
50 cl cab. Clear dark yellow with small diminishing white head. Flavour is malt, sweet, dry and bitter hops.

1L can pours gold with a large dense white head.  Aroma is sweet with notes of caramel, bread, and grassy hops.  Flavor shows the same with honey sweetness followed by clean hop bitterness.  Not overly complex but pleasant to drink.

1L can from the LCBO with a branded stein. Pours a nice gold with large white head. Aroma is just cereal grains with some subtle Noble hops, not a whole lot going on. Flavour is much the same, nice pale pils malts upfront met with some good peppery hop zing, fading into faint notes of biscuity malts. Tasty, but not overly interesting or impressive. The hilariously over-sized can and Stein that come with it are worth more than the actual beer. By no means bad but why is it the LCBO refuses to bring in a REAL Marzen?
1L can, served in its 1L glass. Enjoyable lager, more floral and flavourful than most. Very sessionable and easy to drink as it’s meant to be. Unsurprising but solid.
500 ml bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts some sweet and spices taste malts spices some sweet and hops
Smaken är trevlig lättdrucken och har ganska tydlig prägel av söt malt. Som sagt, en trevlig törstsläckare som säkert gör sig ännu bättre med lite kryddig korv.
Bottle from New Seasons - Pours a darker yellow.  Very smooth with a slightly oily aftertaste.  Great balance.  Nice German beer.  Makes me want to go to Munich.

Pours a clear yellow with a thick head. I gave it a 5 for appearance in part because of the giant mug. It has a fresh malty aroma with light floral hops. The taste is of velvety smooth, doughy barley with a hint of peppery hops in the fairly crisp finish. Thoroughly mediocre beer, but it was an awesome experience to bring Oktoberfest into my own home. :)

1L Can served in 1L Mass, 200th Wiesn Anniversary Bier.  (06.16.10)

Pours orange blonde color, white fluffy head.  Aroma of a lager.  Straw, pale malt, boiled potato, cereal, light toffee, and loads of herbal hops.  Love those hops!  The tastes is very herbal. Almost like herbal toothpaste.  A hint of metal.  Lots of toasted cereal in the finish.  Odd to taste so many florals first and then finish with the malt.  Very nice cereal with a touch of nuts.  It is gonna be a good day... Gemütlichkeit.  Prost!  

Happy Halloween and My Rating #2800.



$9.99 for the collector glass w/ beer.

Clear bright pumpkin orange with a generous head and thin lacing. Bready malt, some caramel, and a hint of herbal tea on the nose. Rich toasted malts dominate the flavors, but just enough bitterness to prevent this from being annoyingly sweet. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, lots of carbonation, and the malt richness lingers nicely.

1 L can in a gift pack from LCBO, served almost cold in its own Mass. 



App.:  Clear deep golden with a smallish white head.
  
Aroma:  Grains/cereals, biscuity malts, some resinous and slightly peppery hops, wet hay, very slightly fruity.
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation, smooth.
  
Flav.:  Grain/cereal, a touch of alcohol, less of the biscuit malt, still a touch of hops and fruitiness; dry with a limited bitterness and a biscuit, slightly sweet malt finish.



The kinda stuff one could drink litres of...in a tent...with roasted chicken and oompah music.  Prosst!

"1 Ale" can poured into 1L Paulaner Special Edition Mug.  Beautiful pour in the huge mug. Large 3 finger head foamy head that reduces to a creamy film atop a golden brew.  Bready and malty smell, not really a lot happening for me here. I can smell some alcohol.  Light and malty taste. I get a little bit of hops. The alcohol is hidden very well, but still present.  I was wondering how long it would take me to drink this whole beer, it went surprisingly quickly.

Bottle. Yellowish orange with a white head. Aroma has hay, bread, caramel and earth. Fat mouthfeel with sweet slightly toasted malt and little bitterness until right at the finish. Some nuts and metal. Not my sort of thing at all, but inoffensive if you’re eating.

1 Liter can from Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a clear amber color with a large frothy white head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel malts and earthy hop notes. The taste is caramel, faint fruity notes, and a floral hop finish with some faint herbal notes. Medium bodied and quite refreshing.

Bottle (BB Mar 2021).

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (grain, malt syrup), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly unclean.

Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation.

Syrupy sweet mediocrity.

A=Beautiful orange-red/amber with good head that fizzles away shortly, leaving behind minimal lacing.

S&T=Very malty, with some sweetness, backed up by some hop extract in the background.

M=Medium-bodied, average with just the right amount of carbonation.

D=Very pleasant, smooth and easy to drink,can drink all night. A perfect session brew, and great for this time of year.

Another quality Oktoberfest brew, great for any Oktoberfest or for any time of the year, for that matter.

1L Oktoberfest can from Liquor Barn - Pours bright golden with a nice fluffy head. Notes of bready, chewy malt, herbal, spicy hops. Medium bodied, light sweetness with lush carbonation. I enjoyed this one thoroughly in its accompanied mug. Quite fresh and easy to drink.

Canned on June 16th 2010.  1 liter can sold with 1 liter stein for $12!  Sick deal especially since the beer is actually good.  Pours a nice bright clear golden with a massive white head- some sticky lace- and good carbonation.  Aroma is toasty biscuity bready, fresh german lager yeast, mineral, light grassy and floral hops, fresh cut hay and just straight up fresh pils malts.  Flavor is a bit more toned down- less bready and doughy, but more crisp, clean, light crackery, light german lager yeast character, pils malts, very light grass and hops and a very clean super crisp finish especially for being amped up at 6% abv.  Incredibly easy drinking and Im almost ashamed to say it is freakin easy to just sit and chug a good portion of this stein.  I will be on the lookout for more of these deals, not just for the cool steins, but also for the great beer!!!  Sidenote- this tastes like a slightly stronger Helles Lager.

Pours a clear copper color with a thin white head that sticks around and leaves nice lacing. Medium-body, creamy mouth-feel, some carbonation tickle and a decent finish. German malt aroma, toasted malt in the nose. Malty with a semi-dry finish. A solid Oktoberfest. Enjoyable.

Can 1000 ml sold as Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier 13.7 P

Aroma:  sweet golden malts with hint of berry. Slight hint of alcohol.6+

Appearance: clear amber gold with large frothy white top. Long lasting frothy top. Ornamental classic lace. Traditional perfect appearance straight from Paulaner 1 L mug.5- 

Flavour and Palate: medium full bodied. Medium light carbonation. Soft golden malty feel, slightly chewy. Very session like. Very little dryness. Good soft, friendly palate. Something you can have whole Oktoberfest night.

On Tap at the Thin Man, Denver 15/09/2010
Some malt aroma. Bronze coloured a little rich on the palate and fruity with a hint of dryness and bitterness in a full malt finish.
Clear yellow, white cover.  Aroma is grainy, toast.  Taste is more grainy, helles like, corn.

First Can date of June 2010, Second date of March 2011; Sampled October 2010

A solid pour from the can into my 25cl tulip glass produces a three-finger thick, pale, off-white colored head that leaves some thin lacing patternes on the sides of my glass.  The beer is a nice gold hue that shows an almost brilliantly clear, bright gold color when held up to the light.  The aroma smells of tin-like hops, soft doughy malt, some dried-grassy-cracker like grain character, perhaps a hint of lemon like hops that mix with a touch of honey like malt character.  As the beer warms the herbal / lemon zest honey notes become more noticeable. 



Crisp and cold, straight from the food fridge, this has a nice bitter hop bite to it and a dry malt character helps accentuate this.  This finishes with a pretty nice pale malt note that reminds me of pale grain crackers, a touch something that reminds me of dried barley still in the field, and even a touch of something that reminds me of a lemon / herbal honey that adds just a touch of spice to the finish.  Actually the hop character, while not over the top, perfumes the entirety of each sip and melds quite well with the pale malt character.  This is nicely quaffable (as a beer meant to drink by the liter should be), but does have some body to it; so it isn’t like a Helles.



This is a pretty clean lager that drinks like a slightly amped up Helles; this is definitely a good thing and I am definitely enjoying the interesting pale malt character and the herbal – lemon honey character that comes from the mix of malt and hops.  This is definitely an appropriate beer to drink by the liter; it goes down quite well.  Nothing earth-shattering here, but I am definitely enjoying this brew.

1L can (fun stuff!).  Pours a clear light orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of skunk, bready malt, cardboard, light skunky fruits.  Flavor of sweet malts and light fruits upfront with a bready malt finish.  A pretty bland beer, but the flavor is better than the aroma. [2.9/5]
Clear golden pour with large, rocky white head.  The nose is a typical barley malt and wheat aroma.  The taste is mildly sweet with lively carbonation and crisp, clean finish.

Clear golden/tan with a white head.  Not much aroma on this but a clean lager smell.   Fairly thin body with light maltiness with a bit of caramel and a somewhat lingering bitterness.  Easy drinking and that’s what it’s about.  **Update 4/23/2012** Had this out of the 1 L oil can for German Beer Day 2012 and I’m liking it more than I remember.   Adding some more points for tastiness.   Prost!

Tap. Light aromas of straw for the malt, herbs for the hops and leather for the yeast, with background notes of melon and some faint spice. Head is thin, wispy white with slight spotty lacing and good legs and is mostly diminishing. Color is crystal clear yellow, like white wine. Flavor starts slightly sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a lively carbonation. This Oktoberfest has some interesting aromas, but it’s just so light in every way.

Clear, medium yellow pour from a 1L can.  Fleeting white head.
The aroma is slightly spicy weak hops, and thin malt.
The flavor has some sweetness initially, but it quickly smooths out into a dry finish.
Certainly not a Marzen,  more like a Dortmunder to me.

Pours a light amber color with foamy, almost creamy head.The aroma is of wet grass, with malt notes.The taste is of a light sweet malts and metallic notes.The body was thin and the aftertaste was metallic taste.Overall it was ok.
(draught - Soulard Oktoberfest) copper with sweet malt aroma. Sweet malt flavor.

This beer pours a golden amber with a medium white head.  The aromas are bread, alcohol and dough.  The mouthfeel is slightly sticky and a little dry with a slight sweetness up front leading to a bitterness in the end.  This was a good representation of the style.  Cheers!
Draft at bar in NYC. Pours a clear amber body with small thin white head. Aroma is malts, caramel, grass. Mouthfeel is thin with some negative notes, some malt.

Paulaner Brauerei Munchen--Paulaner Wiesn Bier Limited Edition!  The authentic beer of the 200th Munich Oktoberfest--2010 1.0 Liter Can.  6.00% ABV.  20 IBU’s?  (2.5 / 5.0)  Oktoberfest.  Lacy 1/2" white good retention head.Clear fizzy bright gold color.Sweet Bavarian yeast mild Noble hop stank front.Smooth pale malt delicate butter sweet crisp clean pale caramel Fest body.Mild hop clean dry end.Odd Hops? Yeast?  Sampled 10/8/2010.  Purchased 2 For $12.49 @ Seattle Fred Meyer--Ballard on 9/25/2010

Presentation: It was poured from a big limited edition 1 liter can into a 1 liter Paulaner Masskrug. The beer came inside of the glass as a package deal. The can has a nice description of the Munich Oktoberfest and the beer. This info also includes its ABV which is 6.0%.

Appearance: Inside the big liter mug the body has a deep golden color with good clarity visible carbonation and a tall bright white head. This head slowly settles down to a much smaller cap that hangs on till the end. Lacing is slick. 

Smell: It has white bready maltiness with a nice nutty character and some leafy/earthy/spicy noble hop notes as well. 

Taste/Palate: The flavor is very similar to the aroma with the same base of clean bready malt and noble hop notes. Its medium bodied extremely drinkable and lively carbonated. 

Notes: All I need now is some good German fest food and maybe some lederhosen to go with the other Paulaner Wiesn beer/glass combination packs I picked up!!!

1l can, 6% a/v

The beer is a light golden colour with a decent head that sticks around. Aroma is very malty, a bit of alcohol and some cereal smell as well. The taste is also very malty with a light caramel and cereal taste. A bit too malty for my liking, would have liked a tad more hops to balance it. The beer coats your mouth and leaves you with its flavour long after you are done! Good beer, im just not a malt man.

Don’t know if is the same, but there is not other one in the site. Had it on tap at Katedralen in Oslo. Pours yellow golden with a decent white head. Hops, dough and some malt in the aroma. Hopy taste, some sweetness, some slight sourness and a light malty taste also. Refreshing. Average carbonation and a light bitter finsh. Very decent german beer.

On tap at Old Chicago Westminster poured a clear golden amber with a lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, light yeast and light fruittiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of wheat and light fruittiness with a crisp finish.

Aroma has lots of hops and lots of hops. Did I mention the hops in the aroma? Has a decent head though a little soft, body is light gold, lots of carbonation. Taste is mostly hops (fancy that), with a slight tinge of malt. Very nice dry German finish. Decent, reliable, but unexciting.

[Tap] On tap at a few locations in Oklahoma City as ’Weisn Bier’ with a cool pretzel tap handle. Pours a bright clear yellow color with a large white head. Aroma of sweet malts and grains. Crisp, grassy hops linger throughout in the taste. Sweet malty and cleanly lagered character. Good mouthfeel, high drinkability and true to style (in the German sense). This is a very nice brew.
Pours golden with a foamy white head. Aroma is bready malt and light hops. Flavor is sweet and malty with a bit of light hops.

On tap: Fluorescent yellow in color, sweetish malt but way less richer then i expected for an octoberfest, mainly grass, hay and straw notes dominated the flavor, easy drinking beer but nothing special really, quite dissapointing.

Pours a depp gold with a nice white head, not retained and not a lot of lacing.  Smells like rich malts, bready, caramel, with some hints of herbal/spicy hops.  Well carbonated, gives a prickly sensation on the tongue.  Medium body with a somewhat balanced finish, some drying on one side and sweetness on the other.  Taste follows the nose, rich malts, caramel sweetness with some breaddiness.  All over top of some hebal/grassy/spicy flavored hops and a bitterness to boot.  A very nice beer.

A - Spicy and fruity
A - Straw coloured with thin white head
T - Light sweet flavour with slight dry finish
P -Ample, but soft carbonation...definitely on the watery side
O - Have to respect it as a classic
Bottle. Poured a darker amber color with a small white head, the head went quick. Aroma was caramel, bread, sweetness. Flavor was spices, caramel. Sweeter aftertaste. Good beer.
Pours a golden amber color with no head.  Aroma of cereal and lemon.  Flavor is mostly grain with some lemon and grass rounding out the flavor.  Pretty good for the style.
About as good as this style gets. Just a good old fashioned beer. Nice and malty with a generous head. Well done.
Amber color with a fizzy white head. Aroma is malt, spicy. Flavor is ordinary malty with some hay-notes. Watery aftertaste and finish.

1L can in it’s own mug. Earthy and spicy hops, lightly toasted malt, a little lemon. Straw colored, bone white head, good clarity. Lightly toasted malt, with a touch of melanoidin rich munich malt,  spicy and lemony hops, clean fermentation character. Easy drinking, but with some German character.

0,5l bottle, light citrus aroma, fresh, pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, light bitterness, medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, average beer, nothing special
On draft at Stephanie’s. Pours a golden brown with no head. Malty nose with  some grassy notes. Nice fizzy mouthfeel with generous hay-like malts. Straightforward and decent.
Can. Aroma of amlt and slightly spiced. Clear yellow colour with white head. Ordinary pale lager flavour except fom som some malt.

Torr, motsträvig. Mycket malt. Känns som en öl som svarvats i träslöjden, lite hafsigt, utan riktig motivation och med bara en vag och rudimentär föreställning om hur det ska göras. Nej, Paulaner kan bättre än så här.

Dåse: Lys pilsnergul klar øl med et fint tyndt skumhoved. Duften er en kende mere maltet end forventet og har den ikke så gode dominerende lagerduft som især optræder i makroswill. Smagen er ikke så frisk som det kunne være ønsket, men ingen fejl og drikbar er den da.

1 liter (bad ass looking) can purchased at Lukas in Overland Park, Kansas. Pour is clear light golden with a well formed two inch pure white head. Aroma is light straw, mildly sweet malt, and not too much else. Taste is the mild straw, very light floral sweetness - kinda bland, but clean. Palate is light to medium, nice bright carbonation - clean and really easy to drink. Not super complex, but still nice.

1L can/stein. Can’t ever pass up the "free" glass with beer combo. Darker golden, nice rocky head, fades/returns with swirl. Cereal/toast, grass/hay for aroma. Flavor much the same, slight malt/cereal sweetness near backend. Medium carbonation. More of helles/maibock imo.

Very flat taste and feel.
Hops: citrus
Color: pale
Liquid: clear
Head: minimal
Initial: light sourness
Finish: light sweetness
Finish Duration: average
Body: light
Texture: slick, thin
Carbonation: fizzy

Pour is a bright gold with a huge white head outta the equally huge quart can.  Aroma is grainy/malty with not much else.  Flavor is the same.  Thick malts with a grainy aftertaste.  Not real great but brings back wonderful memories of being in Munich for the opening of Octoberfest.  Prost!
50cl bought in Düsseldorf.  Straw with a billowing white head; slightly spicy aroma; sweetish flavour. A pleasant Märzen.

0.5 l bottle from Systembolaget. Pale colour with medium sized, foamy head. The aroma is malty (bready) with some yeast. The taste is somewhat sweet and malt dominated with a medium bitter finish. Tastes fresh. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with some fizz. Quite drinkable. 7/4/7/3/14



Re-rating 20110924. Light golden, clear liquid with small-medium white, foamy head that dissipates fast. Aroma is quite malty with notes of bread, hay, noble hops, grass and is a bit nutty. Taste is clean, very lightly sweet and light to medium bitter. Very clean and balanced but still a bit malty. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. Overall, well done and clean lager with no disturbing tastes. One of the better German oktoberfestbiers. 6/3/7/3/13

bought this mainly for the damn fine glass that i will be using quite a bit. and it is good to start the day with a litre of beer before the sun comes up. went really well with my chicken and rice as i watched the sun rise. had to pause halfway through to take a shit that required 5 flushes and a plunger- it will be a good day- i do not blame the beer for that, i blame last nights dead animal orgy i cooked up. pours a dark yellowand has the scent of caramel, and straw,. very mild flavor, a bit of sweet with a harsh metallic finish at first that smooths out as it gores. bready straw flavor throughout this. enjoyable balance between sweet and bitter. an easy drinker that has treated me well.

On tap, pours a clear golden with a decent white bubbly head. Aroma is thinly malty and a bit of honey, some corn. Taste is also a bit thin but not watery, flavors of light malt, hint of honey and caramel and bready yeasty taste. Overall quite drinkable. Good, maybe not great.
Aroma is malts, honey and flowery spices. Taste is watery, fizzy, spicy and some bitterness.

After seeing the thread about the rating split, I was able to correctly identify this at the store or else I never would have known... ha.  Also, it was hard to miss the liter sized stein with the giant 1 L can of Paulaner Wiesn stuffed in it for a hefty $12.99, "commemorative pack" and I’m a sucker for that shit.  Pour a robust clear glowing gold/copper with a medium tall frothy sudsy white head.  I miss Oktoberfest beers... this year I think I’ll keep a case of Spaten in cold storage.   Flavor is crisp, bitter noble hops, edgy, metallic, smooth but noticeable warming alcohol, has a maibock-like richness, not sticky though, just a bit rich, some light grassiness, bit of breadiness, just a hint of apple juice, faintly spicy.  Smooth well attenuated, larger but quickly dissipating carbonation with just a slight sizzle, not sticky.  Pretty good and drinkable.  Flavors are clean but just slightly muted on the finish, fairly dry for style making for excellent drinkability.

Dont remember where or how...

Appearance : Clear pale yellow with a small foamy head. Short retention. Not much lacing.


Aroma : Malt, adjunct, light veggies. Some spices and light honey. A bit floral.


Taste : Adjunct, honey and a bit alcoholic. Carbonation quite fizzy.


Overall : Nothing really interesting...

12 oz bottle served in a tulip.  Pour is shimmering gold with two inches of white head on top.  Nose is honey, light caramel, malt, light hops, and an odd rain odor.  Taste is very similar.  This beer is very light and crisp, easy to drink, and makes for a fantastic session beer.  The various tastes are all mellow, yet very distinctly separate on the pallet.  This has to be one of the better Oktoberfest out there!

Bottle 50cl. A yellow beer with medium carbonation and head. A very basic lager, should this beer have any specificity because of oktoberfest ? Classic lager, medium sweet, low body, less hopy, some bitterness at the finish, common, nothing more to say.

from old notes Brilliant sparkling gold hue beneath a puffy white cloud.  Honeyed, toasty malts have a grainy edge sharpened to a leafy edge.  Thick malt flavor, grainy decoction traces, well balanced by firm hops and bright carbonation.  Slick, sumptuous and well-attenuated; lifting carbonation.  



Crisp, clean, delicious with deep golden malts.



50 cl bottle, best before July 2009.
Bottle. Light golg colour with a thin white head. Sweet aroma of malt. Malt flavour with a dry bitter aftertaste. Lively gas.

Not bottle fermented?  Aroma is of amazing dried fruits (+) and lager (-).  Taste is similar.  haha.  A really good malt keeps the score up on this one, but the aftertaste and palate are not up to grade.  If I was in a giant beer garden and had a litter of this in front of me, it would get a higher score, but as is, it is a good Marzen with a few flaws.

Bottle from "KülönlegesSörökBoltja", Bp.
Clear and deep golden pour with a nice creamy and laceing white head.
The nose is sweet, malty.
It starts with a mild mouthfeel and a sweetish, biscuit-liked flavour
The aroma has mainly a malty character completed by light spicy, herbal/hay and bottom fermented yeast notes.
The clean finish is tiny spicy, citric and a bit dry which remain in a herbal liked aftertaste.
In spite of its relatively higher ABV, it’s easy drinkable. 
Mild and rounded, but overall for me rather average...
Bottle. Nice light golden colour. Perfect head. Smooth and well rounded. Satisfying bitterness.

Bottle. Nice clovey, fruit smell. Soft on the palate with light carbonation and a slight hop finish. So easy to drink for a 6% beer. Would love to be trying a mass of this in the green and white striped tent at the fest again!
0,5 literes üvegből kiöntve világos aranyszínű sör bukkan elő, gyorsan elmúló krémes habbal. Illatában a friss maláta dominál egy kis karamellel. Ízében a komló és a maláta egyensúlyban van.
Good beer. Pours dark yellow with a small white head. Tastes a bit of iron. Smooth and easy on the palate. Great summertime beer from Paulaner.
Golden with a fragmented head. Malty aromas of bread, cereal and biscuits. The flavour is primarily malty, but the finish has of bit of bitterness too.

This is a beer for the expierenced taste. I have seen many of the reviews and am curious if we taste the same beer. The taste of caramel is over the top, to give a mouth watering  taste to it. The sweet taste gives way to a malty and slight bitter taste. The full balance a complexed beer that puts Sam Adams to shame. I have tasted this here in a bottle and in Muinch on draft. The beer transfer well, ever though the draft is a bit better as expected. What the Germans make beer like this, it makes you feel like we’re drinking Fords, when they’re drinking Porsches. You know what I mean. Ours is good, but theirs is better.

500ml bottle. Brilliant gold colour, bright and clear with a film of small sudsy bubbles that skim across the surface. Strong vanilla essence aroma with some metal shavings thrown in. Bitter with a long metalic aftertaste. Could not drink too many.

Bottle. Average white head over a brilliantly clear golden body. Spicey floral aroma, with a hint of applejuide like sweetness. A spicey-buttery taste, finishing with a touch of malt sweetness. Light bodied

Golden blond, small head, lots of carbonation. Hoppy aroma, also grain and barley. It’s mediumbodied, slightly hoppy, a bit hoppy and a bit sweeter than a pilsner. Normal finish, NIce beer but not so special to me.

1L can, comes inside 1L stein, pours golden highly carbonated with a huge white soapy head, aroma of malt, grain and brown sugar, sweet flavors of malt, caramel, corn, brown sugar and some herby notes, medium bodied, quite quafable.
Light and easy to drink.  Slight amount of hoppiness, light malt flavors.  Good festival beer.

Bottle from Arden Wines. Fizzing gold under a high white bloom. But it is in a Schneider Weisse trumpet. Sweetcorn relish, aspirin and mown grass aroma; blossomy hop and Munich biscuit once the head has gone. Papery and slick with a sprinkle of sherbet. Noble hops like pencil shavings, lemon curd on cardboard, breadstick dipped in honey. Disturbing Disprin-like aftertaste. Hops coniferous but industrial, malts bready but unassertive. Drab and efficient. Sorry.

Provdatum: 2009-09-25 
Flaska 8 grader
D: jäst/bröd... some en weissbier
U: houngsgul, nästan inget skum
S: jäst/bröd, citrus, sirap, fyllig och god
ES: lång skön eftersmak

This is currently available in Australia as the "Oktoberfest Bier to go" with a 1 litre can inside a branded Stein glass. It pours clear bright golden with a substantial foamy white head that lasts for several minutes. The nose is grainy malts with sweetcorn and subtle grassy/citrus hops. Flavours are similar with a light-medium body and thin mouthfeel with low carbonation providing very easy sessionability (ie. the whole point of this beer). It is a  good easy drinking beer but surely over-rated because of the "good times" associated with the consumption of it. At a well hidden 6%ABV, I can see why there are so many headaches in Munich every October!

Yellow, completely clear, with a rather big white head. Good head retention and nice lacings.

Light malts, white bread and a fresh mild herbal hop note in the nose.

The taste is rather sweet with malts and toast up front. Light but fresh grassy and herbal hop notes. The finish has some bitterness to it, a a quick hop flare and some malts. Clean and refreshing with decent flavors.

Moderate to light body, quite a lot of carbonation.

A decent beer.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

bottle- pours a faint amber color, lighter than the other oktoberfest beers I’ve drank, it seemed a bit spent, nice white head though. The aroma was very promising very creamy and malty with light fruity tones. Unfortunately the taste doesn’t do the aroma justice, quite bland and slightly metallic, in my opinion lacks the maltiness of the other brews. I’ll stick to the Augustiner or Spaten tent.....

Bottle. Pours clear, pale gold with a bubbly white head that quickly shrinks to a ring around the top. Light aroma is grainy and grassy with hints of caramel and herbs. Flavour is also light and very similar to the aroma: malt and some grassy, herbal hoppiness stand out with subtle citrus and caramel also. Fairly light bodied with a lingering bittersweet finish. Pretty good marzen.

A light yellow with a creamy and sustained head.  Very light Germanic hops offer a light respite from full sweet and thick maltiness.  Milky and a little claggy.  Could do with a slightly spikier carbonation I reckon.

Bottle.
Golden yellow just a touch darker than the regular. Good, fine, creamy head. Relatively strong aroma with slightly sweet malt and ok hops as well. Very malty flavor, slightly sweet, with a touch of fruit. Slightly stronger than usual. Medium light body, slight bitter hop finish, but not a strong finish at all. Decent beer, though not really all that exciting, though much richer and otherwise nicer than the bottled helles.

Re-rate (7/20/2013): 50cl bottle from Tengelmann in Munich. Pours a crystal clear, yellow-gold colored body with an inch thick, creamy, foamy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is lightly sweetened and somewhat bready with touches of caramel and maybe a hint of toast. Just a slight DMS note with a light fruitiness and a very light hopping. Flavor is similar. Lightly sweetened caramels with a very light toastiness, some bread, a light hopping, touches of fruit, and a slight DMS note. Finishes clean and somewhat dry with a very light bitterness. Short aftertaste following a light body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a decent Oktoberfest. Nothing special, but pretty clean and easy drinking. I’ll keep the same rating as before. Original Rating (10/19/2009): 500ml bottle. Pours a clear, copper colored body with a thin, white head that dissipates quickly and leaves a light lacing. Aroma is malty with a caramel sweetness, some hay, a light toast, and a hint of spice. A somewhat grainy nose with some citrusy lemon notes as well. Flavor is sweet with some slightly watery caramels, grass, a light toast, and some floral fruits towards the end. Finishes lightly hopped after a thinner to medium body. Medium aftertaste of thinner malts and a light fruity grass. Goes down very easy. Overall, not bad, but unexciting. Everything works well together for an uneventful, yet satisfying beer (6,3,6,3,13=3.1).
oro buonja schiuma piutosto persitente note maltate leggerissimo erbaceo in bocca maltata corpppo medio poco amara
Can. Yellow colour with huge white head. Aroma of malts. Flavor malt and some sweetness, a drinkable beer.
Sweet fruits in the aroma. The taste is malty. The carbonation is perfect! Very  good beer!

Draught  Bright-golden colour, under fluffy yellowish head. Maltbomb, with toasted aroma and bit grainy underbuild. Bit almondy flavour, and typical pale and lightly toasted malts. Light, with a background stickyness; certainly not empty. Quite doable, but I can’t figure myself downing litres of this stuff four hours.

Bottle. It pours a finger-thick white head over a clear, golden body. Some tropical fruits in syrup on the nose, with pale malts and some grass. Hayish, perfumed touch. Grainy, hayish, fruity, slightly syrupy nose with some bitterness. A bit sweetish maybe, finishing sweet and bitter. Would like more bitterness though. Overall it’s a bit on the sweet side, but it’s a drinkable beer indeed. 091010
Draft @ Monster B’s. Sweet smelling beer that’s well balanced and refreshing. Slight floral hop flavor. Nothing spectacular, but solid.
07.10.2009, 0,5l Bottle at Den Gode Nabo, Trondheim. Golden amber colour with white head. Aroma is malty with a fresh bitter aftertaste. Very nice and easy drinkable fest bier.

Canned sample. Gold in colour with fairly strong carbonation. Aromas are of pale malts, minerals, booze, and vegetal hops. Flavor wise, there are elements of white bread dough, loads of minerals (practically like licking wet rocks) and more veggie + peppery hops. Medium bodied. Very unlike anything other oktoberfests I’ve had in that it’s not all that bready, nutty, or caramelly. More like a suped up helles to be honest. Fairly drinkable, but smells and tastes more boozy than it really is. Average at best.

Clear gold with a white head.  Aroma is grassy and light malt.  Not much going on in the flavor besides the grassy hops and a light biscuit malt profile.  Boring and unworthy.  It was easy to swig though, so if you want to do that then this might be up your alley.

Bottle, 50cl - Clear dark golden color with a large white head. Aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and grass. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel and some German hops. Pretty nice and balanced.

Bottle 50 cl. Drank it with a friend while sitting in the garden on a nice evening. Pours copper with big white head and an aroma of sweet grain. The taste is mellow, but not in a bad way. Not too sweet, not too hoppy. Some sweet malts, some grassy hops, but all very smooth. Not too special, but I guess it’s a good session-beer.

From a bottle this poured in my glass as very clear gold with a fat creamy white head.  Nice lacing rings. Nose of malts and floral hops.  Medium body and smooth mouthfeel. Flavor is lightly bitter and the finish is dry and lightly bitter as well. A very easy to drink beer.
Bottle. This is a stable oktoberfest beer. Great balanced and with a clean malt profile.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours clear and very light golden.

Tastes and smells of vegitables and malt, so dull!

Bottle, bought @ CITTI, Flensburg.

Pours clear golden, lightly pale. Beautiful, creamy, white head. Long duration. Nice grainy aroma, crisp malts, light hay and grassy, flowery hops. Medium carbonation, fine dryish mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, grainy, malty. Discreet hoppiness, light dry, earthy and grassy hoppiness. Well balanced, but a tad too sweet for me.

0.5 L bottle from Systembolaget, Charlottenberg. Solid white head. Clear gold colored body. Sweetish, light bready, light grainy malt aroma. A faint whiff of dusty and papery hops. Clean-tasting, medium sweet malt body. Discreetly hopped, grass and faint lemon. Smooth, almost creamy in the mouth. Quite filling. Fine bitter and rounded malty finish. A well balanced, harmonius and reliable Festbier.

500 ml can, rather small head, pale golden body, aroma is of a good quality hops and malt &#40one type&#41 made on good quality water. Flavour ;between premium lager and strong lager, then herbs, grain and malty background, refreshing and very drinkable

500 ml bottle. Clear golden body with a white head. Grainy aroma with malt. Flavor is refreshing, smooth light malty, grassy, fruity and some hops. Medium body, quite ordinary, but nice thirst-quencher.
Another great representation of the style.  Malt and lightly bittered and hopped.  Sweet, and very drinkable.  Good stuff.
Clear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of malt and sweets. A flavor of sweets, malt and weak bitter notes.
Pours clear golden. Unremarkable aroma. Refreshing and a decent, if somewhat strong session beer.
Lots of spice and a little hops in the smell, great fruity, spicy taste and a lasting aftertaste.  The glass I got with it had a tuba on it, which is a plus.
Bottle. Pours golden with a huge frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel,. Taste is much the same, but richer on the palate, hops presence at the end.

2009-08 Pours light amber with a medium sized dense and moderately lasting white head. Light maltiness with fresh hops in aroma. Clean maltiness with refreshing hops in flavor and a long lasting not so bitter aftertaste. 
2010-09 Still light amber with thick medium sized frothy head which last for a while. Aroma is full or fruity hops with a refreshing apple like grassiness in background. Flavor is malty sweet at first, still on the refreshing side, and it finishes rather dry and bitter which makes you thirst for another sip.
12 oz bottle... one of my  all time favorite marzens.... malty, rich, and buttery... yum... i drink this all year round

1 liter can poured into a giant dimpled mug that came with it as a promotion.  Clear golden with huge creamy white head.  Aroma is caramel, biscuits and slight plastic.  Flavor is caramel and some spice.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is lightly bitter.

Overall Impression: 
A pretty decent example of the style, I like this beer, but I wouldn’t go out of my way to get one, I do find it to be a goo deal better on draft then from a bottle.

Flavors are very mild. Overall this gives the impression of a what a basic beer should be. The blandness of the main stream beers is said to be an intentional marketing ploy - "to offend as few people as possible." I believe that this beer is the best I have ever tasted which is not in conflict with that. In other words, anyone who likes the main stream beers should love this one.

If you want a lot of flavor look elsewhere.

500 ml bottle. It poured a clear pale golden liquid with a small white foam. Stingy smell of sweet malt. Smooth mouthfeel with just a bit of stingyness. Weak taste of malt. Watery and light body, low bitterness and no taste of hops. Not allot of carbonation.

Sötét arany sárga szín,vékony hab és malátás,gyümölcsös illata van.Íze is malátás,gyümölcsös de itt már jelen van egy kicsit a komló kesernyéssége is,ami az utóízben gyorsan eltűnik.Közepesen testes.Beszélgetős,társasági sör.
This beer was incredibly smooth and I enjoyed it immensely.  Wonderful taste.
Bottle as image shows.  Pours amber and smells of sweet spice and hops.  Some bready and pils flavors going on.  Lilvely.
Clear and yellow, thick white head. Nose of citrus and hops. Taste of bitter grapefruit and peel, some bread yeast. Crisp palate, bubbily and quick.
A good example of the style. I think if this was fresh on tap it would be better. It had that stale flavor german beers usually have in the states.  Good strong malt flavor, fruity, sweet. Enjoyable.
Aroma com notas de lúpulo e cereais. Coloração amarelo dourada. Espuma cremosa, mas pouco duradoura. Sabor bem trabalhado, com malte e algo de frutas. Muito agradável.

A clear yellow/golden colored beer, with thick white head. The aroma of a little bread, with malts, some fruits and yeast. The taste of soft malt with some fruits and hops. The aftertaste is a very little bitter with sweets.

Big frothy head nice gold pour good carbonation aroma hoppy grain maltiness fresh hay like flavour hoppy a mild crispness light bitterness of hops fairly sweet a real session beer easy drinking yeasty taste grain little fruity finish sweet dry hopy bitter.
Bottle. Clear golden body with a big creamy white head. Malty aroma with some hops and caramel. Flavour is sweet malty with some caramel, hops and fruit. Soft and creamy mouthfeel.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet aroma with grainy and caramel notes. Sweet falvour with malt, caramel and hints of cardboard.

50cl Bottle. Clear golden amber, white disappearing head. Aroma of malts and grass, some citrus, a bit skunky. Flavour is grassy, malty and some citrus, short hopbitter finish. Very pilsner-like, and not a very good one.

Meeting at DØE, Aarhus Syd, DK.
Can, 191108.
Orange-golden with white head. Aroma of malt and bread. Flavor is caramel malt and a tone of hops
Clear amber pour with a sweet caramel malt aroma.   Flavor is buttery biscuit and sweet apple with caramel.  Very good for style.  I would want to drink a boot of this.
Pale fast disappearing head. Mild nose. Mild hoppiness. Bright pale golden colour. Quite waterly. A 0.5 L bottle from Alko shop.

Botle in Berlin.
Pale lager, full malty body. Dry, sourish finish. Nothing to lift this, a rather boring beer.
Clear gold with a nice white head. Worty grainy aroma with bread and caramel. Clean crisp taste with grains and light hops.

Medium very white shiny fine-bubbled head. Yellow body with light carbonation. Milky fruity peppery aroma with sugary notes. Dry-sweetish grassy light malty taste, very harmonic, with caramelly straw notes. Dry peppery grassy spicy aftertaste. Clean, highly drinkable, but somewhat bland. A bit disappointing for Paulaner. (0.5l bottle, Systembolaget, Charlottenberg. Rerated at Hell Hunt, Tallinn, with much the same results.)
Pours light amber with a nice off white head.  Aroma is slightly roasty and caramel like.  Taste is caramel malt, very smooth and light bodied, but good.

0,5 l can. Clear golden body, medium white lacing head.Sweet buttery aroma of caramel malt, yeast, some fruity perfume. Smooth mouthfeel with nice caramel malt, good balanced carbonation, some fruity(wild fruits?) taste, buttery yeast. Good one to the fest:)
50 cl bottle at home - bought in Germany by my mother. Clear golden color, big disappering white head. Aroma is sweet with fruit and hops. Flavor is sweet malty, some bitterness. Metallic, dry finish

50cl bottle, clear golden colour, small white head, medium carbonation, very well balanced malt and hops aroma, light sweet flavor, light body, clean finish with some hops aftertaste, easy to drink, interesting
Amber pour with thin white head. Sweet malty aroma. Tastes of caramel malt, yeast, and mild spices with a balanced finish. Very smooth on the palate. Nice if a bit undistinguished.
A bit thin tasting, even for a Marzen, and not much in the way of spices. What I did taste was good but it could have been bolder.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Golden coloured brew with some fruity taste and some hints of caramel.
Golden colour, medium, lastingh head. Strong malt nots, slight hops aroma, very little bitterness. Creamy, greaton the palate.
Clear gold, weal notes of fruit and caramel, flavour is sweet, no finish.. well now I have rated it.......
Lighter amber pour with a foamy head.  Caramel malt and spice in the aroma and flavor.  A bit thin on the palate.  Good, but not great.

Tap at Heidi´s Bierbar Århus. Beer of The month october2008. Dark yellow but still far from amber colour, with a nice white foam. Aroma and taste of malts, bread, a bit caramel, hops and straw. Fresh mouthfeel but a bit short finish. Very drinkable all year around.
Can: Poured a golden clear with a lacing white head. Aroma is light with some sweet malt. Taste is metal with a sweet malt finish.

500 ml bottle. Pale golden and crystal clear. Medium-sized white head. Floral hop aroma with a rounded malty background. Feels very clean. Richer malty flavours with a texture that feels somewhat oily and thick. The background is sharply bitter, but not overpowering. Mouth is left in a dry, lightly puckering, state after swallowing. Feels a little like a really strong pilsener. Not particularly interesting.

500 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6.0%. Colden colour, big to medium sized white head. Nice aroma of fruity German hops and sweetish malts. The flavour is fairly sweet and malty but still smooth and easy drinking, with decent hops in the finish.
Can 50 cl. Pours golden with medium white head. Hoppy aroma. Sweet malty flavor with hints of caramel and fresh fruits.

This is a very suitable beer for the Oktoberfest if you are in Munich during the actual fortnight. Very drinkable, but in no way a fancy beer for connoisseurs. But what the heck, its made for drinking and having fun, Ein Prosit!

golden clear. Nice white foamy medium sized head. quite malty, fresh and lightly hoppy.
I expected more of this beer, but seems like it is made high volumes for the oktoberfest to be drunk lots and lots from a 1liter jar and not to think too much.

(Draught at Kitty’s, Helsinki, 2008-09-25) Pale golden and clear. Medium sized quickly disapperaing white head. Fruity, malty and metallic aromas in quite light nose. Medium bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Malts, metallic flavours, some bitterness and hint of raisin in tase. Very easy to drink despite the high carbonation.

I had a keg of it shipped up from Munich for a private Octoberfest party. Made for a great time. THE classic interpretation of this style. Hey folks-- Oktoberfests are meant as a darker, chuggable beer. Syrupy Spatens or unbalanced Sam Adams don’t ’cut the mustard’-- with brats ’n’ kraut or otherwise, like this one. Yum!
Clear light golden color and offwhite fading head. Sweet aroma. Malty flavor with hoppy dry finish. Medium carbonated. Not too special.

This is one of the beers that The Capital Ale House is celebrating this week.  The baer is a smooth drink with the hoppiness and fullness that makes it a very speccial drink.  It is full body beer that is worthy of the  beer of Munich.  I want to learn more about the Marzan style.
Draught@Rotterdam, Helsinki. Golden color, white head. Sweet malty aroma, very fresh malty flavor with just enough hops to make it quaffable. No noticable alcohol. It’s a good Oktoberfest beer.
I enjoyed the depth of the flavor - lots of malt and sweetness at the beginning and finished off with just a little bitter.  Good Octoberfest brew for sure.

a aparência dessa Oktoberfest/Märzen alemã não apresenta nada de mais. A aparência inicial da espuma é pequena, a cor alva e a longevidade reduzida. Há moderada formação de colarinho e o corpo é claro, de densidade rala e tonalidade amarela. No aroma, a coisa melhora um pouco. Farejam-se notas de pão claro, grama e caramelo. O agradável sabor é moderadamente adocicado no início e levemente adocicado e ácido no final, de duração média. No paladar, um corpo médio, de textura cremosa, carbonatação borbulhante e final ligeiramente metálico e levemente alcoólico.

(bottle) yellow-golden colour, firm white head. aroma of sweet pale malts, hops, light corn. flavour is pale malts with light caramel. watery, dry salty finish, light to medium body, mild carbonation, as boring as it gets.
Can.50cl. This beer seemed to lack any real taste. It goes down smooth and doesn’t offend in any way. caramel, pale, clear, a minimal head, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation.

Sampled at the JRHB club meeting.  Always a nice surprise to be at one of the meetings, sample a beer I know I’ve had many times before, and then discover I’ve never rated it.  I think that a lot of this is because with a lot of the "classic" examples, I had them for years prior to finding Ratebeer, but 5 years into it and 1900+ beers later, it is hard to remember some of these old brews.  In any case, medium amber, clear, slight head.  Aroma was lightly malty with faintly floral hops.  Flavor is the same, perhaps lightly grassy.  Not bad, not great.
No the best oktoberfest but its okay, the sweet hangs on for a bit, finishes decent.

This is a typical lager that I can get into, otherwise I find lagers pretty yucky... pours a deep amber with a small head, smell of candied, rotten, sour fruits... easy drinking and mildly sweet... I could get into these kind of lagers.

Looks a little tired... Pale golden coulour with a  head that disappeared way too quickly. The taste is rather sweet and malty and goes well with pork and sauerkraut as a beer like this should. Overall not as good as I remembered it from previous years.
3:rd of 4 different oktoberfest beer in a sampling. A litle more colour than the previous oktoberfest beers. Small aroma of malt. God bitterness and some maltiness.
My first octoberfest of the season.   Just a run of the mill octoberfest. Rather weak hops and malts though. Decent honey aroma. Quaffable

Bottle, light amber color with a fizzy white head. Aroma has some malts, spices and 
grass. Carbonation is pretty standard, not too offensive.  Aftertaste is quite nice malty almost caremel like finish. But overall this feels abit watery.
Great beer with a good caramel flavor. medium sized white head, clear amber cooper color.

draft, tasting, biergarten, tivoli, cph.
fruity aroma, caramel, sweet notes. nice, clear yellow white head, flavor is soft, round, sweet, well balanced, overall quite nice forf a strong beer, could be a session beer until you fall over.

On tap at Stone 12th.  Light amber color with a light, sweet scent.  Lots of flavor in a light, happy way.  It’s clean and fruity in the mouth.  I could have sat down with a few of these had I been given the opportunity.
Bottled 50cl. Extremely well balanced and pleasant. Sweet malty with notes of gooseberries in both nose and taste. Bitter finish. Great!

One Liter CAN!  Sour barley and caramel malt aroma.  Medium yellow color with moderate but quickly disappating head.  Slightly sweet barley malt flavor.  Decent - nothing great.  Primarily meant to be drunk a liter at a time.

bottle.  poured clear amber with a thin cream colored head.  retention was ok, could be better.  aroma favored caramel with a slight citrus.  flavor was caramel with some hop bitterness in the end.  a bit watery though.

Amber in appearance, small head. Strong malty aroma. A bit too hoppy to taste for a Maerzen, in my opinion. It’s not as sweet compared to others either. Some carbonation. Not a bad beer, but there are others of this style that are better.
Amber in color with a rich creamy head, and a smooth, lightly hopped flavor.

This tastes oxidized and skunky, even for an import. I love octoberfests in general, and I know a lot of people enjoy this beer, so maybe I got an extra old one.
The color is a nice amber, good for the style.
There is a good malty flavor under the oxidation, but The hop character might be a tad too much for the style.

A pale golden lager with a thin white head. Aroma of sweet honey and yeast, clearly oxidized. In mouth, good malt with light german hops, definite signs of oxydation, cloying sweetness and chalky final. Bottle is one year old. BB 08/07

500ml Bottle- Attractive golden coloured with mild carbonation and a small head. The aroma is malty, yeasty and has a hint of banana and grapefruit. The taste has a pleasant zing and a mild hoppiness with grapefruit featuring again. Not bad for a beer of this type.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Very zippy. Begins strong and spicy. Finish could be stronger. An average festbier!

Gold, small white head. Sweet vegetable malt aroma. I caught tomato initially. Taste has yeast and grainy malt, very restrained and slightly creamy. Slight bitterness.  I’m struggling to find bad (or good) things to say about this beer. Tomorrow I will have forgotten it.
Bottled. pale golden in color, minor white head. The aroma is sweet and hoppy. The flavour is swwt and has a mild and appealing taste. Like a promise of the summer to come (after winter).
Klassiker - med en del maltsødme, let humle, lidt karamel. Let drikkelig - men ikke ringe...

Pretty good. Not outstanding or memorable.
uquet of honey and grass. golden appearance with a white, not to stable, lacy head.
This is the standard for Oktoberfest Bier. Excellent color, very true to the style.  Flavor is unmatched in festbiers.  As others have said below, it is the best mass at Oktoberfest.

500ml bottle on couch at home. Bouquet of honey and grass. golden appearance with a white, not to stable, lacy head. it#s "herb" , but very refreshing and very very drinkable for a strong, as it should be, beer. round tasting, very well balanced stuff.
Pretty uninteresting overall, some aromatic notes of almond essence and alchohol along with grain, good for thirst quinching, thats it for me.
Bottle@Home. Faint grainy aroma. Pale yellow color, white head, good lace. Sweet, grainy, light bitter, little sticky and soft mouthfeel. This is too clean and too boring.
Ein kraftvolles Bier mit leckerem Malz-Hopfen-Einschlag. Der Alk.-Gehalt ist nicht ansatzweise heraus zu schmecken. Die Süffigkeit für diesen Stoff ist phänomenal!
Color is a dark golden-honey, and has a velvety head.  Not much aroma to speak of beyond simple hops and malts.  Flavor is a nice blend of hops and malts with a hint of caramel with a mellow finish.
Bottle. Yellow with white head. Hay as for the other oktoberfest beers. Some sweet and low on hops.  Not bad.

Straw coloured, head nearly disappears but leaves a little lacing. Feint aroma of soft grain and perhaps a touch of grassy hops.

The flavour is soft and smooth grains, light although quite full on the palate. Still, I found it monotonous, one dimensional and boring.

Re-Rate: For I found interesting bubblegum notes in it. Not that it turned my opinion around but it warranted raising Fl and Oa by 1 each to 5 and 9 respectively.
A dark golden beer with a white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Taste is malty and sweety, notes of hops. Very well balanced. Drinkable but tasteful.
Just a really sweet, malty brew.  Very clean and very drinkable.  Nothing to get too excited about, but would be pretty nice during those Oktoberfest days.
Draft Firewaters in the Tropicana, Atlantic City, NJ- Yellow golden pour, mid to quarter head, malty tastes, light bodied. Couldn’t believe they still had it on tap as its almost February
Bottle 0,5l. Pale golden colored with a fluffy white head that lasted quite a long time. Modest malty aroma. Malty flavor with a touch of plums. Heavy malty finish. No bitterness. KI=3.

.5 liter brown bottle. Pours a pretty amber/gold, not a lot of carbonation or head. Lots of malt in the aroma, a little caramel.
Medium body with a rich German malt flavor. There is a little bit of noble hop bitterness. Nice Oktoberfest. Very drinkable, a great beer with spicy food.

12 oz. glass bottle- color of clear amber, with a off white head - nose of light fruit, light nuttiness,  and malty – taste of light fruit, light nuttiness,  and roasted malt - body is light to medium, and with medium carbonation – aftertaste of sweet, caramel, and nutty

50 cL bottle. Pours clear yellow with a dense white head. Slight breadish and mild hoppy aroma. Flavour is medium sweet cornish/cereal with a mild honey like herbalness and a mild hoppy freshness. Ends with a medium sweet and slight bitter hops note. Quite nice.
This was easily the best beer at Oktoberfest.  Still slightly sweet like most of the Oktoberfest beers, but the finish was good.

Bottled. Pale golden color, medium white head. Aroma is malty end hoppy. Flavor is refreshing and malty. Mouthfeel is smooth bitterness in the end.Português: Cerveja Dourada clara com uma espuma média. Aroma maltada e de lúpulo. Sabor refrescante porém maltado. Retrogosto com um suave amargor
malty sweet, slight bitter, dingy flavor, a little stale, harsh lager flavor

0.5 l can. Well, can’t believe what I read here, mine poured crystal clear golden body with small head. Maybe darker than other pale lagers, but definitely not orange or amber... Quite nice, but weak aroma of some malts, yeasty a bit. Also, bit of flower hops. Flavor is a bit sweet, overall very neutral, let’s say light in a bit watery way, still pleasant. Low carbonation. Finish is sweetish, not long neither short. Extra alcohol punch is not felt while drinking. Pretty decent beer, although I’m not impressed. And I can’t get the point of the style yet, either...

Smells like a cold beer...nothing special to note..............
...taste 
flat tasting....
A very light and slightly sour beer. Not especially flavourful. Goes well with a heavy meal, but that’s about it. It’s nice to experience a Mass of it in a beer tent, but that’s about it.

One mass (1L) draft at oktoberfest munich.
what a beer. slightly opaque (trüb), full bodied, great oktoberfest beer.

Deep golden Color, nice head. Aroma: Malty, some hops, some caramel.
Palate: Malty, toast, caramel, bitter. Well balanced.

Bottled.  A golden colourd lager with hardly any head.  The aroma and taste have some good noble hops.  The malts are nice and balancing and on no way have that buttery off tastes I find with some maerzens.  Nice alcohol levels also.  This is a very nice fest beer, and a credit to such a large brewer.
Aroma has hints of fruit and flowers. Taste is rich and hoppy with just a hint of sweetness. As far as Oktoberfest seasonals go, this is one of the best.

1L on draft at Paulaner’s 2007 Oktoberfest tent in Munich.
Darker beer than most of the other similar-styled offerings at Oktoberfest.  I must admit that the 2 Liters that I consumed were liters #4 and 5 on the day, so my judgment may have been impaired at this point.  If my handwriting at that point is any indication, then I was a bit tipsy at this point.  BUT, since I am giving the beer high marks, I did not want to shortchange Paulaner!  Overall sweet malty body and balanced hoppy finish.  Bit heavier than I had expected.
Cherry and grain aroma, most notably barley. Amber color, medium head. Watery mouthfeel, lots of unroasted malt. Wheat finish.

0.5l can found at the InterSpar in Zagreb. Golden colour, medium sized fluffy white head that went away at a medium pace. A very nice malty nose, honey, some hops, weak hints of propolis. Soft mouthfeel, nice maltiness with notes of honey, which is balanced in the end by a soft hopiness that is somewhere between herbal and lemony in taste and somewhat ruined by some subdued egginess that pops up at the same time. It’s a good beer, but it sure didn’t rock my world. I guess that I have to look elsewhere for a  Oktoberfest Bier that I really like. Hmm... the importer’s sticker lists wheat malt among the ingredients. A mistake most likely, but not as funny as the one the Bosnian importer made on Salvator - they translated everything correctly except the gravity, which they put as 11.5° (and the correct one was written 3 cm above that).
Dark golden with a decent head. Sweet caramel notes with a slight hoppiness that comes out slightly bitter towards the finish. Good Marzen
Bottle. Clear, pale golden colour with a medium white head.sweet, malty and honey aroma. Sweet flavours, some bready qualities, only slightly drier towards the finish. Nothing special, but drinkable.
this is a very good representation of an oktoberfest.  Very nice aroma and a smooth fizzy, malty taste.
Maß at Armbrustschützenzelt on 9-29-07.   Pretty much the same aroma and appearance as Hofbräu and Spaten, but fuller malt flavor.   Very tasty.

330ml bottle picked up at a store in Trier. Clear golden body with two fingers of white foam. The fading foam left some lacing on the glass. Perfumed aroma of sweet grass. Malty sweetness in the direction of caramel and a light taste of fruit. Overall rather tasteless and too sweet. Disappointing (13.09.2007).

Keg (Gallows Bird, Espoo, Oktoberfest 2007)
Sharp sour malt aroma. Slightly too fizzy, spoils the palate. Hasd a slightly plasticky taste, when warmed up actually tastes of something - a rather plain malt.
Rating marked down in "overall" because the Paulaner website, which I used to try to verify which beer I’d had, completely sucks donkey cock.
Very pale golden with a small white foam. Grassy and malyu notes. Lots of carbonation. Malt and barley taste. light to medium body with a sweetish finish.
This is part of a beer club. Had only one bottle but was decent for the price. Poured great and had a nice finish. Would do again.

[i]Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget[/i]. Clear golden with a creamy white head. Strong bready malt aroma, slightly honeyish, with faint grasy hops. Medium bodied with smooth mouthfeel. Flavour is a bit too much on the sweet side.

Bottle. Large foamy white head that mostly lasted. Clear light sparkling body with a golden color. Good display of lacework. Very crispy and clear taste with notes of caramel, light fruit, nice smooth hoppy feel. Medium bodied with a light dry texture and an average carbonation. Well balanced light sweet and hint of bitterness. Sweet caramel like finish.

(Bottle from Alko). Slightly darker than a basic lager with frothy head. Malty, sweetish, full, slightly hoppy and all the way smooth. I need to have another one of these, but it seemed a bit flat and uninteresting compared to Ayinger Oktoberfest. Still good and dangerously easy drinking for such a high alc vol..
Oktoberfest @ Coach & Horses, Greenwich on cask - Clear gold, small head, honey notes, slight varbonation sensed on drinking, soft mouthfeel

I am a  big fan of the Paulaner Hefe so I was really looking forward to this beer.  Unfortunately, it was a thin watery brew that lacked any complexity.  It was quite malty and had a slightly sweet then soapy finish.  Not a great Oktoberfest.

Light golden body with thin fissy head.
Aroma of malt and small citrusy notes.
Flavor of bready malt and citrusy hops.
Palate is thin.
Simple and nice balanced.
Golden colour with small head,mild with taste of hops and corn,sweet and  a bit malty.I better like the paulaner wheat beers.
Golen color with a small head. Malty aroma with some wet cardboard present. Mild malt flavor balanced by some spicy bitterness, rather thin mouth feel. I expected more.

Good but not great. Poured amber with some malt notes. Not my favorite style (read: lager).  I didn’t notice the 6% alc. Seemed like a premium lager to me (actually I think that I like Fairbanks Lager and Sam Adams better). Special to an international food festival here in Panama.

Golden with an OK head. The aroma is malty and hoppy. The flavour is slightly sweet with light notes of flower and caramel and the bitterness is low. This beer simply doesn’t make any impression on me, but then again this is absolutely not a favourite style... 1543
Heavy, nice malt taste without being too sweet - beer taste not sugar taste.  Solid beer.

Tried this out of bottle.  Pours a nice clear amber with frothy head.  Aroma is a nice scent of fresh bread.  Flavor is a clean and crisp with slight hops bitterness.  Overall, I’d purchase this again...
bottle. Golden colour, malty and fruity nose. Malty and fruity flavour with a pleasant fruity sourness. Full-bodied, fruity aftertaste.

Name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Weizen

Date: October 06, 2011

Mode: Bottle

Source: Ale Atlanta

Appearance: clear light golden, fine white head, streaks of lace

Aroma: sweet biscuit aroma, bready, lightly spicy floral hops

Flavor: sweet malt flavor, nice bready character, light earthyness

Overall: still a robust oktoberfest flavor but lightened by the wheat

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20

Rating: 3.2/5.0
Drinkability: 9/10

Score: **+ /4
Bottle. Clear golden colour with medium creamy white mostly diminishing head. Malty aroma. Sweet flavor with a little bitterness at the end.
Bottle.Clear amber.Off-white head.Smells of caramel,malt.Mainly sweet flavor with a slight bitterness.Clean finish.Good.

Can at home - shared with Mette - stolen from Lotte !!! Clear golden - white head. Aroma: Bread, white bread, light citrus hoppy. Taste: Nice soft malty, light hoppy, citrus, light sweetness, citrus hoppy.

Prussians  living in bavaria   who do not like "Paulaner"  should stop drinking beer or leave the country for good!!
God bless Paulaner!!

Nothing is better than sitting in the Oktoberfest tent and having in one hand a "stein" of Oktoberfest Beer and in the other a "Hacksen or Brathaendle"!
I love it!
Boa cerveja, leve e refrescante. Coloração laranja, bonita, espuma branca e presente. Cheiro suavemente adocicado. Uma cerveja leve, adocicada, retrogosto levemente amargo.

Bottle. Pours an amber/golden color with a medium off white head that diminishes quickly to paper thin.  The aroma is nutmeg and some spice. Laces nicely with hoppy taste with some wheat and a crisp finish.

Cleaner that many OFests, with a milder toasted caramelized Munich malt flavor, but with a bright aroma and flavor. Very drinkable without compromising flavor. A very nice and drinkable example of a real marzen.
golden color. Not much aroma. Taste is creamy and  malty with bitter finish.

This beer was nine months since I purchased it. Its a rich beer, more flavor than I’d expected but nothing too out there. I wish I could try this brew fresh.

Earth tones, light carbonation, medium body, pale amber in color, rich head quickly diminishing.

beer festival. golden body, solid imposing white head. smells very earthy, of dirt and vegetables and hay. tastes of sweet malts, wheat, yeast finish is acidic and hoppy. its pretty good. but not great for the style.
Bottle. Golden coloration. Floral and fruity aroma, better than the flavor. High/medium carbonation. Lightly bitter.

Coloração âmbar transparente, creme pouco denso e nada persistente. No nariz sobressai o malte e um levíssimo floral. Aguada. Amargor moderado e agradável. Adstringente. Preferivelmente servir bem gelada.

Clear blonde body with a small white head.  Aroma was a little skunky.  Minimal malt extraction with basic cereals taste.  Distant citrus fruit and almost no hops presence.  Not at all what I came to expect from an Oktoberfest (almost felt kolsh-ish).  I drank the beer as soon as it arrived in Montreal but I suspect it wasn’t very fresh.  Either that or it is part of Germany’s initiative of reducing Oktoberfest’s alcohol consumption.
Robe blonde dorée très claire surmontée d’une mousse blanche qui s’estompe. Arômes de métal et de malt caramélisé. Saveurs de malt caramel, de carton et de houblon amérisant.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de pain et de caramel fruité. Apparence: La couleur est blonde translucide avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un moyen col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et de noix. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps et la texture sont mince. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement pétillant. (Rating #881)

Nice sweet malty finish, with hints of floral hops.  Pours nicely with not too much head.  Tastes better after you pour and let it sit for a while and it opens up.  Beer of choice these last couple of months.

Adequate and representative of the style.  Nose of malts and floral hops.  Cloudy golden pour, smi-hazy, moderate off white head.  Sweet amber malts, too much floral hop for my taste, some caramel sweetness, good bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours yellow with big white head. Aroma: grass. Flavor: Malt sweetness (too sweet). Grass. Bitter finish

500ml bottle: poured golden yellow with a small white head that remains throughout the beer. Moderate herbal hops aroma with a touch of grapes and apples. Mild hop and fruit taste with just a touch of bitterness in the finish. Medium body. Good.
Bottle. Pours a golden colour with a white head. Sweet malty aroma. Sweet malty flavor with some yeasty and bready hints. Sweet malty finish with some bitterness.
Bottle at home. Went flat fast and didn’t taste much better. Malty with little flavor to recommend it. Better than pilseners but not much punch to it, despite the decent alcohol content.

Poured a pale amber color with a nice and long-lasting head.  Aroma is malty, maybe some citrus. Taste is mild, mostly malt with just a touch of bitterness.  Pretty good beer, but seems to lack something....perhaps more hops?
Yeast and malty aroma. Color is deep yellow. Pretty smooth and lingers without bitterness. Not too strong. Pretty good beer.

Bottle from July 1993. very thin with a yellow copper colour. No head was produced. The bottle cap showed some signs of leakage. The body confirmed this in being pretty flat. This did not, however, feel as though it was infected or oxidized. I don’t think the past 13 years have been good to it as it seems to have lost its body and most flavour. The light flavour that is present finishes in some off flavours. Needless to say, i didn’t finish the bottle and will have to give it a more fair rating from a fresh bottle.
Golden colored oktoberfest. Not very special, yeasty, a bit bitter. Drinkable, not enjoyable.
Bottle.  Pale golden beer with a light head.  The aroma is yeasty and lightly dry and the flavour is very bitter, dry and yeasty.  Overall a nice beer.

Golden with thin white head.  Strong aroma of malt and some metal, some apple, and some honey.  Some malt, a bit of sweetness, very little bitter, not much at all.  Also a bit flat, not much body or anything to the texture.

This is a great tasting beer, that is very smooth and pleasing, even when at room temp. Good smell, almost a sweet nutty taste, but not...it is pretty sweet though..., another great Paulaner brew through and through!
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroam and flavour of malt and hops with notes of caramel.
Bottled. Deep golden color with small head. Very malty aroma with distant herbal hops and hints of sulfur. Sweetish, very malty and honeyish flavor with some caramel. Very clean and drinkable.

Not at all sure that i’m reviewing the right beer here because the one i had from a bottle about a fortnight ago poured a very clear, light gold for a start.
anyway it was a clean and refreshing effort if not particularly complex.
Draught. Golden colour with a white head. Malty, straw aroma and taste. Medium body with a sweet finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a white head. Smells like 5-56 (I can’t bother explain... ;-) ). Flavour is a bit sourish, I had higher expectations...

[Bottle from Alexander shared in Palles summerhouse.]

Paulaner makes a lot of good german beers and this one is included.  Lots of ingredients and nice aftertaste.
Deep rich maltiness as you would expect from a OF, nutty, sweetish then slightly dry. gets better as you drink it (for me anyway), started off nice but by the end I thought it was excellent.

Bottle (From Bitter Virtue). Bland malt and mild bitterness in the finish. Some alcohol is apparent. Finishes slightly sweet with some fruity alcohol. Lacks the clean refreshing crispness of lighter german lager or the lip smackingly full maltiness of the dark strong ones, a bit pointless really.
