A Mes rate: Tap from the Bavarian Brewhouse in Old Street. Mellow and malty in the nose but pleasant enough. Golden body with a reasonable head and plenty lace. Initial malted biscuit flavour becomes breaded and then balances out with some hops for a bitter finish. Not bad

Draught at Brew Wharf at London Bridge (London), a very carbonated pale yellow with a filmy white head. A subtle vinuous and wheat aroma with some fruit. Flavours are very corn-like, very clean palate though. I expect (hope) better in its home country.

Bottle: Clear yellow colour, with a nice white head.
Aroma of malts and a bit of hops, citric,caramel.
Flavor is almost the same, thin body, lots of maltynes,a bit sparkling on the tung, short to medium dry bitter finish.

(Draught at The Rover, Göteborg) Pours light golden. Malty, herb-ish aroma. Clean and light nose with hints of lemon. Clean light body with herb-ish hops. Small bitterness but ok malt character.
(Second try, bottle) Sweet and rich malt up front in the aroma with hints of bread, toast and honey. Light perfume like hops with tones of herbs and soft floral tones. A touch of dough in the background. Good, creamy malt flavour with the hops in the background. Some Light bitter herbs, lemon and hints of grass and flowers. Soft and round mouthfeel. Light crisp and light doughy. Medium bodied. Nice with a good, friendly balance.

First rating
(Draught at The Rover, Gothenburg) 
Clear light yellow color, big white head. Sour malty scent. Sweet malty a little bit fruity taste. Rather thin mouthfeel. Low bitterness.
5/3/6/2/10=2.6

Rerate
(50 cl bottle purchased by deft from Systembolaget)
BB 06/09
On September 1, 2008
As "Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier"
Clear pale golden color, small white head. Malty, sweet, a tad bit fruity scent. Sweet, malty, though perhaps too weaek, taste. Medium to moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Dry aftertaste. Mouthfeel goes weak/flat quite fast.
6/3/5/2/10=2.6

This was the first liter of Oktoberfest beer that I had in Munich last year.  SInce then it has been one big beer fest.  I tried this again recently from  bottles.  I love this style and this time of year.  It has a huge malty, roasted sweetness.  It seems a little more amber than I remember.  The alcohol is apparent and pleasent.  Very good tasting beer that should be consumed by the litre.

This is a killer-Oktoberfest bier. Designed to be consumed in large quantities at the oktober-fest in Munich this one hits the spot dead-on. Aroma is pretty ordinary as well as the appearance. The flavour is rather malty with a superb bitterness in the aftertaste, which makes you yearn for another sip. Prost!

Pale yellow see through with little white head. Malty aroma. A bit watery texture. Lively carbonation. Little hoppy bite" that doesnt hurt anybody though". Short OK pleasant finish. Very average & allround. Rarate April 2010: Hayish and grassy. Very clean with a pleasant hop flavor Crisp. 2,8-3,0

(Bottle BBE 08/2008) Grassy and malty aroma with a hint of alcohol. Golden colour, clear and small, white head with a hint of lacing. Acidic, malty, grassy, fruity (citrus after warming up a bit). Lively carbonated and medium-bodied palate. 13/09/07
Bottle. High white lasting head. Clear yellow body with a lot of carbon dioxide. Sweet malt aroma. Dry hops bitterness with a long aftertaste.

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Colour is golden with a firm white head. Nose is malty and bready with a clean cereal aroma and fresh aroma of grassy hops, hints of citrus. Same goes for the taste: malty, with notes of tropical fruit and citrus. Grassy hops in the clean and fresh finish. Medium body, medium bitterness, well balanced sweetness. Nice and fresh, although a bit clinical.
You can find this during September and October in Octoberfest Restaurant in Athens on tap. Very fresh. Enjoyable to drink. Like a stronger Paulaner Hefe. Very nice.

Tastes just like Hacker-Pschoor Oktoberfest because
the only difference is the label and bottle cap!’06 batch,even the lot #’s are the same.Go with the Hacker,$8 rebate on a 
case.
light, average or below carbonation, bit bland and water. The finish was short and sweet literaly. I had expected more.
Overpriced.  The Sam Adams, though not as complex, is better, and 2/3 the price.

Bottle, 0,5l. Strong pale lager aroma, some additional hops. The pale colour is not attractive. The taste is great; extremely flowery. There’s menthe, clover and honey in it. Good stuff; I’ll definetly try this at obkoberfest.
Very fizzy, light yellowish head. Malty effervescense. Light spice, light citrus.

Bottle.  Poured a beautifully pristine gold with red accents with an off-white head with some lacing evident.  Smelled like doughy caramel.  A nice balanced malty flavor with hints of caramel and molasses balanced with the light hops.  Clean, crisp, a good Marzen.

A very well rounded and satisfying beer.  The malted roasty flavour is great.  It my favourite of the Paulaner beers.  Nice hoppy and bitter finish.
Good Oktoberfest beer but there are better lagers out there.
Very good malty beer.  Lacking much of the normal beer lovers flavor notes yet extremely pleasant to the tongue.  This is a must in any beer drinking experience

Very flavorful beer in the German Octoberfest style.  Good year-round brew with many flavor notes but few that dominate.  Some bitterness and carbonation can be short-lived on tap.  Overall very satisfying.
Light hop characteristics, light body. A slight malt characterictic. Not highly gasey. Highly drinkable, not bad, not great.

Yellow to amber colour; clear body; average, white head with not a great lacing.
Moderate malty aroma with some herbal hops; notes of grains and hints of toffee.
Flavour is well balanced between malty sweetness and hops bitterness.
Body is light to medium; carbonation is lively; metallic feeling in the finish.
Satisfactory.

18 Mar 2006 (Rerated 30 Apr 2006) - Roasted sweet fruity malt and some spice aroma.  Cloudy light amber colour, good head and ok lacing.  Roasted sweet malt  and hop flavour but a bit simple.  Stark/sharp malt hoppy finish with a thinnish mouthfeel and sweet malt aftertaste.
Bottle. Medium head wityh medium duration. Golden color. Taste is pretty much like stong lager. I had expected more.
Bottle: Nice balance of flavour, hoppy and nice bitterness. A very nice Maerzen to be enjoyed regularly.

Golden color. Off-white head. Malt dominates aroma and flavor. Sweet to the nose — caramel and earth notes — and tongue — sugar and bread. Slight bitter hop taste in the finish. Body seems somewhat thin. Sticky feel in the aftertaste. Easy enough to drink but not especially interesting.
Good malty, caramel, and butterscotch flavors.  Full-bodied but still refreshing and enjoyable to drink.
One bottle from BTW.  Poured a good head that quickly disapated.  Then weird chuncksof lacing on my beer.  It was smooth with some hops.  Alright.
"Pour a very nice golden color with nice hear. Smelled of malts. Taste was smooth and refreshing. Perfect mouth feel. Overall very nice refreshing beer."

i found the beer to be way to bitter for a marzen. usually marzens are really easy to drink and are one of the smotthest beers arouns, i though this one was a bit harder on the pallet. still not a bad beer

Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. OK aroma, week nice flavour a bit like pilsener. OK palate.
A bit disapointing.
an example of making a higt quality beer with only wasser, gerstenmalz, hopfen,
I drunk this last at the Oktoberfest. Because people wouldn’t get drunk too fast, they add a lot of water with it without you (supposedly) knowing it...
Blond color. Light aroma, malty and sweet. Very common taste, quite strong body, high alcohol perception, high bitterness.

50 cl bottle. No yeast in bottom. Golden clear colour with great white head. Nice aroma of both malt and hops also in flavour. Very refreshing and nice. But overall a little common and with a dull taste.
This was a recomendation from the server.  The apperance was nothing to brag about comming out of a bottle.  The flavor was excellent and it is a beer I will try again.
one of my favorite Marzens out there, very balanced, not too sweet, a bit of an alcohol kick, always consistant and good. More hops than most marzens, nice flavor.
Light dark orange, light red.  Big head.  Rather smooth and drinkable.  NIce light touches of hops and malts.  Barely above average
Good balance between carbonation and hoppiness.  Very drinkable.  Had this at several Oktoberfests this year.
this is a great oktoberfest.  sweet and drinkable.  This goes down smooth finishing sweet and malty

On tap at Firkin’s, Libertyville, IL.  Amber hued with diminishing average white head.  No discernable aroma.  No discernable carbonation. Light bodied that starts with watery sweet honey flavor with hint of dryness and finishes with light dryness.  A decent drinkable Oktoberfest beer but Ayinger Oktoberfest/Marzen is even better.
golden amber w/ a big off white head.  medium bodied, sweet and easy drinking.

Bokbierfestival Utrecht, from tap. Clear yellow color, short white head. Aroma is hoppy of a german  pilsener, but more strong, some caramel malt. Taste is malty, bit crisp. Not bad, but not worth the overall score IMO.

From the bottle, it’s clear gold, with a medium, but short lasting head. The initial aroma in the glass is fruity and dusty yeast, yielding to bready malt as the head recedes. Some more caramel notes come from the malt when in the mouth. Fairly good balance in the flavour, a little sweet, but light enough to slide down without a shudder. If I had to drink a lager, this wouldn’t offend me. More good work from Paulaner.
Well, it was string and a little sweet, hoppy. But It had a something in the back taste I did not like. Low foam.
Keg @ De Hens, Chinatown.  Damned expensive! Mild softly fizzy beer with an alcohol strength noticeable in the malt. Nothing else distinguishes this strong lager. No character. No finesse.
Ordernary lager with a white head on a golden body. Sweet and hoppy malt taste.

Bottle. Yellowish golden colour, small white bubbly head. Aroma of hay, hops and weak malt. Flavour is hoppy and grassy, with some hints of sweet malt. Dry finish and hayish hoppy aftertaste. Uninteresting and watery.
Keg at Porterhouse, Covent Garden. Pale gold colour, with thin white head. Herby, hop nose, lager style body with some deadish malt.  Finish has more herby dry hop which is quite aggressive
Not the most exciting type of beer (IMHO) but this is one of the most enjoyable Oktoberfest biers I have tried to date. Very malty and highly drinkable.
Golden colour with a huge white head. Nice hobby taste and aroma. Nice smooth finish.
On tap at Mahar’s. Great sweet malt flavor, smooth palate. Very nice session beer.
Yellow colour with a white head. malty and sweet grainy aroma with a light hoppyness. Sweet grainy flavor, fairly dry finish.
Aroma is sweet and honey like. Clear golden color with a medium off white head. Flavor starts honey sweet followed by some hop spice  and a crisp dry finish. Smooth, but thin on the palate.

Bottle - import. Imagine my surprise to find this beer in small (WAY!) town New Mexico.  Been a LONG time since Munchen ’91, but this one brings it back wonderfully.  Not as hoppy as the Arrogant Bastards would like (thank god!), but just fine by me.  Warm, earthy, bold yet mild, and smoky.  All things autumn, German, solid, and workmanlike.  If you’ve been there, you know.  Early fall, warm afternoons, crisp mornings and evenings that hint of what’s to come.  SIMPLY CLASSIC!
Deep gold or very light amber, off white head. A very malty beer on all fronts, doughy, caramelly, very light bitterness on the end. Soft bodied, very drinkable. Good stuff.
not one of the best oktoberfest that they have put out but ok this yea. had some spice and some bitterness.
something different! A pils but a bit heavier. Typical floral hoppy nose from Paulaner, hoppy and acid finish, a good beer

Draught

Pale golden color, good creamy white head. Lemony hoppy nose. Malty, medium-bodied, lemony hoppy flavor. This boring oktoberfest brew looks way too overrated here.

Compact and persistent foam, not excessive bulky. Golden yellow color, medium fizz and discreetly shining. Long-lasting bitter and decided malty scent, agreeable. Fresh and alcoholic taste, softly dry; much pleasant and bitter. Watery and light metallic on the end.
Pours gold with a decent white head.  Smells of cookie dough and lemon.  Taste is average and malty.

On draft at the Federal in Durham, NC. Sweet malty aroma is slightly fruity. Much more flavorful than the bottled version it seems. Very sweet with only a hint of german hops. This is definitely a session beer as it seems I could pound these all night if I wanted to. I’d probably stick to the Heffe instead though.

(Bottled) Clear, pale golden color with a smallish, white head. Sweet, lightly acidic and grassy, toffee-grainy-malty, honeyish aroma. Smooth, quite malty, sweetish flavor with honey hints, some acidity, but very low bitterness. Sweetish, medium-bodied palate with soft carbonation. Very easily drinkable, which - I guess - is a plus for an Oktoberfest beer. Alcohol is reasonably well hidden. Not very interesting, but smooth, easy and malty brew.
(Draught@Kaisla, Helsinki, was 5-2-5-3-10=2.5) Slightly hazy, pale golden color with a small head. Honey-sweetish acidic and slightly corny aroma. Sweet, corny-malty flavor with some acidity. Pretty light-bodied, slightly alcoholic, not very carbonated palate. A quite lightweight and plain, sweet märzen. Somewhat like Löwenbräu Original, only sweeter and with more alcohol.

Pours a very clear golden with a small fluffy white head. Sweet malty aroma, with some skunky hops. Quite full in body and wonderfully balanced, loads of nutty biscuity malt, and small flowery hoppy flavour. Very clean finish and low bitterness, great beer
[bottle from peckhams] amber coloured with a moderate head. malty with some breadish notes, some herbal notes there as well. well bodied, bitter finish.

Bottled.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of malts and hops with fruity and yeasty notes.
Flavour of malts and hops. Hoppy finish.
Ordinary.

Bottle: Crystal clear gold with a big solid white head. Lots of sweet, buttery malts upfront, a little sulphur, and some elusive golden floral notes. Very slight phenolic notes later on. Buttery and nutty malts with a soft lemony aftertaste (and a bit of dust). A little astringent but quenching nonetheless.

Bottle: Clear golden colour with a thin frothy head; some malts, but also fruitiness (citrus, honey) in the nose; malty-sweetish taste, some light bitterness in the finish; fizzy; O.K., quaffable, not demanding.
Light colored beer with a decent head that sticks around for a little while.  Very fizzy in the mouth, but yields a nice light taste.  Definitely will drink again.

(bottle) Clear golden colour with a medium frothy white head. Malty aroma with cake dough. Medium sweet flavour, light to medium body, spritzy carbonation. Malty taste with a dense fruitiness and a light bitter and quite watery finish.

Bottle. Bready, semi-malty aroma. Clear golden colour. The head is small, white and semi-stable. Flavour is slightly malty, at least balanced towards the malt, but nothing special. Slightly creamy mouthfeel.

Bottled, 0.5 liter. This one’s from memory. Amber coloured, dying head. Initially sweet flavour, malts are dominant. Some bitterness in the end. Didn’t think it was that special, but thanks to my mom for always bringing back beers from holiday that i haven’t had before!

Always a treat to sample a Paulaner. This is a typically well crafted brew. Poured a bright gold with a 2.5cm head that deflated disappointingly quickly but left a thin mat of foam. Fresh malty aroma has sweet honey notes and some wet cardboard. Smooth, well rounded palate, clean and refreshing. Dominated by malt - sweet honey notes up front and a moderately bitter finish. A decent marzen but lacking the character of their superb Hefeweizen. (33cl bottle, Camperdown Cellars, best before 8/05)
lovely malty, hoppy beer with a good balance. sweet in the beginning bitter in the end. banana in the finish. full body but not sticky. a pity that i’ve got only 1 bottle.
(Bottle 50 cl) Reddish golden, with lovely malty notes throughout. Some malty sweetness well balanced by the hops in a moderate bitterness. A very harmonic beer. 021199

Very simillar to the heifweissbier from paulaner, slightly spicey in aroma and taste though a little thin and watery for my tastes. Good alround session beer could do with a little more though.
Dry finish.
A very good beer that offered some nice aroma and flavor. Features some slight sweetness on the palate and a warmth in the aftertaste.
had this beer last year it went down alright had a decent taste to it. but not what you would expect out of a german beer. slightly skunked and not that great
This Oktoberfest brew is not on par with Spater or Hacker but it is definitely drinkable with a slight hoppy, smooth finish.
First taset on the palate is sweet.  Has a slight coffee smell and taste.  (Weird) The coffee taste is more in the finish.  Great flavor. I REALLY LIKE THIS ONE

Picked this up on a whim while searching for something new because i liked everything else I had from Paulaner.  Low expectations because of past encounters with "oktoberfests".  Turned out to be a tasty and enjoyable brew to open after a long day at work.  Dark golden with a creamy head which vanished after a while.  Excellent malty flavor, faintly sweet, faintly hoppy, and faint bitter finish.  Thick and chewy in the mouth; perfectly balanced for an "anti-hop-head" like me.  Totally unexpected, but I loved it.  Yes I see everybody else rates it lower but I dont care.  Excellent!!
Musty aroma. Some initial head but nothing to look at. Suitable Above average carbonation, some malts and some bitterness and astringency in finish, with dry bitter aftertaste that’s best part.
Golden in color, with little head.  Aroma is sweet hops. Clean on the taste with bubbles to finish.  I just love the bubbles.
Nice golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is skunked hops and sweet malts. A world class Marzen, for sure. Im just not a fan of the style.

Ultra clear in the glass and light amber in colour.  Sweetish malt aromas.  More sweetness in the mouth, not hoppy but a good level of fizz stops the beer becoming fat.  Ok but would have expected more at the rating - just a bit too one dimensional. Very easy to drink and I can see its appeal in this regard.

First tasting of this beer was over a year old, so I didn’t rate it. Second tasting of this beer was with a recent bottle, and gee, I don’t know why I bothered. I figure this beer is designed just to get drunk on with it’s higher than normal ABV and very inoffensive taste. It had little subtlety,  just a clear malty brew with a slight hop twang. Not a very crisp finish, given enough I can see myself throwing this stuff up.

Bottle Best before 08/04 So it’s getting on. Still holds up well. Pours pale gold to my surprise. I expected a richer amber color. Nose is of cracked grain and light caramel. Hops are faintly floral. Flavour is well balanced and slightly sweet. Hop bitterness is just enough to clean the finish. Well rounded drop.
Amber/gold colour, a bit of a white head, but ti didn’t really last long. The noble hops came through, as did caramel notes, nice enough, but not my sort of thing.
I had this on tap at the Gingerman and liked it.  It compliments the Paulaner Hefeweizen very well.  Oktoberfests are fine but not my favorite types of beer.  I wouldn’t drink them in the summer.

An aroma of noble, flowery hops and a hint of malt.  Pours to a golden color with a white head, with fair retention.  Has that grainy/candy lager flavor with mild bitterness.  A bit of alcohol taste is detectable.
Malty aroma and some typical german-style hopped. Clear, golden coloured with a lasting, white head. Taste is malty, a bit floral some hops, sweet. And quite smooth. Decent enough.
Pale golden colour with medium-size white head. Definitely malt on the aroma and the taste was fairly light but pleasant enough, soft citrus fruit, a faint touch of spice and a short finish.
Pours dark gold ,with minimal head and lacing.Very nicely carbonated. Good malt upfront in both aroma and taste, finishes dry with a slightly bitter aftertaste.very drinkable indeed.

Pretty average tasting to me -- I used to like this better than Hacker Pschorr, but not anymore after having them consecutively.  Was golden more than red.  Head faded much to quickly. Nice inviting aroma, but little in the way of fresh, complex taste. -- just a little sweet lager is a what I thought, rather than bold Oct Bier. Way too expensive too ($9.69 for a six) for what it was.

I’ll admit it, I like American Octoberfests better than German versions.   My German ancestors may frown on that statement but it’s true.   Paulaner’s version is an average sweet Marzen with a golden appearance.

I like this beer, it’s one of my favorite Oktoberfests as it doesn’t overdo it. So many of the seasonal attempts at this beer seem to try too hard. Here is a tasty, well balanced beer that can be drunk by the litre in a giant stein with a big creamy head.

Draught.  I had this beer in the Flying Saucer in Fort Worth, Texas.  I enjoyed it a lot.  Pours a little lighter than I imagined but nose is malty and a little hoppy.  Taste is great, with a nice sharp bite and a pleasant finish that shows some nice work done balancing this one with the hops.  Good mouthfeel and a decent body.  I enjoyed.
Bottled(500ml). -pale amber coloured, little white head, malty and hoppy but weak for 6%, hoppy finish
Bottled, JDW Ocktoberfest. Deep yellow, scant white head. Sweetness to the aroma and the flavour, simple mildly hopped finish, enjoyable but not outstanding.
Bottle at the JDW in Twickenham. Pale yellow, slight head. Sweet malty, apparent alcohol, slightly syrupy.

Yellow colored, white head. Surprisingly light colored for märzen. Sweet and fusel aroma with notes of alcohol, not disturbingly though. Medium bodied. Sweet start in flavor, some grass, fusel and fruit come up too. Notes of hops in the end. Little disappointment for Paulaner, too thin and mild in many cases.
Clear spritzy appearence. Malty aroma with malt on the palate and some spice but I found this slighlty Uninspiring.

Bottle from JDW, Paradise Forum, Birmingham. Lager coloured, no head. Baked bean aroma - a common feature of Marzen beers (I have observed). Strongish, crispy flavour, not too much different than a good Deutsch Pils, but slightly more insistent, with a tinge of thickness in the finish. Niceish - haven’t really made up my mind.
Golden with a white head of foam.  Aromas are sweet grain, butter, light pepper and yeast.  Flavours are sweet malts, grain, corn and some pear.  Vapour dry ans spicy on the finish.  OK.
As good as Ayinger, and Hacker-Pschorr. Much better than Spaten. Clean, crisp flavor with a nice roasted malt flavor with just the right amount of bitterness to finish.
A pretty good flavor that laces smoothly against your tongue, goes down nicely with an appropriate finish.    Representative of German beer.  Just a well balanced beer overall.

Pale golden pour with an orange tint seemed a bit light for a fest bier.  The body was topped by a short lived off-white head that left some decent lacing as it departed.  The aroma was richly malty with earthy, bready notes wafting through.  The taste was as advertised, with bready, caramel malt, and sweet esters giving just a hint of bananas.  The aftertaste was grainy with a touch of herbal hops.  A bit closer to a macro offering than I prefer, but a very appropriate session drink for the season.

Tap (and came with a free 1L mug, hell yeah)  Clear copper color.  Not poured with a head that you should find on an oktoberfest.  I blame the bar for that.  Aroma is lightly sweet and of caramel.  Malty sweet flavors.  Crisp medium body with a spicy finish.
Bottle.  This was not the best Oktoberfest I’ve had.  Better than some, not as good as others (but definitely better than Anheuser World Select, but really, what isn’t?)

Bottled. The colour is very pale yellow. The small foam is white with medium-sized bubbles. 

The smell is sweet and malty with a small sourish touch.

The carbonation is medium strong, but it is at the same time quite refreshing. 

The first taste is sweet with a hint of diacetyl. The bitterness grows, but it doesn’t get up to the level that an Oktoberfest beer requires. The aftertaste surprises me with a developed and pleasant malty taste that saves this beer from being mediocre. 

I have hoped more from this one, as it was a slight disappointment
out of a 1 gallon keg. all i have to say is i hope this beer has a little more carbonation in any other form. but from reading the other responses, i doubt it.

Draught at the Falstaff, Gare du Nord, Paris. Golden colour with sizable white head. Aroma is malty with some hops. Sweet and malty taste , slightly bitter at the finish. Medium bodied, moderately carbonated, and refreshing. Nothing outstanding but still pretty good.
Bottled. Golden to amber colour.Malty sweet.Good carbonation. It´s okay.

Bottled.
Golden, white firm head.
Very malty in both aroma and flavour. Full and rounded body with a fine bitterness.

Bottle:  Aroma is malty with caramel along with some hops and a slight sour smell to it.    Pours a dark transparent gold with a decent head but not the greatest retention.  Big sweet and malty taste with big caramel flavor lasting throughout.  There is a slight bitterness that barely sneaks thru in the finsih.  Lightly sweet aftertaste.  A little on the sweet side but still very good.
Golden hue with fairly lively carbonation and a decent white head.  Fairly yeasty nose with sweet orangey tone.  Slightly earthy flavour with yeasty tones and a nice bitter bite.

Bottle @ home
Golden colour. Fruity (!) aroma. Malty fresh flavour. Quite sweet. Initial taste and primary aftertaste very good. However after a while the only taste you are left with is a dull sweetness and sticky lips.

The aroma is sweet hoppy with strong notes of caramel. The color is dark yellow and it has a fine lasting white head. The flavor is sweet malty with subtle hints of hops and caramel leading to a smooth hoppy bitter end.

This is the kind of beer that makes Autumn my favorite season of the year.  Drinkable, crisp, refreshing, and flavorful, this beer is sure to please the drinker with its delicious fall flavor and mouthfeel.  Great color, perfect for the cooling nights of the season or an afternoon football game.

Bottled. 
Golden colour. Malty nose with some fruitiness as well as a little butteriness. Soft malty and quite big, somewhat citric flavour with a late, rich bitterness.
I kind of like this beer when I can get it in fresh condition.  Pretty well balanced flavor and not overly bitter.  Nice with a good schnitzel.

Golden colour. Very firm head.
Sweet malty aroma with notes of herbs, wet forest, fruits, roasted malts and some chocolate.
Malty flavor with notes of cream. Decent dry bitterness

Had at O.C.  Malty
A very average, decent Oktoberfest beer....worth drinking again.

Bottled. Bright yellow with a shiny white head. Sweet aggressive flavour. Sticky sweet flowery flavours that aren’t that appealing.  Bitterness as soapy/sudsy and a you feel like you’re drinking sweetened bubble-bath.

Pours a lighter hue and has a sweeter punch than I would have wished.  This may sound bad but it tasted a little too watery.  Slight caramel notes.   Not very high on my list and pretty average through and through.  Pretty indicative of the Marzen style.  This bottle is past its prime (I hope for Paulaner's sake).
I like Oktoberfest beers, and this is a decent one. Just don't have any other thought provoking commentary to provide. Nice to drink, how's that?

A whole lots of hops going on. Poured golden w. a white head that laces. Smell the hops from across the room. Malty with a long bitterness. The hops in the aroma and flavor are the what does it for me here, although without the malt it'd be wasted.

One of my favorite oktoberfests around.  expertly crafted aroma and flavor heavy on hops with just a hint of malt.  Overall a thouroughly enjoyable beer.  One that I find myself going back to when the season arives.

fruity/floral aroma.
dark golden, nice head.
sweet hops, lightly malty and biscuity.
medium/heavy body with light refreshing drying hops.
great refreshing beer carries it's 6% well with nice body and all the right aromas and flavours.
Paulaner's Oktoberfest had a nice head and citrus qualities to it.  There was also a grain and yeast taste to it.  Another superb beer from Paulaner.
Plenty of head initially, not lasting; typically German flavored malts and yeast; slightly sweet, though well balanced,a bit metallic tasting; pretty good brew, lighter body, clean finish.

Great oktoberfest brew.  As with all of the paulaner beers this one sets a standard. anything better is as good as it gets and anything worse is crap.  Paulaners brews are very suggestive of the style.  in other words if you want to try a good standard oktoberfest try this.
Pale amber color.  Weak white head.  Hints of toffee in the aroma.  Flavor holds some caramel and maltiness.  Good drinking beer.
Golden colour with a bitter apple aroma. Quite a bitter taste and a little sour at the end.
Bottle: full flavored, malty with biscuit flavor. sweet with balancing bitterness.
(Bottle)  Pours a golden yellow color with a small off-white head.  Descent taste that improved as the beer warmed.

Bottled. Yellow to golden colour, small bubbles, glass sticking head, disappears fast. Clear body.
Sweetish aroma of malt, honey, syrupy, wort-like, a bit cooked cereal-like aroma when the beer warmt. Weak hop notes.
Taste is sweet, sweetness is more similar to white candy sugar than honey sweetness. Clean herbal bitter. Dry, thin body, watery texture. Unexciting.
I like the color of this one, golden.  Very smooth an deasy to drink........

The only first impression is lager, pale colour and creamy head. This doesn't last long but there is a reasonable carbonation evident. The nose is a clear malty and toasty one. On tasting it is good and solid beer that has the balanced profile of this style.

I had this two weeks ago but am finally getting around to rating it.

Drank from the bottle at a local bar.  I really liked the heavy carbonation in this beer.  Mouthfeel almost felt like a cola, but it's definitely beer :)  Slightly bitter aftertaste which I could live without, but it's the best out of 6 octoberfests that I've had this season.
Bottled. Not a bad beer. Had a good malt taste to it. Better than some other Oktoberfests I had.
Wonderful beer, so sweet and easy to drink.  My favorite Oktoberfest hands down.  Much better than Spaten on tap.

Color is golden with red highlight.  Good clarity.  Aroma is dominantly malt.  Flavor is sweet with German malts and maybe a touch of toasted malt.  A little lite in the body but not bad. Nice Octoberfest.

A bit disappointing really. Lightly malty and spicy aroma which was OK but hardly outstanding. 
Very clear with reasonable head but a little pale for my liking.
Flavour was reasonably thin with a pretty high bitterness for the style and with a fair bit of alcoholic soapiness in the finish. I don't understand how an Oktoberfest can be less malty than the same brewery's Hell!!??
Served way too cold.  After warming, pleasant dusty-leavey malt notes.  Nicely hopped.  Well-balanced.  What can I say, good malty lagers are just plain fun to drink.

White thick full lasting head. Bright golden color. Aroma is hoppy with herbal and grainy notes. Flavor is hoppy too with herbal tones, ending in a more balanced, slightly grainy and sweet finish. Light bodied.
A sweet flavour reminiscent of Löwenbräu's Oktoberfest beer. I like it better though. And it looks good, too. The first taste is always the best.

Crystal clear golden copper with low carbonation and a loose head. Toasted malt and cookie aroma with notes of pepper and nutmeg. Flavor of water, malt, fruit, metal, and spice. Feel is a bit flaccid. Somewhat boring and disappointing.
I nice malty Oktoberfest. Rich and creamy in the mouth. Good finish.........

It's that time of year again, and I feel compelled to drink this type of beer.  The style, in general, is not that good.  This and Spaten are my favorites.  A bit watery with some sweetness.  Drinkable, but gets kind of old and boring quick.
Light, shiny golden color. Quickly disappearing head. Not much of aroma, maybe some yeast. Has a spicy finish, but feels watery and not very interesting.
Golden color, white rather thin head. Aroma is not very strong, but has som yeast in it. Sweet at first and then turns in to pepper. Rather easy to drink, but a little watery.
Bottle.  Nice and malty.  Very full, not watery at all.  A very drinkable brew.
Had at O'fest event with Ayinger, Hacker, Spaten, Ramstein, etc. and Ramstein won. This was good and malty without much in the way of bitterness. Still a top notch beer.
One of the better Oktoberfests I've had this year.  A hint of sweet flavor seperates this from many other Oktoberfests.
This one is pretty decent.There are better oktoberfest biers out there(overhyped!)
As Oktoberfest brews go, this one isn't too bad.  Nice color, and a smooth taste, with light hops.

golden color, small white head. Very nice malty aroma of butter, herbs, syrup with weak notes of berries. Very, very malty with a smooth mouthfeel. finishes dry and malty with some notes of toffee and minerals.

Very very good, but slightly unbalanced, which is okay, but very malty and slightly syrupy.  Very dry finish in the aftertaste.  I look forward to this time of year every year, I love Oktoberfest styles.
Fruity nose, with raspberry suggestions.  Sweet body with caramel notes.  Finishes sweet with hints of dryness at the end.  Well rounded beer.
I drink the little kegs of this stuff every fall.  Oktoberfest in America, YUM
Typical good German beer, I would pick some others in Munich before this, but there is nothing bad about this beer!
Great appearance, looks and smells very tasty.  Aftertaste is a little weird though.
Great beer. Malty, yeasty, toasty smooth beer. I could drink this and sing German drinking songs all night.

I enjoyed this brew due to its very sweet aroma and I found it to be  smooth tasting which is very much to my liking unlike those brews that taste like strong coffee.This is a brew that I would enjoy drinking all night at a bar or party.
This brew seems to be true to the style, has some malt sweetness and is light on hops. The result is a somewhat pleasant drinkable beer with no real character of it's own.

Aromas of bread and corn.  A bit of a spicy marzen, which is nice.  Light bodied but crisp and sharp.  Some honey, hay, crisp pears and grains.   Has a bit of a spoiled, sour twang, but it’s not too distracting, and really just is a defect of the bottle being slightly lightstruck.

definite rich malt aroma.  the appearance is dark golden with brilliant clarity and the head lasts for a decent amount of time.  the flavor is run by malt.  there is a lot of rich malt flavoring here.  there is a hint of toastiness at the start and a very low hop spiciness is apparent with slight bittering to balance and keep the malt from getting too cloyingly sweet.  very clean aftertaste.  medium body and carbonation making this beer surprisingly light for all that malt.  very easy drinking and pleasantly balanced beer.
Varies from bottle to bottle.  Sometimes it has been flat, other times just right.  When not flat it is ok balenced, more malty but has a beautiful color.  I really like it.
I love me some Oktoberfest.... other than Spatan, the best Oktoberfest I've had.....
a pleasant sweet taste with a mellow hops aftertaste.  Very smooth..........

Excellent example of an Oktoberfest, kicks Lowenbru"s Oktoberfest in the arse.
Nice head, clinging almost to the bottom, nicely hopped with a pleasently smooth aftertaste - would be great with kraut. Lovely.
Every year my biggest decision in September is which oktoberfest is that years best.  This one is always in the top 2.

blech. i do *not* like this beer. i''m not really a fan of oktoberfest brews period, but this one particularly struck me as icky. not hoppy, not very full-bodied, malty, but missing that slight spice that i like in an oktoberfest brew.
Maybe I got a skunky one, but it had an odd aftertaste and a pretty funky aroma.  But in the mouth, it''s a pretty well balanced beer.
From bottle- light clear gold colour, malty aroma with a hint of hops. Light mouthfeel with a inoffensive finish. Good on a hot day - like today.
This beer seemed to lack any real taste.  It goes down smooth and doesn't offend in any way, so it might be a good beer to enlighten a Coorbudmiller drinker, but it's not a beer for me.
Pretty good German brew. It doesn''t have that German bite, which is great. Flavor is a rather good amber.

Tan/gold colour. quite a decent amount of head. Sweet malty aroma, sweet wheaty flavour on the palate, with a hoppy finish, slight acidity and bitterness, enjoyable. A bit of stinky hay and barnyard this time, a bit strange, but OK, not too complex.

Rerate 11/23/05 Just does not do it for me anymore, corny flavor permeates throughout - even though I know Germans do not put corn in their beer. No real caramelly sweetness that I usually seek out in Marzens. Original 3.9 Strange aroma upon opening - kind of a rotten vegetable smell - but mellows out to a clean malty scent.  Pumpkin-like appearance with a long lasting head.  Good yeasty, malty, stick to your ribs kind of flavor. Full body lasts to the end. This style is kind of growing on me.
Golden coloured with white medium lasting foam. Very sweet and malty aroma. Flavour is malty wiht some bitterness in the end. Very dry. Good over average beer.
Nice example of Octoberfest.  Good deep gold color, medium head.  Nice malt up front with tones of a hop finish.

Bottled. Straw gold, slightly paler than the Hofbräu example. Moderate head and good condition. Sweet malt aromas, malty body with some hop bitterness and a chalky dry malty finish. The Munich oktoberfest beers seem all very similar.
This was a basic fest to me,seems.  But fairly good Ill drink this one again.

On tap.  The malts had a very swwet presence in this one.  I cought whiffs of dark frutis (blackberries,grapes, currants) in the aroma and the taste had similar fruity sweetness.  It worked pretty well with the other malts, but it just wasn''t too terribly complex, and it was thin-bodied.  Hops are there but in any abundance.  This is nice, but it seems like it could have been better.

pale for an oktoberfest - dark yellow like a dehydrated pee. smells malty/hallertauey/plus a bit of tinned fruit salad more like a bock. taste is creamy, bready malt with a surprisingly dry, resinous bitter finish, with some alcohol noticeable. Pretty rough but tasty enough.

Unlike many festbiers, the malt doesn't smack you upside the head, but is rather understated.  Fairly dry, with a decent amount of bitterness.  Well-balanced.  I love the label, with the rows of beer wenches serving up suds.
Well balanced & malty.  Very good.  Head lasted forever in the glass....
The best oktoberfest. Awesome malt flavors and full body flavor.............
This was, to me, a great brew.  Excellent rounded malt flavors, slight sweetness, but a bit thin-feeling.  Had it in the bottle, and it tasted as fresh as could be.  Definitely worth it to me.
This is a solid Octoberfest.  The only better one I''ve had is the Hacker-Pschorr.  This one is a little less interesting than the H-P, but still very solid and well rounded.
Very nice, the bottle I tried showed no ill effects of its long travel. Just a great fest beer. Nice pour with a good head. Just the right amount of hops and sweetness makes it a winner.
Great Marzen. I had this on draft in Munich, then in a bottle. The ratings given are for the tap version. The bottle had a slightly skunky flavor.
A classic bitter German beer. Pretty hoppy..................................
Mine was 6.0%ABV. Funny label with the fat German chicks carrying beer. Rather malty with a slight sweetness. Smooth and pleasant.

Dark gold color, large head (foamy) malty aroma. A medium bodied marzen. Mild malts, slightly sweet. Some hoppyness. Mild flavor. Smooth and mild taste. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. It a nice Oktoberfest -Marzen. Nice but nothing special.

Overall I have to say I was a bit disappointed in this one. Pale gold clear under a medium-large lasting yellow white head. Very faint grain and citrus aroma. Clean crisp medium-light body. Moderately well balanced grainy malty sweet and hoppy bitter start. A milder malty cornsweet middle and medium short lasting hoppy bitter finish. Quite hoppy for Märzen.

Slightly lighter in colour than expected. Crystal clear light yellow. OK head. Little carbonation. Aroma is cut grass and mead. More hops than I expected: tasted really ''green''. Ever so slight caramel undertones. Slight acid. Very enjoyable.
Big head, the malt comes through but not over sweet. Slight bitter finish, a keeper
Typical Octoberfest. Aroma is of hay and a little doughy yeast? Starts sweet and fininshes slightly bitter and sweet. The flavor doesn't linger long. The head was thin and also did not last long.
Decent malt/hops blend and quite drinkable for a somewhat complex beer......
Flowers, hay, hops also sweetness coming to my nose. Yellow body with a little fast diminishing head. Nice malty flavor also pears. Light sweet aftertaste. Refreshing and good beer.

Light malt nose - slightly grassy. Yellow-gold color, crystal clear and a decent head. Start is fruity - like apple juice; slightly bitter finish. Long profile. Clean palette and creamy mouth feel. Very well balanced. Kinda complex and sophisticated. Simply well done.

A decent beer offered to the masses at a public event!  Creamy texture with a sweet aroma.  Flavorful, malty in the mouth (perhaps overmalted?)  Some bitterness and unsure aftertastes emerging later on, but overall it worked well.  I had it with a plate of pork, sauerkraut, and German potato salad...a good beer drinking experience in addition to a good beer. (On tap at the Paulaner-sponsored Addison Oktoberfest, TX...plastic cup...wasn't going to pay another five bucks [over and above the four this one cost] for a souvineer glass mug.)
very malty. quite drinkable. nothing remarkable.............................

I was the guy who said "ugh" (see jfishback13's rating).  I hesitate to post this rating because I am sure that something funky happened to this beer.  This cannot be the way the brewery intended the beer to taste.  Besides which, I think that German laws prohibits the addition of dill and vinegar to beer.  I will try a bottle and rerate.  But I wanted to post this here to see if anyone else has had this problem?

Update:  Come now.  What I remember as a terribly rich malty maerzen now tastes thin and finishes grainy like their helles.  Not what it once was.  

Old: 4.1.  This is the big, bumbling, brutish Bavarian bastard.  Not a lot of finesse, but plenty of worty malt and a bit of alcohol.  This beer is simply a great time.

This must have been a bad batch.  I had two sips after the guy who bought it said, "ugh".  That's normally not a good way to be introduced to a beer.  It tasted like vinegar or pickles.  The place I had it takes very good care of their taps, so I don't think that was the problem.  There is no way they would have made a beer taste like this on purpose.
This is a good oktoberfest but it seems to be losing something everytime I try it.  I think I am going to do a oktoberfest battle as soon as someone gets something besides Paulaner in this damn city!
A great all around drinkable beer. Nothing outstanding, but nothing to make me dislike it either.

Watery, straw and somewhat skunky nose.
Pale urine yellow, no carbonation, ok head.
Boring, medium body, watery aftertaste.
smooth and malty, nice aroma. Overall pretty well balanced, but dosen't have a very distinct taste.
Golden coloured. Very malty, soft, big body, smooth but with a stinging late bitterness.
Cooked to the max. Were finished with the Hacker, put the Paulaner labels in the labler. If these two beers are not the same I'll be a monkeys uncle.
Easy to drink, with a mild spiciness in the finish, but no other very exciting flavor.  Not terribly interesting.
Malty aroma with prune. Full bodied. Malty taste with orange, prune and banana.
So I'm not a big Oktoberfest beer fan to begin with.  Spicy, fruity, malty, yesty, little to no hops.  Rather bland but highly drinkable.
yeasty spicy aroma, rich, spicy flavor, almost sour tasting.  Not too bad.  Unfortunately the wrong time of year to be having an Oktoberfest.  I'll have to try again in the fall.
mmmmmmm.  a really good octoberfest, the hop charecter surprised me.  This is one of the few decent beers you can find in Utah so i'll definetly get it again.
a solid oktoberfest but did you expect less from a Munich brewery?..........

Malty aroma and flavor profile.  Nice color and good carbonation.  I would rather be drinking this beer at the opening ceremonies for Oktoberfest than out of a bottle that has sat on a shelf for a few months...good, but could be a lot better.

Bottled:
Pours a golden yellow colour with a mid sized head. Malty biscuit aroma with notes of honey. Dry, grainy flavour with faint notes of salty liquorice.
not as sweet as I expected - still pretty good. Nice appearance.............
Not as much flavor as I had expected but still quite good. Tastes like a light version of Bass Ale.
My first Oktoberfest, so its hard to compare.  Almost no head, which disappeared almost instantly.  Very hard to distinguish aroma.  Sweet, malty flavor.  Not bad, not excellent.
Just a run of the mill octoberfest.  Rather weak hops and malts though. Decent honey aroma.  Quaffable
Nice aroma.  Have a cold so I can't quite place aroma qualities in specific.  Taste a little too alcoholish.  Slight malt presence.
Not as good as the Original Munich Premium..................................

I just recently had Chimay bleu, and the nose of this beer reminds me of it. I can’t say that I like this beer too much, but it is drinkable. Just not my style I guess. Orig rate 2/16/02..2.5. I’m not quite sure what a marzen has to do with a trappist quad, but I was young and prob very drunk upon my first rating. Clear dark amber, nutty and toffee malt aroma. Similar flavors as the aroma. Malt forward clean drinking amber lager.
This beer makes me crave for October and German food.  It is a special brew.

Tested back in 95 - in Berlin - so it might be different now. It was a bit disappointing at the time, even if the tent at Alexanderplatz was big and the music was loud...It was fruity and "spritzig", but it was too short.
Everything a beer should be!  Serve with brats and kraut and have your own Oktoberfest.
This beer makes me wish it was always October.  Great representative of the style.
Oh great, another oktoberfest beer. ........................................

very smooth on the palate. easy going down
nice hoppy taste that stays with you till end
Beautiful, sweet, fruity nose. Great delicate moutfeel with a notably sweet tinge and just beautiful hopping. Hard to call between this and Spaten as Oktoberfest king.
